story:
My name is Erick Villanueva and I am U.S. Army vet that's working towards building mine and my wife's dream of a cafe that we can pass on to our seven children (6 girls and 1 boy). This has been a goal now for about four years. We have all details and plans in place. We've ironed out all the details from product and menus to design and location with city agencies (SBA and city hall), distributors, and financial advisors. Now it's time to fund this dream. With all our children and a mortgage, applying for large loan is out of the question, besides we wouldn't qualify. So now we've chosen to turn to you to help us realize our dream of a coffee house and venue.

Turning Gear Cafe is expected to be Elizabeth City’s newest destination spot for café favorites, tasty desserts, wine and entertainment. With its blend of locals from the “Harbor of Hospitality”, universities, and nearby military bases, Elizabeth City will make a wonderful home for Turning Gear Café and keep our establishment full of culture and diversity. We’ve formulated a business model that at its roots creates a family friendly artistic atmosphere where coffee lovers and aspiring musicians and artists alike can gather to relax, express, and enjoy everything that is our dream. Your taste buds will be tickled by a café beverage or tea selection from around the world along with locally supplied desserts and wines that flow deliciously with your choice entrée.

Turning Gear Café is expected to be open for guests’ enjoyment from 6am to 10pm Mondays through Fridays (later on special occasions), and from 10am to 10pm on Saturdays. Sundays the café will be available to local church organizations to conduct café ministries from 1pm to 6pm(by reservations only).  We are a veteran owned establishment and will offer military and civil service discounts as well as senior citizen discounts. We plan on partnering up with surrounding local vendors to support local businesses through marketing and merchandising. To promote environmental awareness and reduce our carbon footprint we have put into place certain processes and improvements such as the daily donation of coffee grounds and other biologically friendly byproducts for use in compost and gardening. In addition, the use of used furniture, recycled products, energy efficient appliances, and LED lighting are just a few more ideas that not only save us money but also reduce waste. We will work with the local colleges and universities and local health departments on continuous process improvements so that we may take this small business family-owned company from good to great.

Our venues will include nightly themes for example “E. City Soul” and “Turning Gear Unplugged”  will feature local bands playing acoustic numbers and R&B artist on Fridays and Saturdays nights, “Live Poets Society” features classical, urban, and contemporary poets on open mic night which will be either Monday and Wednesday and the occasional 80’s and 90’s movie nights on Tuesdays and Thursdays. There will likely be a minimum 2 dollar cover to help support local artists. We will set up an advertising board where the public will be encouraged to post event flyers, items for sale, wanted ads, and other announcements. Local artists will be given space to display and sell their artwork.  Turning Gear Café will become a destination in which memories, relationships, and businesses can blossom.

Our goal is to be able to collect enough funding to cover full startup cost which includes the appliances, furnishings, licenses & permits  necessary to operate here locally in Elizabeth City, inspections and products, first month’s rent/security deposit and miscellaneous items is $53,000. The extra $18,000 will help with bringing in another employee and covering his or her wages for a few months. Whatever help we receive will be accepted as a blessing. We pray that you can sympathize with our dream and find it in yourselves to support not just a business venture but an opportunity to become part of a culture that bonds a variety of demographics, interests, and forms of artistic expressions… Thank you all, every little bit helps.

story:
Les séjours offerts peuvent être utilisés quand bon vous semble en fonction des disponibilités.
Free  night stays can be used whenever you want, according to Hostel availability. 

English Version Here

NOUS ET LE PROJET:

Nous sommes deux jeunes entrepreneurs récemment diplômés, Adel et Helder. Nous vous proposons un pari fou:

Prouver que nous arriverons à financer notre projet d'auberge de jeunesse dans le centre de Lisbonne sans avoir recours à un prêt bancaire! 

Dans cette auberge nous voulons qu'il y ait tout ce nous aimons: Personnel fun et accueillant, atmosphère amicale, grands espaces partagés, activités communes et animations quotidiennes. 

Je suis moi-même de Lisbonne et Adel de Lille. Nous nous sommes rencontrés durant nos études à Toulouse. A la fin de nos études nous nous sommes rendus compte que nous n'étions pas faits pour être dans un bureau... Nous avons décidé de quitter nos boulots respectifs et lutter pour la vie que nous rêvions dans une ville que nous aimons. 

Lisbonne, est une ville coup de cœur. Les festivals et ambiance conviviale, la proximité des plages, font de Lisbonne une destination de plus en plus prisée des jeunes européens. 


POURQUOI LE CROWDFUNDING:

Au début on a fait la tournée des banques. Un banquier a accepté de nous prêter l'argent pour lancer le projet. Cependant, on s'est rendu compte que pour 100€ prêtés, nous devions en rembourser 135... En somme, pour payer cet emprunt 1/4 de nos revenus annuels partiraient directement à la banque:


Alors nous avons décidé de lancer notre campagne de crowdfunding:

Au lieu de payer des années d'intérêts à la banque, l'argent économisé servira non seulement à financer notre charte d'activité responsable (comme 100% d'énergies renouvelables, investir dans des projets d'économie sociale et solidaire, etc), mais aussi nos engagements envers nos contributeurs (comme les nuits offertes, les 10% de remise à vie, etc). 

Nous croyons à l'économie sociale et solidaire et aux profits raisonnables.

Nos engagements reflètent nos valeurs et le monde que nous voulons construire, même à notre petite échelle. 


COÛTS RÉELS: 

Pour financer tout le projet sans avoir recours au prêt bancaire nous avons besoin d'un million d'euros:

  • Achat de l'immeuble: 600 000€
  • Achat de licences et coûts administratives: 100 000€
  • Restauration de l'immeuble: 300 000 €
  • Coûts inhérents au site de Crowdfunding: 9% du montant levé.
Nous sommes conscients qu'arriver à cette somme est un énorme défi. 
Quoi qu'il arrive, l'Arty Hostel verra le jour, nous avons l'accord de la banque,  mais si on peut éviter un maximum de frais bancaires tout en proposant des super contreparties à nos clients, nous le ferons.

Nous préférons choyer nos clients que donner de l'argent aux banques et entretenir un système que nous ne cautionnons pas. 

Si vous, comme nous, croyez qu'une autre façon de financer vos rêves est possible, participez et partagez ce crowdfunding grâce aux outils Indiegogo! 

Le partage est la seule façon d'atteindre l'objectif que nous nos sommes fixé. Nous comptons sur votre aide et espérons vous voir très prochainement à Arty Hostel.


OUVERTURE PRÉVUE EN AOÛT 2015!

 Aidez nous à rendre notre banquier fou!!!!


English Version

WE AND THE PROJECT:

We are two recently graduated young entrepreneurs, Adel and Helder. We are making you a mad bet: 

Prove that we can fund our hostel in Lisbon’s downtown without a bank loan!

This hostel will be a compilation of everything we love: welcoming and funny staff, a friendly atmosphere, large shared areas, shared activities and a lot of hustle and bustle.

I'm from Lisbon, Portugal and Adel from Lille, France, we met during our studies at Toulouse. At the end of our studies, we both realised that we didn't want to be stuck in an office for the rest of our life... So we quitted ours jobs and decided to live the life we have always dreamed of in a city we both love! 

Lisbon is the kind of city you could fall in love with very easily. There are lots of festivals, a friendly atmosphere and the beaches are really close. As a matter of fact the city has turned to be one of the most popular destinations for young European people.


WHY CROWDFUNDING:

At the beginning we visited some banks. One bank manager accepted to loan us the credit to do the project. But then, we realised that if we borrowed €100, we would have to pay back €135... Meaning that 1/4 of your benefits would go straight to the bank:


So we have decided to launch the crowdfunding:

Instead of paying years of bank interests, the money we could save thanks to your donations will not only be used to fund our commitments (such as 100% renewable energies, investing in other Crowdfunding projects, etc), but also our commitments towards our donators ( such as free overnight stays, 10% life time discount, etc).


We do believe in responsible economy and reasonable profits. 

Our commitments reflect our values and the world we want to live in.


REAL COSTS:

To finance the entire project without a bank loan we need 1 million euros:

  • Purchase of the building: €600,000
  • Purchase of the license, solicitor and administrative costs: €100,000
  • Restoration of the building (we want to help restoring Lisbon): €300,000
  • Cost of the Crowdfunding site: 9% of the total amount of the funds raised

We do realise that reaching this goal it will be very difficult. 

Whatever happens, Arty Hostel will be launched, our bank can loan us the money, but if we can avoid bank charges while giving our customers great offers we will go for it.


In any case, Arty Hostel will see the light of day. It will be much faster and easier thanks to you, and you will enjoy unique advantages!


If you believe that another way to fund your dreams is possible, please share this page thanks to Indiegogo tools! 

Sharing is the best way to reach the goal we target, so we are counting on your help, and we hope to see you in a very near future at ARTY HOSTEL!

PLANNED OPENING ON AUGUST 2015!

And let's drive bankers maaaaad!

Alors nous avons décidé de lancer notre campagne de crowdfunding:
Au lieu de payer des années d'intérêts à la banque, l'argent économisé servira non seulement à financer notre charte d'activité responsable (comme 100% d'énergies renouvelables, investir dans des projets d'économie sociale et solidaire, etc), mais aussi nos engagements envers nos contributeurs (comme les nuits offertes, les 10% de remise à vie, etc). 

Nous croyons à l'économie sociale et solidaire et aux profits raisonnables.
Nos engagements reflètent nos valeurs et le monde que nous voulons construire, même à notre petite échelle. 

COÛTS RÉELS: 
Pour financer tout le projet sans avoir recours au prêt bancaire nous avons besoin d'un million d'euros:


Achat de l'immeuble: 600 000€
Achat de licences et coûts administratives: 100 000€
Restauration de l'immeuble: 300 000 €
Coûts inhérents au site de Crowdfunding: 9% du montant levé.

Nous sommes conscients qu'arriver à cette somme est un énorme défi. 
Quoi qu'il arrive, l'Arty Hostel verra le jour, nous avons l'accord de la banque,  mais si on peut éviter un maximum de frais bancaires tout en proposant des super contreparties à nos clients, nous le ferons.

Nous préférons choyer nos clients que donner de l'argent aux banques et entretenir un système que nous ne cautionnons pas. 

Si vous, comme nous, croyez qu'une autre façon de financer vos rêves est possible, participez et partagez ce crowdfunding grâce aux outils Indiegogo! 
Le partage est la seule façon d'atteindre l'objectif que nous nos sommes fixé. Nous comptons sur votre aide et espérons vous voir très prochainement à Arty Hostel.

OUVERTURE PRÉVUE EN AOÛT 2015!
 Aidez nous à rendre notre banquier fou!!!!







English Version

WE AND THE PROJECT:
We are two recently graduated young entrepreneurs, Adel and Helder. We are making you a mad bet: 
Prove that we can fund our hostel in Lisbon’s downtown without a bank loan!
This hostel will be a compilation of everything we love: welcoming and funny staff, a friendly atmosphere, large shared areas, shared activities and a lot of hustle and bustle.

I'm from Lisbon, Portugal and Adel from Lille, France, we met during our studies at Toulouse. At the end of our studies, we both realised that we didn't want to be stuck in an office for the rest of our life... So we quitted ours jobs and decided to live the life we have always dreamed of in a city we both love! 

Lisbon is the kind of city you could fall in
love with very easily. There are lots of festivals, a friendly atmosphere and the
beaches are really close. As a matter of fact the city has turned to be one of
the most popular destinations for young European people.

WHY CROWDFUNDING:

At the
beginning we visited some banks. One bank manager accepted to loan us the credit to do the project. But then, we realised that if we borrowed €100, we would have to pay
back €135... Meaning that 1/4 of your benefits would go straight to the bank:

So we have decided to launch the crowdfunding:
Instead of paying years of bank interests, the money we could save thanks to your donations will not only be used to fund our commitments (such as 100% renewable energies, investing in other Crowdfunding projects, etc), but also our commitments towards our donators ( such as free overnight stays, 10% life time discount, etc).

We do believe in responsible economy and reasonable profits. 
Our commitments reflect our values and the world we want to live in.

REAL COSTS:
To finance the entire project without a bank loan we need 1 million euros:




Purchase of the building: €600,000


Purchase of the license, solicitor
and administrative costs: €100,000


Restoration of the building (we want
to help restoring Lisbon): €300,000


Cost of the Crowdfunding site: 9% of the total amount of the funds raised



We do realise that reaching this goal it will be very difficult. 
Whatever happens, Arty Hostel will be launched, our bank can loan us the money, but if we can avoid bank charges while giving our customers great offers we will go for it.



In any case, Arty
Hostel will see the light of day. It will be much faster and easier thanks to
you, and you will enjoy unique advantages!

If you believe that another way to fund your dreams is possible, please share this page thanks to Indiegogo tools! 
Sharing is the best way to reach the goal we target, so we are counting on your help, and we hope to see you in a very near future at ARTY HOSTEL!
PLANNED OPENING ON AUGUST 2015!
And let's drive bankers maaaaad!

story:
As the campaign draws to a close we hope that this update clip gives confidence to all who have supported the Project that they have made a differance in this wonderful place in Africa. Nothing is certain here, other than the LORDS Love and Grace for these beautiful people. Thankyou seems so inadequate to express our appreciation to everyone, but thats all we can say, A HUGE THANKYOU from the Team. To anyone that may have decline to support the Project because they may have doubted its veracity, it's not too late to come on board. Cheers & Blessings From Cibitoke, Burundi, Africa


In 2007 Ted Bosveld became aware of the Orphans of Burundi, Central Africa, one of the poorest countries in the world. Ted and his wife, Lorraine founded an NGO, "Villages of Life" and set about providing a home and education for as many of them as they can. In 2013 as part of the team visiting Burundi it was obvious how difficult obtaining adequate basic life needs is for most people.

Today with 32 children, six homes and a vibrant school on the ground in Cibitoke, providing a varied diet is challenging. Fish for Life will greatly assist in the area of good nutrition for the developing minds and bodies of our special children.

The land on which Homes of Hope is built is undulating, porous with a lot of small stones and is not suitable for traditional pond method of fish farming. Using open tanks is a suitable alternative enabling the most efficient use of water. The water will come from a 60,000 litre concrete tank which has been built to capture rainwater run off from the roof of the homes.

The funds raised will provide header tanks, a solar powered pumping system and two banks of fish tanks. Each bank will have its own Vortex and Bio filter. The fish waste collected will be used in the vegetable garden to promote better yields.

Fish for Life will be a blessing for the wider community, work for the local people in the construction phase and be a model enterprise which will be used to train others who want to grow their own fish.

Freddy visited a fish farm whilst in Australia in August 2014

To record the projects development for history, a 10 year TIME CAPSULE will be buried on site after the first fish are harvested. It will contain a Journal of the project which will include a record of the names of all supporters, sponsors, donors, photos and a message to the residents of the future.

We would love you to come on board and journey with us as this beacon of light grows in Central Africa. ALL ABOARD

All donations made within Australia are Tax Deductible. Just email ted@villagesoflife.org with your Indiegogo receipt and adress details and he will get a Tax Reciept to you.

Here are some of our other sustainability projects in Cibitoke.

From Cows, Goats and Rabbits to Sewing and Carpentry. Enjoy

This is why we call it "Homes of Hope"

A big shout out to 2 amazing Launceston businesses who went over and above with product to assist with this Fish Farm.

Tones Electrical for Solar Panels, switches and wiring

And Premium Plumbing for PVC pipes and fittings soon to arrive in the container.

story:
At Fogliasana, our aim is to feed our consumers with produce that is clean, convenient, and has been produced with an efficient use of our natural resources.  (Para leer en español, ver más abajo)

It is important for everyone to know how their food has been produced and where it comes from so they can make sustainable choices. 


Traditional agriculture uses between 50% and 70% of the world´s freshwater sources. 

At Fogliasana, we are committed to a responsible use of our water and have chosen hydroponic crop production which uses between 10% to 20% the amount of water that traditional agriculture consumes. 

FAO Water Withdrawal Infographic

Population increase to 9 billion people by 2050 is driving demand for food... on less farmland!

This is placing pressure on water systems and soil quality and quantity worldwide. We want to provide food choices that are right for consumers and their children and believe that produce is part of a healthy diet. We have chosen green leafy vegetables as our main product. 

"Feeding 9 Billion"

"Inside the looming food crisis".


Your donation will help us accomplish our dream of making our startup hydroponic farm more sustainable.  

Help us finish setting up our new greenhouses with hydroponic irrigation systems, a rainwater capture system and solar panels to generate our own electricity. 


What We Need

The $60,000 that we raise from this campaign will be used as follows: 

Item Cost
Land clearing and setup  $3,765
Materials for 6 greenhouses + NFT  $9,432
Labor for 6 greenhouses +NFT  $7,600
Water filtrations system  $5,501
Solar panels and pump systems  $19,753
Labor for solar panel and pump installations  $5,300
Materials for office and packing room  $3,900
Labor for constructing office and packing room  $1,800
Indiegogo Campaign costs and perks  $3,000
Grand Total  $60,051 

Please donate now! Select a perk on the right, or keep on reading for more details.


How far ahead are we and what do we have?

We began production in November 2014 with the core value of sustainability and currently have one test greenhouse, 6 partially assembled greenhouses, 16 portable locally designed NFT systems, one used delivery truck, and a simple office. We have some customers right now, but we cannot have more customers unless we can produce more vegetables.

We still need to furnish our installations better, by adding a cover to the soil to prevent dust from settling on the plants, and sealing our greenhouses to minimize insects.

As we began production, we opted to purchase a small used KIA K2700 truck for deliveries. 

Our first office space consisted of this empty plastic fertilizer bag.

Now we have a much more decent installation (including decorations for valentine's day). This office will be relocated to our new production site in early June.

This greenhouse is rented.  It is not ideal for hydroponics due to the low height, but we have managed to produce adequately enough in it.

Our propagation bed, right beside our NFT bed number 1.


Setting up our simple hydroponic tanks for the first time.


Our disassembled greenhouses, ready to transport and install in our new location

Our team. From Left to Right: Alain, Jose, Marcelino, Patricia, Zoila, Marleny, Santos, Adriana.

Please donate now! Select a perk on the right, or keep on reading for more details.

Our project was just featured in Guatemala's TV program "Inversión & Desarrollo" ("Development and investment")  see below:

The video is in spanish, to translate, play it, then press the "CC" button, then press the settings button, under "Subtitles/CC" select your preferred language. (Automatically translated)


What You Get

Your donation will help ripple our positive impacts in the community and the country.  As we grow, we will keep you posted vía our Facebook fan page and our website with weekly photos and videos.  You will see how your money is being used to help us reach our dream. We will inform you about our water and energy use as well as our job creation capacity as we expand. You are welcome to visit us anytime!

Our Perks

Perk Amount
Zinc 1 Your name on our food future wall
Iron 5 Personalized PDF Certificate
Chlorine 25 Guatemalan Worry Dolls
Sulfur 50 Guatemalan Typical Bracelets
Phosphorus 100 Mayan Loom belt
Magnesium 250 Handwoven designer wallet or cardholder wallet, by Augusto Castillo
Ca-Mg 300 Free herbs for 1 year
Calcium 500 Necessaire, iPad case or Mini checkbook, by Augusto Castillo
Potassium 1000 Guatemalan embroidered handbag or authentic Jade bracelet, by Augusto Castillo
Nitrogen 2000 Luggage or Jade necklace
Fogliasana Hero 5000 VIP Tour of Antigua. See below for details

Guatemalan Worry Dolls


These dolls will take care of your worries while you sleep if you tell them what they are before bedtime.

Guatemalan Typical Bracelets


Guatemalan typical bracelets, you get one like these by mail with $50.

Mayan Loom belt


Mayan loomed belt. Yours if you help us out with $100.

Handwoven designer wallet or cardholder wallet, by Augusto Castillo



Donate $250 and you get your choice of: Handwoven designer wallet for male and female. Cardholder purse or a pound of one of Guatemala's most sustainable coffee:  El Injerto

Necessaire, iPad case or Mini checkbook, by Augusto Castillo




Authentic Guatemalan embroidery on a necessaire or an iPad case (for iPad mini), yours for a $500 donation.


Guatemalan embroidered handbag or authentic Jade bracelet, by Augusto Castillo 





Our perk for donating $1,000! You can pick either the handbag or the authentic jade bracelet. (For the handbag, you can mention three favorite colors, and pick one of the two styles shown and we will try to fulfill your desire depending on availability. For the bracelet, pick leather based or metal based)


Luggage or Jade necklace



You'll get Augusto Castillo's luxury travel luggage or this certified authentic jade necklace for helping us out with $2,000.


The Hero perk

And last, but not least:

If you donate  $5,000,  you get a VIP tour of Antigua and our project!

What To Do In Antigua Guatemala - The New York Times


Antigua Guatemala

It was the capital of the Captaincy-General of Guatemala in the early 16th century. The city was built on a grid pattern inspired by the italian renaissance, and the buildings continue to exhibit the traditional colonial look of the era. The city was prone to flooding and earthquakes, which prompted many to move the capital to the actual Guatemala City.  Many stayed behind and it was referred to as "La Antigua Guatemala" (The old Guatemala). Today the city is a hotspot for restaurants, hotels, spanish schools and local shops. It is considered a romantic and wedding destination.

One generous donor will get to visit us and stay for three nights in this charming town.  Since we can't offer you air travel according to IndieGogo terms, you'll have to arrange that on your own, to Guatemala's La Aurora Airport, but once you arrive, we will take care of you like a VIP.

DAY 1 - Arrival

  1. We'll pick you up at La Aurora International Airport for your 40 minute drive to Antigua.
  2. Check in to your hotel
  3. Get a relaxing massage at Prana Holistic Center
  4. Overnight at one of trip advisors top 10 hotels in Antigua.
DAY 2 - Visit the farm
  1. Breakfast at your hotel
  2. Day visit (lunch included) to Fogliasana. Tour the facilities that you helped create.
DAY 3 - Tour day
  1. Breakfast at your hotel
  2. Antigua Tour: Discover the secrets of Antigua’s traditional history and art. Admire the colonial architecture of the XVI century churches, buildings, fine arts, terra-cotta ceramics, wooden sculptures and a great variety of traditional weavings. The tour is designed to highlight the city's past and present treasures, OR
  3. Lake Atitlán Tour: With three stunning volcanoes rising out of its emerald surface, Lake Atitlan it´s characterised by its natural beauty surrounded by gorgeous views of the volcanoes and indigenous villages filled with culture. The famous writer Aldous Huxley considered it "the most beautiful lake in the world".

Image by Tucker Sherman - Mango Sunrise, Lake Atitlan
This work falls under the creative commons attribution license v2.0

DAY 4 - Departure day
  1. Breakfast at your hotel.
  2. Your driver will meet you at the lobby of your hotel for your transfer to Guatemala City.

What happens if we don't reach our goal?

If we do not reach our entire goal, the funds will be allocated in the following order:

  1. Greenhouse installation
  2. NFT system installation
  3. Water filtration system
  4. Solar panel and pumping system
  5. Office and packing room
  6. Insurance for staff
  7. Certifications
Our farm will continue to operate, but our growth will not be as fast or steady to keep up with fund needs.

Can't Donate? Please spread the word!

We would really appreciate your help by making a donation. Should you not be able to donate, we ask that you share this with friends, family, coworkers, angel investors, etc.   We appreciate any help we can get.

The video is in spanish, to translate, play it, then press the "CC" button, then press the settings button, under "Subtitles/CC" select your preferred language. (Automatically translated)

Filming, editing and Production: Alain Berger

Inversión y Desarrollo video:   Luis Velasquez and team

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

ESPAÑOL

En Fogliasana, nuestro objetivo es alimentar a nuestros consumidores con productos limpios, convenientes y que han sido cultivados con un uso eficiente de nuestros recursos naturales.

Para todos y cada uno de nosotros es importante saber como se ha producido su comida y de donde viene para poder tomar decisiones sostenibles.


La agricultura tradicional utiliza entre 50% y 70% de las fuentes de agua fresca del mundo. 

En Fogliasana, estamos comprometidos a utilizar responsablemente el agua, y por eso hemos elegido la producción hidropónica, la cual utiliza entre 10% y 20% de la cantidad de agua que normalmente se utilizaría con métodos tradicionales.

Infográfica de la FAO sobre uso del agua fresca

El crecimiento poblacional hacia 9 millardos de personas para el año 2050 esta impactando la demanda por alimentos frescos... en menos espacio para sembrar!

Esto esta presionando los sistemas acuíferos del planeta, así como la calidad y cantidad de suelo disponible. Queremos proveer opciones de alimentos que sean adecuados para nuestros clientes y sus hijos, y creemos que los vegetales y las frutas son parte importante de una dieta saludable. Hemos elegido vegetales de hoja verde como nuestro producto principal.

"Alimentando 9 Millardos (Artículo de la National Geographic en inglés)"

"Dentro de la crisis alimentaria".


Tu donación nos ayudara a cumplir nuestro sueño de hacer nuestra finca hidropónica un modelo de sustentabilidad.  

Ayudanos a terminar nuestros nuevos invernaderos con sistemas hidropónicos, un sistema de captura de agua de lluvia, y paneles solares con sistemas de almacenamiento para generar nuestra propia electricidad. 

Que necesitamos

Los $60,000 que logremos recaudar serán utilizados de la siguiente manera: 

Descripción Costo
Limpieza del terreno  $3,765
Materiales para 6 invernaderos + NFT  $9,432
Mano de obra para 6 invernaderos +NFT  $7,600
Sistemas de filtración de agua  $5,501
Paneles solares y equipo de bombeo  $19,753
Mano de obra de paneles solares  $5,300
Materiales de oficina y cuarto de empaque  $3,900
Mano de obra oficina y cuarto de empaque  $1,800
Costos de campaña IndieGogo  $3,000
Total  $60,051 

Por favor haz tu donación ahora!! Selecciona una recompensa o sigue leyendo abajo para mas detalles.


Cuanto hemos avanzado y que tenemos?

Iniciamos producción en noviembre de 2014 con el valor fundamental de la sostenibilidad y actualmente tenemos un invernadero de prueba. 6 invernaderos parcialmente ensamblados, 16 sistemas NFT (agua en tubo donde crecen las plantas), un camión de entregas y una oficina sencilla. Ya tenemos clientes, pero no podemos tener más clientes al menos que podamos producir mas vegetales.

Todavía tenemos que mejorar nuestras instalaciones, proporcionando un cobertor del suelo para prevenir que el polvo caiga en las plantas, y sellando nuestros invernaderos para evitar insectos al máximo.

Conforme fuimos incrementando producción, optamos por la compra de un camion pequeño marca KIA K2700 para entregas. 

Nuestra primer oficina consistió en esta bolsa usada de que contenía fertilizante. (Costal)

Ahora tenemos una instalación mucho mas decente (incluyendo las decoraciones del día de San Valentín). Esta oficina será re-ubicada a nuestro nuevo sitio de producción en Junio.  (en estos momentos ya estamos trasladándonos)

Este invernadero es alquilado.  No es ideal para cultivo hidropónico debido al pequeño tamaño.  Pero podemos producir adecuadamente para mientras.

Nuestra cama de propagación,  justo al lado de nuestra cama de hidropónicos #1

Arrancando nuestro tanque hidropónico por primera vez. 


Nuestros invernaderos sin ensamblaje, listos para transportar e instalar en nuestra nueva ubicación.

Nuestro equipo. De izquierda a derecha: Alain, Jose, Marcelino, Patricia, Zoila, Marleny, Santos, Adriana.

Porfavor haz tu donación ahora! Selecciona una recompensa en la derecha, o sigue leyendo abajo para más detalles.

Nuestro proyecto salió entrevistado en el programa "Inversión & Desarrollo" Puedes verlo aquí:

Que obtienes a cambio

Tu donación tendrá un efecto que se sentirá primero en la comunidad y eventualmente en el país. Conforme crecemos, te mantendremos informados vía nuestra página de Facebook y nuestro sitio web con fotos y videos semanales. Verás como se utilizan los fondos para alcanzar lo propuesto acá. Te informaremos sobre nuestro uso de energía y de agua, así como nuestra capacidad de creación de puestos de trabajo conforme expandemos. Estas bienvenido a visitarnos en cualquier momento!

Nuestras Recompensas

Recompensa Cantidad
Zinc 1 Tu nombre en nuestra pared de alimentos innovadores
Hierro 5 Certificado PDF Personalizado
Cloro 25 Muñeco quitapenas

Calcio 500 Necessaire, Cobertor de iPad o Mini chequera, por Augusto Castillo
Potasio 1000 Bolsa típica de Guatemala o brazalete de jade por Augusto Castillo
Nitrógeno 2000 Maleta de viaje o collar de jade
Héroe Fogliasana 5000 Tour VIP de Antigua. Ver abajo para detalles.

Muñecos Quitapenas


Estos muñecos se encargarán de tus preocupaciones al contárselas mientras duermes.

Pulseras Típicas de Guatemala


Pulseras típicas de Guatemala, obtienes una de estas por correo si nos donas $50.

Cincho típico de Guatemala


Cincho típico. Tuyo si nos ayudas con $100.

Billetera o tarjetera con diseño típico, por Augusto Castillo



Dona $250 y obtienes tu elección de: Billetera para hombre o mujer.  También te damos un portatarjeta o una libra del café más sostenible de Guatemala:  El Injerto.

Necessaire, Cobertor de iPad o Mini chequera, por Augusto Castillo




Tejido auténtico de Guatemala en un necessaire o un cobertor de iPad.  También puedes optar por una mini-chequera, tuyos por una donación de $500.


Bolsa típica de Guatemala o brazalete de jade por Augusto Castillo





Nuestra recompensa por donar $1,000!  Puedes escoger la bolsa con tejido típico o la pulsera de jade. (Para la bolsa, puedes mencionar tres colores favoritos, y escoger uno de los dos estilos que mostramos para complacerte, dependiendo d ela disponibilidad. Para la pulsera, escoge una con cuero o metal.)


Maleta de viaje o collar de jade



Si nos ayudas con $2,000 obtienes una maleta de viaje de Augusto Castillo, o este collar auténtico y certificado de jade. 


La recompensa de héroe

Y finalmente:

Si donas $5,000,  obtienes un tour VIP de la Antigua y nuestro proyecto!

Que hacer con 36 horas en Antigua Guatemala - The New York Times


Antigua Guatemala

Fue la capital de la Capitanía general de Guatemala a inicios del siglo 16. La ciudad fue construida en un patrón cuadriculado inspirado por el renacimiento italiano, y los edificios continuan exhibiendo su origen colonial. La ciudad solía inundarse mucho y sufría de terremotos con frecuencia, lo cual estimuló a varios a pasarse a la capital actual. Muchos se quedaron atras y se renombró "Antigua Guatemala" (The old Guatemala). La ciudad es hoy un centro popular para restaurantes, hoteles, academias de español, y tiendas locales. Se le considera un destino romántico para parejas y bodas.

Un donante generoso (o más!) pueden visitar nuestro proyecto por un día y poder alojarse en esta fantástica ciudad colonial. Como  no te podemos ofrecer viajes aéreos de acuerdo con los términos y condiciones de IndieGogo, tendrás que encargarte tu de esto, llegando al Aeropuerto La Aurora en la Ciudad de Guatemala, perio media vez llegues, te trataremos como un VIP.

Si vives en Guatemala, podemos platicar sobre alternativas en el plan

Día 1 - Arribo

  1. Te recogemos en el aeropuerto Internacional La Aurora para tu viaje en auto de 40 minutos a la Antigua.
  2. Check in en el hotel
  3. Obtén un relajante masaje en Prana Holistic Center
  4. Duerme en alguno de los hoteles top 10 de Antigua.
DIA 2 - Visita la finca
  1. Desayuna en la finca
  2. Visita de día (almuerzo incluido) a Fogliasana. Tour de la finca que has ayudado a crear.
DIA 3 - Tour day
  1. Breakfast at your hotel
  2. Antigua Tour: Discover the secrets of Antigua’s traditional history and art. Admire the colonial architecture of the XVI century churches, buildings, fine arts, terra-cotta ceramics, wooden sculptures and a great variety of traditional weavings. The tour is designed to highlight the city's past and present treasures, OR
  3. Lake Atitlán Tour: With three stunning volcanoes rising out of its emerald surface, Lake Atitlan it´s characterised by its natural beauty surrounded by gorgeous views of the volcanoes and indigenous villages filled with culture. The famous writer Aldous Huxley considered it "the most beautiful lake in the world".

Imagen por Tucker Sherman - Mango Sunrise, Lake Atitlan
Esta foto se utiliza bajo la licencia de atribución de Creative Commons v2.0
DAY 4 - Salida
  1. Breakfast at your hotel.
  2. Your driver will meet you at the lobby of your hotel for your transfer to Guatemala City.

Que pasa si no llegamos a la meta?

Nuestra empresa continuará operaciones, pero nos será muy difícil crecer para poder generar mas empleo y mantener la empresa funcionando.

Si no alcanzamos la meta, los fondos se asignarán el siguiente orden:

  1. Instalación de invernaderos
  2. Instalación de sistemas hidropónicos de cultivo
  3. Sistemas para filtrar el agua
  4. Paneles solares y sistemas de bombeo
  5. Oficina y cuarto de empaque
  6. Seguros
  7. Certificaciones

No puedes Donar? Ayúdanos a compartir en redes sociales!

Realmente apreciamos tu apoyo!  Porfavor dona por lo menos $1, no toma mas de 5 minutos de tu tiempo. Si no te es posible donar, te pedimos que compartas esto con tus amigos, familia, compañeros de trabajo, inversionistas!  Apreciamos toda la ayuda que nos puedas dar!

Inversión y Desarrollo: Luis Velasquez y equipo
story_txt:
At Fogliasana, our aim is to feed our consumers with produce that is clean, convenient, and has been produced with an efficient use of our natural resources.  (Para leer en español, ver más abajo)It is important for everyone to know how their food has been produced and where it comes from so they can make sustainable choices. 


Traditional agriculture uses between 50% and 70% of the world´s freshwater sources. 

At Fogliasana, we are committed to a responsible use of our water and have chosen hydroponic crop production which uses between 10% to 20% the amount of water that traditional agriculture consumes. FAO Water Withdrawal InfographicPopulation increase to 9 billion people by 2050 is driving demand for food... on less farmland!This is placing pressure on water systems and soil quality and quantity worldwide. We want to provide food choices that are right for consumers and their children and believe that produce is part of a healthy diet. We have chosen green leafy vegetables as our main product. "Feeding 9 Billion""Inside the looming food crisis".
Your donation will help us accomplish our dream of making our startup hydroponic farm more sustainable.  
Help us finish setting up our new greenhouses with hydroponic irrigation systems, a rainwater capture system and solar panels to generate our own electricity. 

What We Need

The $60,000 that we raise from this campaign will be used as follows: 


Item
Cost


Land clearing and setup
 $3,765


Materials for 6 greenhouses + NFT
 $9,432


Labor for 6 greenhouses +NFT
 $7,600


Water filtrations system
 $5,501


Solar panels and pump systems
 $19,753


Labor for solar panel and pump installations
 $5,300


Materials for office and packing room
 $3,900


Labor for constructing office and packing room
 $1,800


Indiegogo Campaign costs and perks
 $3,000


Grand Total
 $60,051 


Please donate now! Select a perk on the right, or keep on reading for more details.

How far ahead are we and what do we have?


We began production in November 2014 with the core value of sustainability and currently have one test greenhouse, 6 partially assembled greenhouses, 16 portable locally designed NFT systems, one used delivery truck, and a simple office. We have some customers right now, but we cannot have more customers unless we can produce more vegetables.


We still need to furnish our installations better, by adding a cover to the soil to prevent dust from settling on the plants, and sealing our greenhouses to minimize insects.

As we began production, we opted to purchase a small used KIA K2700 truck for deliveries. 

Our first office space consisted of this empty plastic fertilizer bag.

Now we have a much more decent installation (including decorations for valentine's day). This office will be relocated to our new production site in early June.

This greenhouse is rented.  It is not ideal for hydroponics due to the low height, but we have managed to produce adequately enough in it.
Our propagation bed, right beside our NFT bed number 1.

Setting up our simple hydroponic tanks for the first time.


Our disassembled greenhouses, ready to transport and install in our new location
Our team. From Left to Right: Alain, Jose, Marcelino, Patricia, Zoila, Marleny, Santos, Adriana.
Please donate now! Select a perk on the right, or keep on reading for more details.


Our project was just featured in Guatemala's TV program "Inversión & Desarrollo" ("Development and investment")  see below:

The video is in spanish, to translate, play it, then press the "CC" button, then press the settings button, under "Subtitles/CC" select your preferred language. (Automatically translated)


What You Get
Your donation will help ripple our positive impacts in the community and the country.  As we grow, we will keep you posted vía our Facebook fan page and our website with weekly photos and videos.  You will see how your money is being used to help us reach our dream. We will inform you about our water and energy use as well as our job creation capacity as we expand. You are welcome to visit us anytime!

What To Do In Antigua Guatemala - The New York Times


Antigua Guatemala
It was the capital of the Captaincy-General of Guatemala in the early
16th century. The city was built on a grid pattern inspired by the italian
renaissance, and the buildings continue to exhibit the traditional colonial
look of the era. The city was prone to flooding and earthquakes, which prompted
many to move the capital to the actual Guatemala City.  Many stayed behind and it was referred to as
"La Antigua Guatemala" (The old Guatemala). Today the city is a
hotspot for restaurants, hotels, spanish schools and local shops. It is
considered a romantic and wedding destination.
One generous donor will get to visit us and stay for three nights in this charming town.  Since we can't offer you air travel according to IndieGogo terms, you'll have to arrange that on your own, to Guatemala's La Aurora Airport, but once you arrive, we will take care of you like a VIP.
DAY 1 - Arrival

We'll pick you up at La Aurora International Airport for your 40 minute drive to Antigua.
Check in to your hotel
Get a relaxing massage at Prana Holistic Center

Overnight at one of trip advisors top 10 hotels in Antigua.

DAY 2 - Visit the farm

Breakfast at your hotel
Day visit (lunch included) to Fogliasana. Tour the facilities that you helped create.

DAY 3 - Tour day

Breakfast at your hotel
Antigua Tour: Discover the secrets of Antigua’s
traditional history and art. Admire the colonial architecture of the XVI century
churches, buildings, fine arts, terra-cotta ceramics, wooden sculptures and a great
variety of traditional weavings. The tour is designed to highlight the city's past and
present treasures, OR
Lake Atitlán Tour: With three stunning volcanoes rising out of its emerald surface, Lake
Atitlan it´s characterised by its natural beauty surrounded by gorgeous views of the
volcanoes and indigenous villages filled with culture. The famous writer Aldous
Huxley considered it "the most beautiful lake in the world".



Image by Tucker Sherman - Mango Sunrise, Lake AtitlanThis work falls under the creative commons attribution license v2.0


DAY 4 - Departure day

Breakfast at your hotel.
Your driver will meet you at the lobby of your
hotel for your transfer to Guatemala City.

we do not reach our entire goal, the funds will be allocated in the following order:

     panel and pumping system

     and packing room

Our farm will continue to operate, but our growth will not be as fast or steady to keep up with fund needs.


Can't Donate? Please spread the word!
We would really appreciate your help by making a donation. Should you not be able to donate, we ask that you share this with friends, family, coworkers, angel investors, etc.   We appreciate any help we can get.

ESPAÑOL
En Fogliasana, nuestro objetivo es alimentar a nuestros consumidores con productos limpios, convenientes y que han sido cultivados con un uso eficiente de nuestros recursos naturales.Para todos y cada uno de nosotros es importante saber como se ha producido su comida y de donde viene para poder tomar decisiones sostenibles.
La agricultura tradicional utiliza entre 50% y 70% de las fuentes de agua fresca del mundo. 

En Fogliasana, estamos comprometidos a utilizar responsablemente el agua, y por eso hemos elegido la producción hidropónica, la cual utiliza entre 10% y 20% de la cantidad de agua que normalmente se utilizaría con métodos tradicionales. Infográfica de la FAO sobre uso del agua frescaEl crecimiento poblacional hacia 9 millardos de personas para el año 2050 esta impactando la demanda por alimentos frescos... en menos espacio para sembrar!Esto esta presionando los sistemas acuíferos del planeta, así como la calidad y cantidad de suelo disponible. Queremos proveer opciones de alimentos que sean adecuados para nuestros clientes y sus hijos, y creemos que los vegetales y las frutas son parte importante de una dieta saludable. Hemos elegido vegetales de hoja verde como nuestro producto principal."Alimentando 9 Millardos (Artículo de la National Geographic en inglés)""Dentro de la crisis alimentaria".
Tu donación nos ayudara a cumplir nuestro sueño de hacer nuestra finca hidropónica un modelo de sustentabilidad.  
Ayudanos a terminar nuestros nuevos invernaderos con sistemas hidropónicos, un sistema de captura de agua de lluvia, y paneles solares con sistemas de almacenamiento para generar nuestra propia electricidad. 
Que necesitamos

Los $60,000 que logremos recaudar serán utilizados de la siguiente manera:

Por favor haz tu donación ahora!! Selecciona una recompensa o sigue leyendo abajo para mas detalles.

Cuanto hemos avanzado y que tenemos?


Iniciamos producción en noviembre de 2014 con el valor fundamental de la sostenibilidad y actualmente tenemos un invernadero de prueba. 6 invernaderos parcialmente ensamblados, 16 sistemas NFT (agua en tubo donde crecen las plantas), un camión de entregas y una oficina sencilla. Ya tenemos clientes, pero no podemos tener más clientes al menos que podamos producir mas vegetales.


Todavía tenemos que mejorar nuestras instalaciones, proporcionando un cobertor del suelo para prevenir que el polvo caiga en las plantas, y sellando nuestros invernaderos para evitar insectos al máximo.

Conforme fuimos incrementando producción, optamos por la compra de un camion pequeño marca KIA K2700 para entregas. 

Nuestra primer oficina consistió en esta bolsa usada de que contenía fertilizante. (Costal)

Ahora tenemos una instalación mucho mas decente (incluyendo las decoraciones del día de San Valentín). Esta oficina será re-ubicada a nuestro nuevo sitio de producción en Junio.  (en estos momentos ya estamos trasladándonos)

Este invernadero es alquilado.  No es ideal para cultivo hidropónico debido al pequeño tamaño.  Pero podemos producir adecuadamente para mientras.
Nuestra cama de propagación,  justo al lado de nuestra cama de hidropónicos #1


Arrancando nuestro tanque hidropónico por primera vez. 


Nuestros invernaderos sin ensamblaje, listos para transportar e instalar en nuestra nueva ubicación.

Porfavor haz tu donación ahora! Selecciona una recompensa en la derecha, o sigue leyendo abajo para más detalles.

Nuestro proyecto salió entrevistado en el programa "Inversión & Desarrollo" Puedes verlo aquí:


Que obtienes a cambio
Tu donación tendrá un efecto que se sentirá primero en la comunidad y eventualmente en el país. Conforme crecemos, te mantendremos informados vía nuestra página de Facebook y nuestro sitio web con fotos y videos semanales. Verás como se utilizan los fondos para alcanzar lo propuesto acá. Te informaremos sobre nuestro uso de energía y de agua, así como nuestra capacidad de creación de puestos de trabajo conforme expandemos. Estas bienvenido a visitarnos en cualquier momento!

Que hacer con 36 horas en Antigua Guatemala - The New York Times


Antigua Guatemala
Fue la capital de la Capitanía general de Guatemala a inicios del siglo 16. La ciudad fue construida en un patrón cuadriculado inspirado por el renacimiento italiano, y los edificios continuan exhibiendo su origen colonial. La ciudad solía inundarse mucho y sufría de terremotos con frecuencia, lo cual estimuló a varios a pasarse a la capital actual. Muchos se quedaron atras y se renombró "Antigua Guatemala" (The old Guatemala). La ciudad es hoy un centro popular para restaurantes, hoteles, academias de español, y tiendas locales. Se le considera un destino romántico para parejas y bodas.
Un donante generoso (o más!) pueden visitar nuestro proyecto por un día y poder alojarse en esta fantástica ciudad colonial. Como  no te podemos ofrecer viajes aéreos de acuerdo con los términos y condiciones de IndieGogo, tendrás que encargarte tu de esto, llegando al Aeropuerto La Aurora en la Ciudad de Guatemala, perio media vez llegues, te trataremos como un VIP.
Si vives en Guatemala, podemos platicar sobre alternativas en el plan

Te recogemos en el aeropuerto Internacional La Aurora para tu viaje en auto de 40 minutos a la Antigua.

churches, buildings, fine arts, terra-cotta ceramics, wooden sculptures and a great
variety of traditional weavings. The tour is designed to highlight the city's past and
present treasures, OR
Lake Atitlán Tour: With three stunning volcanoes rising out of its emerald surface, Lake
Atitlan it´s characterised by its natural beauty surrounded by gorgeous views of the
volcanoes and indigenous villages filled with culture. The famous writer Aldous
Huxley considered it "the most beautiful lake in the world".

hotel for your transfer to Guatemala City.



Que pasa si no llegamos a la meta?




Nuestra empresa continuará operaciones, pero nos será muy difícil crecer para poder generar mas empleo y mantener la empresa funcionando.
Si no alcanzamos la meta, los fondos se asignarán el siguiente orden:

story:
INTRODUCTION

The personal computer was created to make ALL of our lives easier. Everyday tasks such as letter writing, budgeting and financials, information research, and shopping have been made easier by the personal computer.

In the same manner, the Internet was developed for the “free exchange of ideas, information and knowledge". The Internet has ever simplified our lives by its ability to connect users to like-minded people, communities, shopping, and information that is used to inform, enhance and entertain us.

But for some members of our community, this is not the case. They cannot afford a computer or the Internet connection to be competitive within their community, the classroom, or at work. That’s where we come in. We are Americorps/CTEP (Community Technology Empowerment Project) and our project is “Narrowing the Digital Divide”. We are advocates for Digital Inclusion (EVERYONE should have access to computers and the Internet) and we are instructors of Digital Literacy Skills. We believe that no one should have to rely on time-limited access in public locations (like libraries).

PROJECT GOAL

Our goal is to help 100 families purchase computers and Internet access. To get the equipment, we are working with a local organization called PCs for People (www.pcsforpeople.com). PCs for People, a Microsoft Certified Refurbisher,  refurbishes 3-5 year-old computer systems that are donated by private citizens, local businesses, and local, county and state government agencies. The typical cost for one of these desktop systems (computer, monitor, keyboard, and mouse) is $80. For an additional $60, people can purchase an Internet modem and 3 months of high-speed internet. After the initial 3 months, Internet access can be purchased at 3, 6 , or 12 months intervals at an affordable rate. Only the individuals and families that meet the income and/or assistance guidelines set by PCs for People will be eligible for our project.

FACTS AND FIGURES

The following summary is from the 2014 City of Minneapolis Community Technology Survey. Although it is Minneapolis, it is representative of the Twin Cities Area. For the complete report, click here.

  • Digital equity is a component of equity in Minneapolis: The data on access and use of technology points to a digital equity gap along the lines of income, race, age and education.
  • Overall 15% of households do not have a computer with Internet access at home, which translates into 24,750 households in Minneapolis.
  • Only 6% of whites don’t have any Internet access at home, compared to 24% of African Americans and 10% of other races/multiracial or Hispanic respondents. While there is less variation based on preferred language for respondents with computers and smartphones, 90% of whites have computes with Internet at home compared to 66% of African Americans and 81% of other races or Hispanic.
  • Income: Respondents earning $50,000 a year or more were significantly more likely to own a desktop computer, tablet, cell phone and game console with Internet access.
  • Education: Those with a high school education or less felt that access to a computer and Internet at home was less important compared to their counterparts. Residents with more education were more likely to own computers, tablets and cell phones with Internet access, were more comfortable using these devices, and tended to use the Internet for activities such as emailing, attending online classes and communicating with government.


THE REASON FOR RECYCLING

According to the EPA, in 2009 the United States alone discarded 2.37 million tons in televisions, computers, cell phones, and assorted electronic accessories. Devices that are improperly disposed of are capable of threats to both human and environmental health, due to the hazardous effects of lead, nickel, cadmium, mercury, and other materials found in electronic products. Through our Project, we hope to increase awareness of how hazardous electronic waste is, while lessening waste in the communities we serve, by hosting recycling events in conjunction with our computer purchase project.  In this video, The Digital Dump: Exporting Re-use and Abuse to Africa, we are shown where most of the unwanted electronic material is disposed of. Through our recycling events, we are keeping material from landfills (or worse), and are being good stewards of the environment.

WHY WE ARE FUNDRAISING

To help our families with the cost of purchasing computers and Internet access, we are raising funds through 1) this Indiegogo funding site, and 2) by hosting community-wide recycling events that will keep no longer wanted electronics equipment out of landfills (see below).

WE NEED YOUR HELP

We are asking for your support, either through a financial contribution or your recycled materials, for our project. Your help will enrich the lives of our community members who will benefit greatly from increased technology access, and help us narrow the "digital divide". 

THANK YOU

Devices that are improperly disposed of are capable of threats to both human and environmental health, due to the hazardous effects of lead, nickel, cadmium, mercury, and other materials found in electronic products. Through our Project, we hope to increase awareness of how hazardous electronic waste is, while lessening waste in the communities we serve, by hosting recycling events in conjunction with our computer purchase project.  In this video, The Digital Dump: Exporting Re-use and Abuse to Africa,
 we are shown where most of the unwanted electronic material is disposed of. Through 
our recycling events, we are keeping material from landfills (or worse),
 and are being good stewards of the environment.WHY WE ARE FUNDRAISINGTo help our families with the cost of purchasing computers and Internet access, we are raising funds through 1) this Indiegogo funding site, and 2) by hosting community-wide recycling events that will keep no longer wanted electronics equipment out of landfills (see below).WE NEED YOUR HELPWe are 
asking for your support, either through a financial contribution or your
 recycled materials, for our project. Your help will enrich the lives of 
our community members who will benefit 
greatly from increased technology access, and help us narrow the "digital 
divide".  THANK YOU

story:
We are building a new bike ped bridge over the Winooski River
in East Montpelier, Vermont. You can help!

The bridge and 2.75 miles of new universally accessible trail to go with it will make a safe alternative to a busy highway - giving people of all ages and abilities the chance to walk or bike to work, to school, for health, and to explore nature.

90% of the funding needed has been committed - as challenge grants - which need to be matched by donations from actual real individual people, like you! This indiegogo campaign is an important step towards crossing the finish line and getting this bridge and trail built.


The Story

The Cross Vermont Trail will be a new trail running East to West across North-Central Vermont - a 90 mile path connecting towns across the state from Lake Champlain to the Connecticut River. 

We, the Cross Vermont Trail Association, are a nonprofit, volunteer driven organization that has been working hard to make this trail a reality. So far 30 miles are built and open to the public.

 Our vision is to be safe and family-friendly.  We are working to create alternatives to state roads like US Route 2, a high speed road with lots of truck traffic.  The single largest obstacle in the way of the vision is the Winooski River. A bridge over the Winooski River will allow us to open up miles of off-road trail parallel to Route 2 that commuters, families, and people of all ages will enjoy. 

Help us build the keystone piece of the Cross Vermont Trail.

It's going to cost $1.6 million. That's crazy, but the good news is, amazingly, we have already secured over $1.4 million of grants together with small local donations to build the bridge over the Winooski and 2.75 miles of new, universally accessible trails joining together the growing region wide path network. Now we just need a final push to fully fund the bridge. If you agree with the idea of a safe off road trail network, useable by all, complete and connected - for commuting, play and exploration, please pledge.

Engineering plans for the new bridge


How We Normally Work

Imagine: a multi-use, four-season off-road trail across the width of Vermont following the Winooski River & Wells River valleys, a 90 mile greenway for cyclists, skiers and walkers connecting communities, their schools, and the natural areas between. This vision has steadily moved toward reality through the quiet work of the Cross Vermont Trail Association.

The Cross Vermont Trail Association, formed in 1999, is an incorporated, private non-profit organization that is member-based and volunteer-driven. With part-time staff and donated office space, we are large enough to get things done, but small enough so that most of our funding goes directly into building new trails.  We form partnerships with community organizations across the state to develop and expand local trails. Already 30 miles of Cross Vermont Trail are signed and open to the public. These 30 miles are complemented by our 60 miles of “on-road” route signs that identify the best roads people can use to link together existing trail sections. Meanwhile, we continue to work towards the ultimate goal of connecting all local trails into a continuous, statewide, off-road network. How have we been building this trail? We use common sense, hand tools, and volunteers. We work with willing landowners to plan the best route for new sections of off-road trail.

In time, we believe nearly all of the statewide route will be completed in this moderately scaled, incremental way. However, we currently face a challenge to complete a keystone piece of the trail by making an investment on a much larger scale.

Our Challenge Now

We have secured nearly $1.3 million in federal funds for the construction of the bridge and 2.75 miles of new, universally accessible trails. However; we cannot access these funds until we collect the final amount needed to cover all of the costs.

We've raised 90% of the total project cost already, but still need  $171,900 to "challenge match" these large donations and pay for the bridge connecting the East and West sides of the trail.

We are pursuing many avenues for fundraising - ranging from bake sales (I kid you not) to Federal Highway grants - it all adds together. Our goal of at least $10,000 raised on Indiegogo will be a critical piece of the campaign to get this trail open.

Summary of costs


The new trail bridge will help join together a growing area wide trail network, including a direct connection to the regional middle and high school.


Project location


The Impact

Reaching our goal will create long-lasting value for families throughout Vermont, and help us expand the trail network to all community members. We provide communities along the Cross Vermont Trail and visitors to the area with:

  • Family friendly recreation for people of all ages and abilities
  • Safe travel to school and work for non-motorized commuters
  • Convenient location for daily exercise and healthy outdoor activity
  • A permanent greenway for easy local access to the natural world
The Cross Vermont Association is an incorporated non-profit organization. We exist to assist municipalities, recreation groups, and landowners in the creation and management of a four-season, multi-use trail across the state of Vermont for public recreation, alternative transportation, and awareness of our natural and cultural heritage.


Risks & Challenges

Laying the plans for the 200 foot bridge.

This project has benefited from decades of discussion and dreaming, and from years of careful planning. We have worked closely with landowners and environmental regulators to make a sustainable, useful and beautiful design. Engineering blueprints are being finalized. 

If it were just a matter of elbow grease, we'd be out there right now making it happen. But there is no way around the fact that this one is going to cost money - because of the need for heavily engineered and professionally built structures "threading the needle" between a busy highway, a broad river, and steep valley walls. The metal alone in the bridge will cost well over $100,000.

The good news is we have secured 90% of the funding needed - but these are mostly challenge grants which need to be matched by local or non-government donations in order to be released and used to build the trail.  Your donation will make a real difference.

Over the past 15 years our experienced trail building staff and committed volunteer members have helped to create and care for many miles of new trail. Our accomplishments have ranged in size from teaching a first grade class to restore native plants along an eroded river all the way up to administering the 1/2 million dollar construction of a new trail underpass beneath an interstate highway. Now we are capable, ready and fired up to be carrying out our biggest project ever.
The only thing standing in the way is this final fundraising hurdle.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you just can't contribute, but you can still help us raise awareness about the campaign by following us on Facebook and Twitter and sharing our story with your network. The Cross Vermont Trail is built on your support. Please use the Indiegogo share tools to share the campaign. 

We always welcome volunteers to help us build and improve the Cross Vermont Trail network. New to trail building? We teach! Or, are you already experienced? We've got spots you can take the lead on, and give them your own stamp.

Please let us know if you would like to get involved with the Cross Vermont Trail Association or if you'd like see more and better trails in your community.

Thank you so much and happy trails!

story:
How It All Began

Three years ago, Roberto Catanuso, General Manager and Mounir Elhilali, Executive Chef, combined culinary experiences to launch a crêperie food truck serving made-from-scratch, savory and sweet, authentic French crêpes. The Crêpes Parfait team prides itself on being environmentally responsible— our crêpes are made daily, using only all-natural and organic (whenever possible) ingredients and ONLY serve products using recyclable and biodegradable paper and plastic products. The use of Styrofoam (technically known as polystyrene foam) is strictly prohibited.



We set our Crêpes Parfait food truck journey on the streets of DC, visiting a different location each day. Though our food truck is only operated on a part time basis (Monday – Friday, during lunch), it has achieved notable recognition by the food truck industry. We were selected to participate in several DC special events, including the Presidential Inauguration Parade and numerous French themed events including, “Day of La Bastille.” Crêpes Parfait has won awards for Dessert Chef of the Year (2014), Chef Battle (2014), and the Golden Spatula (2015) for the unique design of our truck and we continue to receive raving reviews on websites such as Yelp , Twitter and Facebook.



Several of our clients have requested additional operation hours and the opening of a brick and mortar crêperie. Unfortunately, due to our boundaries in space and usage time in the shared commercial kitchen that we currently rent, our production capabilities are limited. We rely on one food truck to service, one location at a time. Our goal is to: 1- Move into a larger commercial kitchen that is equipped with adequate appliances and 2- Launch a second Crêpes Parfait food truck so we can expand our service.

In order to grow our business and oblige the demands of our clientele, we need your help raising capital!


What We Need & What You Get

With $50,000, Crêpes Parfait will be afforded the opportunity to expand to the next phase of our business model. This phase includes securing a full-time lease on a commercial kitchen, remodel the kitchen to fit our production needs, equipping it with appliances such as convection ovens, dough mixers, 12 range professional stove, ice maker, reach in refrigerators, a walk-in refrigerator and remodeling, equipping and licensing the second (recently purchased) Crêpes Parfait food truck.

As a thank you to all of our supporters, we have prepared a variety of perks, ranging from our "Mon Cheri" pin (we call our logo Mon Cheri), gift certificates, crêpes and drinks, to the ultimate package which includes a catered, 7 course, tasting dinner, paired with wine – all, prepared by Chef Mounir showcasing his professional training and creative culinary background.



The Impact of Your Help

When we started our crêperie on wheels, our vision was to grow and become a major brand in the fast-casual dining scene. Since Crêpes Parfait’s inception, we have been perfecting our product and overall concept to ensure our ability to duplicate and grow. 

Three years have passed and the Crêpes Parfait brand is ready for the next phase.  Your support and the funding that this campaign will generate are immensely important in 1- providing the push that we need to start expanding our business model and 2- bringing the perfect meal to an ever growing, customer base of health conscientious consumers, who look for great tasting, quality, non- processed foods at an affordable value. 


Risks & Challenges

Growing a business can be even more challenging than launching a business. This is especially the case within the food service industry. We have all seen restaurants start and within a few months or perhaps a year, shut down. Restaurants face challenges such as: increasing production while maintaining the same quality standards, becoming a chain food establishment without tasting like one, synchronizing several moving parts such as purchasing, storing goods, preparing food, distributing, and selling, all while providing excellent customer service. Each of these challenges and many more can be daunting when considering the expansion of a business model. 

During our combined 40+ years of experience in the food service industry, we have accumulated the skills and knowledge that are necessary to thoroughly and successfully address any challenge that a food establishment may encounter.


Other Ways You Can Help

Of course, we would love to see everyone contribute! If you cannot contribute financially, we totally understand and you can still help us through your continued support of our Crêpes Parfait food truck and by spreading the word about our campaign. Tell everybody: President Obama, Mrs. Obama, Bill Gates, Melinda Gates, Dr. Dre, Warren Buffett, Beyoncé & JayZ, Mark Zuckerberg, Oprah, John Wall, Pink, Jon Favreau, José Andrés, Denzel Washington, Taylor Swift, Usher, Gordon Ramsay, Steve Harvey, Kevin Hart, The Wizards, The Redskins, The Capitals, The Nationals, The Mystics, The Kastles, DC United, Washington Spirit… well basically all your family, friends and coworkers!

Please use the Indiegogo sharing tools and share this information on social media! 

Thank you, in advance for your continued support and assistance!!!

story:
Health and Education Conference Donations

October 6th 7:30 PM - 11 PM

- - - 

Please find tickets at: 

ubchec2015.eventbrite.ca
- - -
Our ticket sales will not cover the costs of our event, even if we sell every ticket. We have minimized ticket costs, therefore we will appreciate the communities support.
Our conference will feature keynote talks from two of the most renowned mental health intellectuals, live music, paintings, and informative workshops.
The student experience is often marked by the struggle for mental health and the battle to escape loneliness. Many have trouble 'finding passion' or feel like they lack purpose, trying to 'find themselves'. Their struggles are often perceived as personal issues, problems they need to seek help for or to band-aid. This widespread isolation and high rates of mental illness ought to make us reflect on the society that produces them in hopes of building communities and organizations that not only prevent these issues but promote participation and health.
Dr. Gabor Maté will speak on 'Illness & Health in a Toxic Society' and address the conditions in which these problems arise in students and citizens. He will talk on resilience in this 'stressed culture' and how we can come together to fight it.
Professor Adele Diamond will speak on the undergraduate education system in universities - what allows for creativity and critical thinking to emerge and how to create socially conscious and responsible citizens and students.


UBC Students for Climate Action

This conference is hosted by UBC Students for Climate Action. Our mission is to create meaningful cultural movements required for the task of climate change. 

We believe that students – especially those privileged enough to live in Vancouver and attend university – have a responsibility to play a major role in cultural change as well as national policy in regards to inequality, current international policies, and most urgently, domestic policies regarding climate change. In light of this, we have organized a coalition of student organizations at UBC. This coalition includes environmental groups, humanitarian groups. and research groups.

We hope to create a movement on the UBC campus that will steer the climate conversation to become more concerned with tactics of addressing the alarming matter while conversing with and informing students about the reality and size of the problem; the reality of climate change should be widely accepted on an academic campus and so should its serious implications. Students and professors should be utilizing their diverse academic disciplines – physics, economics, social theory, behavioral evolution – to argue tactics. We hope to create an environment where political discourse is not limited to the few students that choose to participate, that instead, through joint action, participation is exciting, enjoyable and popular, so that these kinds of topics will become prevalent in the everyday conversation of students.

We believe that this movement can have a meaningful impact on student votes and turnout in the upcoming election; Because of this, and in light of the the UN conference on climate change in Paris, we have organized a pre-election campaign. For the winter semester, we have a series of creative social events that will allow for serious conversation on how to address climate change. For increasing conversation and accessible information we have organized student-to-student seminars and teach-ins. We also plan to utilize the arts through spoken word poetry, live student written music, impromptu choirs, collaborative paintings (with 1300+ contributors), and many more activities intended to bring students together through art while addressing and being active about important issues and problems. At all our events, we are going to promote students to vote and present them with the platforms of the Canadian parties. We  will end with a large theatrical production called ‘Climate Change Game’.


Our Projects:

We need support in providing students with events and speakers that bring the community together and provide the right soil for social action. 
Other than the Health and Education conference, our upcoming events include:
Student Workshops:
  1. Institutions of Extraction 
  2. Education/Doubt/Intuition
  3. History of Vancouver University Movements
  4. Stress
Collaborative Painting Project: brings together 1440 students and Vancouver citizens to create a mural dedicated to climate action in light of current and coming refugee crises
Community Conversation (weekly): we host UBC students to a weekly organized conversation that brings us together through impromptu choirs, dance, and poetry, along with meaningful conversations on inequality and climate action.
War on Nature - Conversation with David Barsamian: an event where the nature of the climate crises will be discussed, its implications, and necessary action that is required in response. 
Climate Change Game Show: this theater production will be fully produced and filmed as a live game show, with live participants. Our goal is to provide an abstract understanding of various important factors that influence the climate change game, with an emphasis on inequality. The ideas of the show are based on social evolutionary theory and economic games. 


Get Involved

visit http://sc-ociety.ca/events/health-education-conference or email info@ubcclimateaction.ca

Canadian parties. We  will end with a
large theatrical production called ‘Climate Change Game’.


Our Projects:



We need support in providing students with events and speakers that bring the community together and provide the right soil for social action. 
Other than the Health and Education conference, our upcoming events include:

Student Workshops:


Institutions of Extraction 
Education/Doubt/Intuition
History of Vancouver University Movements
Stress


Collaborative Painting Project: brings together 1440 students and Vancouver citizens to create a mural dedicated to climate action in light of current and coming refugee crises


Community Conversation (weekly): we host UBC students to a weekly organized conversation that brings us together through impromptu choirs, dance, and poetry, along with meaningful conversations on inequality and climate action.

War on Nature - Conversation with David Barsamian: an event where the nature of the climate crises will be discussed, its implications, and necessary action that is required in response. 

Climate Change Game Show: this theater production will be fully produced and filmed as a live game show, with live participants. Our goal is to provide an abstract understanding of various important factors that influence the climate change game, with an emphasis on inequality. The ideas of the show are based on social evolutionary theory and economic games. 



Get Involved

 visit http://sc-ociety.ca/events/health-education-conference or email info@ubcclimateaction.ca

story:
"""THEY ARE IN GERMANY!!!"""  """Support them!"""

The Story

A few of my neighbours and I are getting together to help sponsor Aslan and Rose to start a new life. 

A 17 year old Syrian refugee has walked more than 300 miles carrying his pet dog after he could not bear to leave the animal in his war-torn homeland.

Holding the tiny dog as it yapped happily in his arms, he said: “I love this dog, I need her.”

"Some people will ask - you have only a small bag?" "Yes." "And you bring your dog?" "Yes." "Why?" "I love my dog!"

What we need

Support! It can be in the form of a financial contribution or at least by sharing this page with others who can afford to donate.

All money raised will go directly to Aslan. After this campaign ends we are going to get in touch with Aslan.

The biggest hurdle for us is securing the financial sponsorship for Aslan and Rose. We can all contribute some money, but as parents of young kids we can't afford to pitch in the full amount ourselves.

Please help us make a difference for the future of Aslan and Rose. We will be doing private fundraising alongside this campaign. 

Thank you!

If a financial donation is not possible, you can still contribute by spreading the word and raising awareness.

Together we can make a difference!

Sincerely,

Peter Zimmerman, Olga Malika, Roland Horvat 

Contact: peterzimmerman80@gmail.com
