story:
In October 2014, a friend of mine asked me if I could give him a ride home because his car was in the shop for repair. I didn’t refuse, and we safely reached his village, close to Argavand. We parted and I headed back home by a road I didn’t know very well and, as a result, didn’t notice a hole in the road and drove over it at a speed of about 70 km / h, flattening both of my wheels on the left side. (Note from the author: I drive a Mercedes E-class 2003 release, and as we all know there is only one spare wheel in the car). I switched on the emergency lights and changed one wheel. Then I had to decide what to do with the second wheel; it would be too far to drive to the nearest tire-change service, I was in the middle of a road connecting two villages, and it was late at night, so very few cars were passing by, if at all. All my attempts to contact any sort of car service were in vain, and I couldn’t explain to friends where I was geographically. My phone ran out of battery very quickly since I was making so many calls. Finally, fortune smiled down on me and one of my friends figured out where I was. After almost an hour of waiting, we changed my flat tire with the spare that he brought.
After returning home, I was struck with an idea. What if I created a club of motorists and car enthusiasts who would be willing and able to help each other, through their own good will and without expecting money, and who would unite together, creating opportunities to communicate with each other and make useful contacts! I did some research online and found many similar organizations, but they were mostly thematic. But I didn’t want to limit people. I decided that a club founded by me would be open to not only motorists but also those who have different sorts of hobbies! For example, one of my friends, a motorist, is also interested in landscape design. Another friend loves to collect corks from bottles. Why not help them broaden their network of acquaintances? So, by the end of 2014 the club logo was created! (The logo / emblem represents two letters MS, inscribed into each other, the beginning of the letter M is the trail tread from a car tire in which the QR code is integrated, which contains information about the club).
At the very beginning, the club only contained four friends/associates, but soon we become 50! The club has a Council consisting of 10 people who make decisions and discuss proposals of partnerships with other organizations and clubs, regardless of whether they are motorists, florists, constructors, athletes, or ordinary people without any hobbies! One of the first decisions of the club was to enable any of the participants to create their own group of up to 10 people, with its distinctive mark and emblem, under the auspices of the club on MyCar.am, in order to participate in various competitions and games organized by the club!

It happened that one of the members of the club, Marina, got married and moved to St. Petersburg. While we were all happy for her, we were also sad that she was not with us ... but we found the solution! The Council decided that the club should be supported not only by associates from Armenia but also from abroad! Board meetings are held online via Skype, and Marina, as the official representative in Russia, is continuing her activities!
So far, several companies have supported our idea and have gladly put our logos on their windows, with some of them even offering discounts to members of the club as an expression of their good will! Members of the club have different professions and profiles and offer their help with great pleasure as well! At this moment, our club consists of lawyers, doctors of physical, mathematical, and historical sciences, construction workers, businessmen, designers, photographers, professional drivers, IT specialists, car tuners, and many more! Our current partners are: miniwans.am, mixmarket.am, Jeans House, Armenian Tuning Club, Car Proshyan-20, and a few more. They have helped us greatly in the expansion and development of this project!

We have many ideas, starting from propaganda of respect towards the SDA, the introduction of associates from different backgrounds and countries to each other, the organization of auto races, charitable giving to orphanages and shelter-schools for people with disabilities, and the organization of tours for children from low-income families in the country and abroad with the aim of developing the level of knowledge and history of the world! Our club welcomes guests and provides them with any assistance in arranging accommodation, car rental, recreation (sightseeing, providing a guide, etc.), cuisine introduction, riding with an instructor, and teaching traffic rules! Of course, all of the above comes at a financial cost. We cannot fully ensure the above listed activities and services based only on our investments! So, we would be very grateful for your help!
story_txt: In October 2014, a friend of mine asked me if I could give him a ride home because his car was in the shop for repair. I didn’t refuse, and we safely reached his village, close to Argavand. We parted and I headed back home by a road I didn’t know very well and, as a result, didn’t notice a hole in the road and drove over it at a speed of about 70 km / h, flattening both of my wheels on the left side. (Note from the author: I drive a Mercedes E-class 2003 release, and as we all know there is only one spare wheel in the car). I switched on the emergency lights and changed one wheel. Then I had to decide what to do with the second wheel; it would be too far to drive to the nearest tire-change service, I was in the middle of a road connecting two villages, and it was late at night, so very few cars were passing by, if at all. All my attempts to contact any sort of car service were in vain, and I couldn’t explain to friends where I was geographically. My phone ran out of battery very quickly since I was making so many calls. Finally, fortune smiled down on me and one of my friends figured out where I was. After almost an hour of waiting, we changed my flat tire with the spare that he brought.After returning home, I was struck with an idea. What if I created a club of motorists and car enthusiasts who would be willing and able to help each other, through their own good will and without expecting money, and who would unite together, creating opportunities to communicate with each other and make useful contacts! I did some research online and found many similar organizations, but they were mostly thematic. But I didn’t want to limit people. I decided that a club founded by me would be open to not only motorists but also those who have different sorts of hobbies! For example, one of my friends, a motorist, is also interested in landscape design. Another friend loves to collect corks from bottles. Why not help them broaden their network of acquaintances? So, by the end of 2014 the club logo was created! (The logo / emblem represents two letters MS, inscribed into each other, the beginning of the letter M is the trail tread from a car tire in which the QR code is integrated, which contains information about the club).At the very beginning, the club only contained four friends/associates, but soon we become 50! The club has a Council consisting of 10 people who make decisions and discuss proposals of partnerships with other organizations and clubs, regardless of whether they are motorists, florists, constructors, athletes, or ordinary people without any hobbies! One of the first decisions of the club was to enable any of the participants to create their own group of up to 10 people, with its distinctive mark and emblem, under the auspices of the club on MyCar.am, in order to participate in various competitions and games organized by the club!It happened that one of the members of the club, Marina, got married and moved to St. Petersburg. While we were all happy for her, we were also sad that she was not with us ... but we found the solution! The Council decided that the club should be supported not only by associates from Armenia but also from abroad! Board meetings are held online via Skype, and Marina, as the official representative in Russia, is continuing her activities!So far, several companies have supported our idea and have gladly put our logos on their windows, with some of them even offering discounts to members of the club as an expression of their good will! Members of the club have different professions and profiles and offer their help with great pleasure as well! At this moment, our club consists of lawyers, doctors of physical, mathematical, and historical sciences, construction workers, businessmen, designers, photographers, professional drivers, IT specialists, car tuners, and many more! Our current partners are: miniwans.am, mixmarket.am, Jeans House, Armenian Tuning Club, Car Proshyan-20, and a few more. They have helped us greatly in the expansion and development of this project!We have many ideas, starting from propaganda of respect towards the SDA, the introduction of associates from different backgrounds and countries to each other, the organization of auto races, charitable giving to orphanages and shelter-schools for people with disabilities, and the organization of tours for children from low-income families in the country and abroad with the aim of developing the level of knowledge and history of the world! Our club welcomes guests and provides them with any assistance in arranging accommodation, car rental, recreation (sightseeing, providing a guide, etc.), cuisine introduction, riding with an instructor, and teaching traffic rules! Of course, all of the above comes at a financial cost. We cannot fully ensure the above listed activities and services based only on our investments! So, we would be very grateful for your help!

story:
Our Story

I am a son of a Pastor and 24 year U.S. Marine, growing up in this type of environment gave me a sense of service to my community and to humanity. I also followed in my Fathers steps and served 6 years in the U.S. Marines which opened my eyes to the world and lead me to enjoy traveling. I became aware of the vastness of amazing products and incredible designers in Africa that were not represented in the U.S. and the west. For the past 15 years I have been working with different teams to streamline the process of showcasing top designers and products from Africa at U.S. whole sale trade-shows. We now have a team of 120 people world wide,  a few military vets, business people, several people who have traveled through Africa, some educators, moms and dads etc. and all of us have joined together to expand and improve the program.

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising 200k to instantly create jobs, ad the latest technology to implement our programs and to pay a modest salary to our existing volunteers in the U.S., Africa and around the world.  We will use 100k to pay our volunteer team so they can pick, ship and showcase the products at trade shows and on the internet. We will use the remaining 100k for the infrastructure including buying products, opening small trade centers in Africa, setting up fulfillment centers in the U.S., hiring call centers, updating our websites/e commerce,  marketing and management assistance.

When you support our program you will instantly help communities around the world by creating jobs, promoting entrepreneurship, supporting artisans and since part of our profits for the past 15 years have been used for Humanitarian efforts in the countries where we buy the products, you will also be helping us to continue that mission. 

Not only will you get the satisfaction of assisting this amazing effort but with your donation you will get one of our amazing products. You get to choose one of our high quality unique products with your donation. Whether you choose an amazing home furnishings product, a hand woven basket, quality leather product or beautiful jewelry item you will be rewarded all the way around!!!!!

Even it we don’t reach our entire goal which I am sure we will, whatever we raise will go towards the project so no matter what you will have done your part to bring our beautiful planet earth closer together.

The Impact

Our team are all volunteers and have been working hard for free for the past year getting set for the 2016 Holiday Season. The difference your contribution will make is to create a sustainable business for 120 people. It will go a long way to assist the team members in Africa because this modest income will makes it easier for them to move around to villages and through the cites to locate the most amazing products for you!!!! We will also be able to bring our technology, CPA and legal assistance to a level so we can compete on a global level.

Our program is valuable to the world because it is a huge job creator and can do its part to eradicate poverty through international trade. We have had many successes with the program over the years.  With little investment input into the program we where able to take it to a global level. We have built a client base via U.S. trade shows of 600 stores that want to order our products, we have existing orders and we have assisted several primary schools, orphanages and villages in Africa and Asia and trained over 100 us students in International Trade.

We have had our share of challenges and ups and downs, a few times with shipping, the weather and human errors but we have been working hard meeting twice per weeks to alleviate as many of the risk as possible. We now insure all of our shipments and work with UPS fulfillment center and Indiegogo process to utilize risk minimization through out our systems.

Don’t worry if you cannot contribute monetarily, we still need your help getting the word out by posting our campaign to your page and to group pages that you think may be interested. Its very easy Indiegogo has share tools for several social media platforms so you don’t have to work hard to help!!!!!

story:
Short Summary

I am a stay at home mother of two who is looking to improve the world around us. I will be graduating from Southern New Hampshire University with a bachelor's in public relations. I am wanting to combine my passion and my education to bring the Boise area more options. We are looking to start a sustainable food and timber farm in the Boise area. We will have gluten-free and dairy-free foods in our large green house. With them being grown locally, they will be less expensive to our customers and therefore bring more options to them and to future generations.

Timber is an industry that isn't going away. We are looking to bring a sustainable option to the area in the form of bamboo. Bamboo is strong, easy to grow and harvest and can be used for many things including building material, textiles, and even paper products. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise about $2 million dollars. We will be buying the land, building the greenhouse and filling it all will plants. This takes quite a bit of money. An acre greenhouse is huge (43, 560 square feet) and takes a lot of glass and steel. Each plant isn't very expensive, but we will need many. We will also be purchasing all the tools and equipment we need for this venture. If we don't make it to the $2 million mark, we will start smaller and work into our end goals. 

1.Personnel -$1 million for wages for myself and my two employees. This will cover our needs for about ten years, but I will call it eight years to be safe. 

2.Material-I am not sure I will need much in the way of material since that will actually be one of our products. Land is about all of that I will need (I have covered that in the equipment and facilities section.)

3.Media Costs- To start, I won't be spending much on media. After I have funding, I will put $100,000 aside for media costs to bring us closer to our opening date in late 2019.

4.Equipment and facilities- I will need to purchase land and some harvesting tools and also the greenhouse. This may include horses and their feed, specific equipment, and other needs for them. I am expecting this to be about $700,000. 

5.Administrative items- The remaining $200,000 will be set aside for emergencies and unforeseen expenses. 


No one has ever done anything worth talking about alone. I am asking for some help to get started with something that may change the way we look at food. It will surely change the way people with food intolerances and food lifestyles look at their food.

The Impact

Bamboo can be harvested about four years after it is planted. We will start selling then. Having bamboo will help keep our air quality right, bring locally grown and sustainably harvested timber to the area, and also give options to save some habitat. 

Food trees are a great way to get all the needed items for a diet in a sustainable and healthy way. Almonds and coconuts both offer flour, milk, oils, and even sugars onto of just their fruits. These are great alternatives for dairy-free and gluten-free lifestyles. 

Risks & Challenges

One of the biggest challenges we are going to be facing is this is the first company like this in the area. As with any "firsts", we will have to convince the people around us that we are worth having and doing business with. I think that is where the public relations education will come to play the most. I will have the ability to speak in a way that will show the people in Boise that this will help them in a lot of great ways. 

Another risk is drought. I have been putting together information and studying on bamboo for about three years and I feel like I am choosing the best species for our climate and for drought resistance. I will also be setting up rain-water collection systems and preserving what we have available. 

Other Ways You Can Help

There are lots of ways you can help us get started. If you can't fund, that is ok! 

  • Tell your friends about us.
  • Share this profile on Facebook, Twitter and other sites. 
  • Think about sustainable options next time you are looking for lumber or wood products.
  • Try to eat more sustainable foods.
  • Connect with us on Facebook and Twitter.
Thank you for your support and for reading all about us.

story:
At Phononic, we're revolutionizing cooling and heating using SilverCoreTM solid-state technology featuring next generation Thermoelectric (Peltier) devices, heat exchanger systems, and control electronics that removes the constraints of compressors, fans, and water based systems to provide transformative innovation that changes the way we deliver thermal management forever. 

Our latest thermal innovation unleashes the computing market by introducing a microprocessor (CPU) cooler that delivers:

  • Integrated thermoelectric cooling technology—Actively lowers CPU temperature
  • Liquid cooling performance without water— Thermoelectric heat pump cools the CPU while increasing temperature of heat exchanger, overcoming the heat capacity limit of air
  • Variable Assist Cooling—Smart electronics included with the CPU cooler to monitor temperatures and respond with proportional cooling power  
  • Exceptional cooling performance in a small form factor—Fits inside mini-ITX box without compromising cooling performance
  • Variable fan mode—Trade off heat pumping power for fan speed when you want to reduce noise – go full speed when you want the coolest CPU

The Phononic HEX 1.0: A Refrigerator for Your CPU.

Are you pushing your CPU to the limit? Do you know what it is like to smell smoke while trying to grab more GHz out of your processor? Have you ever tried to cram a water cooler radiator into your box only to discover you ran out of wire ties and the back cover won't fit? Judging from the gaming “rage quit” videos we’ve all seen on YouTube, you’re not alone. Finding a scalable way to cool your processor has been frustrating…until now. At Phononic, we don’t like mediocre or big clunky CPU coolers either. So we set out to fix it in a way nobody has done before. We turned to solid-state technology, the same approach that revolutionized microprocessors, solar, and LED lighting industries.

So what the heck does that mean? Simply put, we started over and leveraged Phononic’s SilverCoreTM technology: high performance solid-state thermoelectric devices, heat sinks, and electronics. We didn’t stop there. 

We wanted a smart cooling system that is electrically efficient and delivers performance only when needed. So we ran some numbers, created sophisticated models, ordered lunch, and challenged our engineers to solve the problem. The answer is Variable Assist Cooling (VAC); a mini control board that automatically responds to the thermal demands of your CPU, cooling the processor, and adjusting the fan based on your performance needs. Thermal muscle when you need it, quieter performance when you don't.

How Does Variable Assist Cooling Work?

With Variable Assist Cooling (VAC), users can maximize thermal performance and minimize the power and noise associated with ever-changing CPU loads. The proprietary heat sink design moves heat through two dissipation paths – one is in direct contact with the CPU case and acts as a highly efficient fan heat sink and the second utilizes a Phononic SilverCoreTM thermoelectric heat pump to cool the first “stage” and pull heat into the second heat exchanger.  The result of this system design is a cooler that greatly reduces CPU temperatures.  

As the processor load increases and the temperature starts to rise, the Phononic HEX 1.0 VAC control system activates the built-in cooling element to respond with a proportionate level of heat pumping, resulting in a lower CPU temperature. When the load on the CPU decreases, the heat pump will turn off and the CPU cooler will continue to perform as a high performance fan heat sink – drawing no power for the heat pump at all.

How Big is Your Box?

As microprocessors evolve, their feature sizes have shrunk allowing CPU manufacturers to pack more transistors into their devices which increases clock speeds and overall device performance (ever hear of Moore's Law?). More transistors and faster clock speeds also mean the processors runs hotter. 

To remove heat from faster processors, manufacturers add larger heat sinks and high speed fans just to keep the CPUs from overheating resulting in larger computer cases. With larger cases, there was room for manufacturers to add more secondary fans to ensure that your CPU heatsink/fan combo was getting enough air to do its job.  

In today's sleek technology world, no one wants a big noisy box. So what is a user supposed to do to enjoy gaming in the living room or stream videos when the game is over? The answer is simple: The Phononic HEX 1.0 gives you the performance you need without the bulk of a much larger CPU cooler. That's right. Our CPU cooler will work in EATX towers and will also fit in Mini-ITX boxes as well.

Hydrate Yourself, Not Your Computer.

Water and electricity should never mix. Period. Protect your equipment and yourself, and eliminate water from your investment. While you’re at it, remove the risk of you—or someone else—losing a finger by eliminating external facing fans. Our cooler chills using a Phononic solid-state thermoelectric heat pump (water-free) which comes with an integrated 80mm fan with fully enclosed blades. Safety first, right? Not to mention that ear plugs won’t be needed—this puppy is quiet. 

Become an early adopter!

Get in on the latest cooling technology in high performance computing before it hits the retail market. We’re offering early-adopter rates through our perks as well as a unique opportunity to join our development team as a beta tester. Beta testers will have access to a private forum where you can provide feedback and "geek out" with our team. As a beta tester, you may even win a trip to Phononic's HQ to take part in the launch of the final product.

Let's Talk Tech.

Model:  HEX 1.0

Type: Fan Heatsink with Phononic SilverCoreTM Solid-State Thermoelectric Heat Pump; Integrated 80mm Fan with enclosed blades

Cooler Specifications:

  • Fits Intel LGA2011/LGA1366/LGA1156/LGA1155/LGA1150
  • Dimensions & Weight: 4.3" x 3.5" x 3.5" (H x W x D)
  • Weight = 650 grams
  • Material:  RoHS compliant
  • Removable Fan
  • Fan Compatibility: 80x80x25mm

Fan Specifications:

  • Dimension: 80x80x25mm
  • Connector:  4-PIN PWM
  • Bearing Type: Two Ball Bearings
  • Voltage Rating/Power: 12VDC/5.76W Maximum power
  • RPM: 4500RPM Maximum
  • Air Flow: 67.02 CFM Maximum
  • Noise Level: 48.6 dB-A
  • Max Static Pressure: 9.955 mm H2O
  • MTTF: 70,000 hours

Electronic Control Specifications:

  • Mounting: PCIe slot with included bracket (no PCIe electrical connection)
  • Motherboard Connections: CPU fan (either 3-wire or 4-wire fan connections are supported)
  • Power Connections: Standard 4-pin IDE power cable
  • Required voltages: (from 4-pin IDE connection) = 5, 12VDC
  • Dimensions: 100mm x 38.1mm (excluding mounting bracket)

Features:

  • Three colored LED status indicators provide visual display of the electronic controls
  • Fan speed can be optimized by the user by varying a knob on the control board
  • Easy installation without moving the motherboard. Fits within the 4 mounting screws of the Intel LGA2011/115x socket

Cooling Performance

The measure of the effectiveness of a CPU cooler (or any heat exchanger in general) is the measure of its thermal resistance. This characteristic shows how much the temperature of the CPU will rise depending on the power being dissipated. The Phononic CPU cooler shows very low (<0.1 °C/W) thermal resistance with modest air flow (>15 CFM) which rivals or surpasses liquid coolers of similar size.  


Overclocking Results

Test Details:

  • Tested in OEM overclocked system @4.5 GHz
  • Mini-tower chassis
  • i7-4790 Intel processor – LGA1150 Socket
  • Running HyperPi floating point math application – 100% CPU power and speed
  • OEM system is 120mm fan remote radiator, closed loop liquid cooler
  • Phononic CPU cooler under maximum heat pumping mode for lowest temperature CPU

Test Results

The Phononic CPU cooler was able to deliver equal or lower CPU temperature as the OEM closed-loop liquid cooler. This was ~10 ℃ cooler than the measured CPU temperature of a conventional fan heat sink CPU cooler. 

Download our technical paper here for more information.

Who is Phononic?

Phononic is revolutionizing cooling and heating with solid state thermal management solutions. Headquartered in the heart of North Carolina's Research Triangle Park, Phononic provides solid state semiconductor technology that can be applied to everything from refrigeration to fiber optics, removing the barriers of traditional approaches and ushering in a new era of cooling and heating. The result is a solution to this age-old challenge that is distributed, convenient, sustainable and connected. For more information visit www.phononic.com or follow us on Twitter @PhononicRTP.

Thermal muscle when you need it, quieter performance when you don't.How Does Variable Assist Cooling Work?With Variable Assist Cooling (VAC), users can maximize thermal performance and minimize the power and noise associated with ever-changing CPU loads. The proprietary heat sink design moves heat through two dissipation paths – one is in direct contact with the CPU case and acts as a highly efficient fan heat sink and the second utilizes a Phononic SilverCoreTM thermoelectric heat pump to cool the first “stage” and pull heat into the second heat exchanger.  The result of this system design is a cooler that greatly reduces CPU temperatures.  As the processor load increases and the temperature starts to rise, the Phononic HEX 1.0 VAC control system activates the built-in cooling element to respond with a proportionate level of heat pumping, resulting in a lower CPU temperature. When the load on the CPU decreases, the heat pump will turn off and the CPU cooler will continue to perform as a high performance fan heat sink – drawing no power for the heat pump at all.How Big is Your Box?As microprocessors evolve, their feature sizes have shrunk allowing CPU manufacturers to pack more transistors into their devices which increases clock speeds and overall device performance (ever hear of Moore's Law?). More transistors and faster clock speeds also mean the processors runs hotter. To remove heat from faster processors, manufacturers add larger heat sinks and high speed fans just to keep the CPUs from overheating resulting in larger computer cases. With larger cases, there was room for manufacturers to add more secondary fans to ensure that your CPU heatsink/fan combo was getting enough air to do its job.  In today's sleek technology world, no one wants a big noisy box. So what is a user supposed to do to enjoy gaming in the living room or stream videos when the game is over? The answer is simple: The Phononic HEX 1.0 gives you the performance you need without the bulk of a much larger CPU cooler. That's right. Our CPU cooler will work in EATX towers and will also fit in Mini-ITX boxes as well.Hydrate Yourself, Not Your Computer.Water and electricity should never mix. Period. Protect your equipment and yourself, and eliminate water from your investment. While you’re at it, remove the risk of you—or someone else—losing a finger by eliminating external facing fans. Our cooler chills using a Phononic solid-state thermoelectric heat pump (water-free) which comes with an integrated 80mm fan with fully enclosed blades. Safety first, right? Not to mention that ear plugs won’t be needed—this puppy is quiet. Become an early adopter!Get in on the latest cooling technology in high performance computing before it hits the retail market. We’re offering early-adopter rates through our perks as well as a unique opportunity to join our development team as a beta tester. Beta testers will have access to a private forum where you can provide feedback and "geek out" with our team. As a beta tester, you may even win a trip to Phononic's HQ to take part in the launch of the final product.Let's Talk Tech.Model:  HEX 1.0Type: Fan Heatsink with Phononic SilverCoreTM Solid-State Thermoelectric Heat Pump; Integrated 80mm Fan with enclosed bladesCooler Specifications:

Fits Intel LGA2011/LGA1366/LGA1156/LGA1155/LGA1150


Dimensions & Weight: 4.3" x 3.5" x 3.5" (H x W x D)


Weight = 650 grams


Material:  RoHS compliant


Removable Fan


Fan Compatibility: 80x80x25mm

Fan Specifications:

Dimension: 80x80x25mm


Connector:  4-PIN PWM


Bearing Type: Two Ball Bearings


Voltage Rating/Power: 12VDC/5.76W Maximum power


RPM: 4500RPM Maximum


Air Flow: 67.02 CFM Maximum


Noise Level: 48.6 dB-A


Max Static Pressure: 9.955 mm H2O


MTTF: 70,000 hours

Electronic Control Specifications:

Mounting: PCIe slot with included bracket (no PCIe electrical connection)


Motherboard Connections: CPU fan (either 3-wire or 4-wire fan connections are supported)


Power Connections: Standard 4-pin IDE power cable


Required voltages: (from 4-pin IDE connection) = 5, 12VDC


Dimensions: 100mm x 38.1mm (excluding mounting bracket)

Features:

Three colored LED status indicators provide visual display of the electronic controls


Fan speed can be optimized by the user by varying a knob on the control board


Easy installation without moving the motherboard. Fits within the 4 mounting screws of the Intel LGA2011/115x socket

Cooling PerformanceThe measure of the effectiveness of a CPU cooler (or any heat exchanger in general) is the measure of its thermal resistance. This characteristic shows how much the temperature of the CPU will rise depending on the power being dissipated. The Phononic CPU cooler shows very low (<0.1 °C/W) thermal resistance with modest air flow (>15 CFM) which rivals or surpasses liquid coolers of similar size.  Overclocking ResultsTest Details:

Tested in OEM overclocked system @4.5 GHz


Mini-tower chassis


i7-4790 Intel processor – LGA1150 Socket


Running HyperPi floating point math application – 100% CPU power and speed


OEM system is 120mm fan remote radiator, closed loop liquid cooler


Phononic CPU cooler under maximum heat pumping mode for lowest temperature CPU

Test ResultsThe Phononic CPU cooler was able to deliver equal or lower CPU temperature as the OEM closed-loop liquid cooler. This was ~10 ℃ cooler than the measured CPU temperature of a conventional fan heat sink CPU cooler. Download our technical paper here for more information.Who is Phononic?Phononic is revolutionizing cooling and heating with solid state thermal management solutions. Headquartered in the heart of North Carolina's Research Triangle Park, Phononic provides solid state semiconductor technology that can be applied to everything from refrigeration to fiber optics, removing the barriers of traditional approaches and ushering in a new era of cooling and heating. The result is a solution to this age-old challenge that is distributed, convenient, sustainable and connected. For more information visit www.phononic.com or follow us on Twitter @PhononicRTP.

story:
I love what Opportunity International Canada (OIC) represents and I believe in their work throughout the world. I encourage you to learn why I love OIC and why you will too, click here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MVmxTCEkefY&fea...

I have been involved with OIC through giving and coaching for over a year. I love the way OIC empowers people to work their way out of poverty through micro-finance and community building. This access to credit releases entrepreneurs from poverty’s shackles and enables them to launch their own businesses. The thousands of lives transformed are a testament of OIC's success.

I have been asked by OIC to Chair an important fundraising luncheon for them in Calgary (for details http://opportunityinternational.ca/news/events/...).. I am honoured to be leading this event, which is attended by many prestigious and reputable members of the Calgary corporate community. This luncheon typically raises $150-$200k that is used for micro-finance loans to aid the working poor. As the Chair, I will be leading a handpicked team to ensure a successful event that reaches our goals. 

In addition to donating and providing leadership, I want to further support this event by inviting 20 special guests that I am confident will GIVE to OIC at the luncheon. I want to offer FREE tickets to my personal guests to inspire their generosity. Tickets are $200/person, so I am trying to raise $4000 to cover the costs for these invites. My goal is that each guest I invite will give a minimum of $500 (resulting in $10,000+ raised). Will you come alongside me and help me raise the resources for these 20 tickets?

Thank you for considering this idea. As a thank you for all who participate, I will provide monthly updates and a final report of the total amount raised at the event. In addition, please see "Perks" for some great gifts to incentivize and inspire your generosity.

PS: Unfortunately this contribution is not eligible for a tax-deduction.

story:
Soy Jordi Carreras Areny y soy el coordinador del Summae Dream. Nuestro objetivo es obtener financiación para la Fundación Summae a través de la organización de eventos de deporte solidario y a su vez dar a conocer la labor de la Fundación.

"Esperamos que por cada euro invertido en el Summae Dream se obtengan tres euros para la Fundación Summae".

    

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes:

Necesitamos financiación para capitalizar el proyecto Summae Dream:

  • Organización de carreras de bici o de running donde la inscripción sea 100% solidaria, para la Fundación,  y el dinero no se merme con la compra de comida y camisetas que debemos regalar, con seguros de RC que debemos pagar, con permisos que debemos conseguir, etc.
  • Difusión de la Fundación Summae con la participación en eventos nacionales e internacionales de primera línea sin que los fondos recaudados se nos vayan a las equipaciones, alimentación, viajes, etc.

Toda la gente que participe en esta financiación ya sea con un capital grande o con un capital pequeño, disfrutará de sus recompensas pero además formará parte del Muro de los Fundadores, que será una lona impresa con el nombre y/o la foto con la camiseta Summae Dream de todas aquellas personas que nos ayudan con este proyecto.

El impacto:                         

  • Este proyecto demostrará que el deporte bien gestionado es una buena fuente de difusión y de recaudación de fondos, y que la solidaridad es algo que aún existe.
  • La primera edición del Summae Dream recaudó más de 10.000€ para la Fundación Summae sin apoyo inicial como este. Imagina lo que podemos hacer con tu ayuda ahora…
  • La Fundación Summae no invierte en publicidad, no invierte en una gran imagen. Todos los fondos que se recaudan van directamente al desarrollo de sus tareas. Tareas como la formación y apoyo a los familiares de una persona con discapacidad y la adaptación de su entorno, el apoyo psicológico a los discapacitados tanto en edades tempranas como en avanzadas, en definitiva, la medicina especializada que no debería estar solo al alcance de unos pocos sino de todos aquellos que lo necesitan.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar:

  • Si tu no te ves en condiciones de ayudarnos económicamente, no significa que no nos puedas ayudar. El triunfo de esta campaña está en que mucha gente aporte poca cantidad, DIFUNDE NUESTRO MENSAJE usa tus redes sociales, manda un e-mail a todos tus contactos, que la gente sepa lo que queremos hacer y porque lo hacemos.
  • La gente de  Indiegogo, nos proporciona muchas herramientas para poder difundir nuestro mensaje, úsalas!

Preguntas frecuentes:

¿Qué es Summae Dream?

Somos un grupo de personas que quieren dar un sentido solidario a la práctica del deporte y se han propuesto como meta ayudar a la Fundación Summae a ampliar su obra social.

¿Qué tipos de actividades solidarias organizamos?

La temporada 2014-2015 fue la primera del Summae Dream se  recaudaron más de 10.000€ para la Fundación Summae (sin apoyo inicial como el que estamos solicitando ahora):

  1. SUMMAE TOSSA TRAIL: Trail de Bicicleta de Montaña

  2. Limpieza de las bicis de la Andalucía Bike Race: limpiamos más de 2000 bicicletas en una semana siguiendo las etapas de la ABR.
  3. Poniendo como objetivo diferentes retos personales, realizamos diferentes campañas de micromecenazgo. (www.summaedream.com)

¿Qué es la Fundación Summae?

La Fundación Summae es una entidad sin ánimo de lucro creada para dar respuesta a las necesidades de los niños con trastornos del desarrollo y trastornos neuropsíquicos y acompañar a sus familias a lo largo de todo el ciclo vital, así como para atender a las personas con discapacidad.

A través de la difusión de la labor de la Fundación se obtienen nuevas donaciones y fuentes de financiación.

¿Por qué hago esto?

En mi familia hay dos personas que necesitan de un servicio médico específico y personalizado por culpa de una enfermedad o discapacidad que la Seguridad Social no está preparada para ofrecer. La Fundación Summae nos ha ayudado mucho y de manera desinteresada, con grandes profesionales y con muchísima humanidad. Ahora me toca a mí ayudarles a ellos para que puedan seguir con su labor y ayuden a más gente.

¿Qué ocurre si no conseguimos el 100% de la financiación solicitada?

En caso de que no logremos nuestra meta, ajustaremos las actividades a lo recaudado.

story:
Summary

My name is Julia. I'm studying to be a photographer in Prague. I enjoy bodyart, taking pictures, architecture and trying new things. Once me and my friend didn't know how to congratulate our mutual friend. So we decided to draw a beautiful picture on our breasts with his name and age on it and sent it to him. During the process I realised that it could be cool to create a service that could help people to send funny messages to their friends. To realise this idea I rented a studio, took my friends and asked them to help me to create this video. And now you can see what we've done.

When you obtain any perk we will contact with you via e-mail  with the request to send the text, logo, picture or advertisement ,that you want to see depending on the type of your order. Executed order will be sent to your e-mail address.

 
How will my service look if I collect enough money?

I will create  a website with the help of which any person will be able to order a photo or video-message with congratulation, advertisement, invitation or whatever which he can send to friend, relative, colleague, girlfriend, whoever.

The service could help you:

To congratulate your friend on his birthday or invite him to spend evening together

to motivate your friend to work out in the gym

to congratulate your friend on marriage or talk him out of it

to inform your partners or colleagues about meeting postponement

What invitation for fishing could be better than sexy girl with a fishing rod

to congratulate your friend on his  achievements  in popular video-games

to boast to your friends about awesome vacation

To break up with your girl....................................Easy! xD


Wanna advertise your company logo, brand name, facebook group or  account, shop, your services ? What is the most rememberable advertisement for your potential customers? Of course the one on bodies of  our beautiful girls!

As you can see with the help of this service people will be able to say about serious things in an  easier and funnier way!


Partnership:

I'd be glad if as many people as possible would know about my project. That's why I decided to present one photo to people who have more than 100 000 subscribers in social networks (instagram,facebook,youtube etc.)

All you need to do is just send a link on Your account or group to my e-mail address "bodysnapshot@gmail.com". When I make sure that it exists I send an approval.

After publishing of the advert, you send me the text of the message, that you want to see on our model. All the messages will be sent to You and  contributors in November in 2015. If you can't contribute but you still love the idea of my project don't worry you can still help!

You can share this page and  our other pages  in social networks.

    TERMS:
    A text message you provide to us shall not be longer than 35 characters and shall not contain any text, image, graphics, or any other information that is in any way unlawful in any state of the world, offensive, profane, harmful, threatening, defamatory,obscene, harrasing or racially, ethically or otherwise objectionable or extremist; facillitate legal activity, promote or depict sexually explicit images, obscene or pornographic images; promote ofdepict violence; promote discrimination based on race, sex, religion, nationality, disability, sexual orientation or age.

    Contacts:
    Business contact - bodysnapshot@gmail.com
    Instagram: bodysnap-shot
    https://www.facebook.com/julailafray

story:
What We Need & What You Get

  • We need 92.000 USD  for next year to keep runing our NonProfit radio Station, money is for all taxes, goverment fees, and salaries  for 4 employees.
  • We offer you to become unique Voice for disabled people in Croatia. Our stream has reached great numbers and We change public opinion in favor of people with disabilities  every day. You can be that Voice!
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, Funds will  be used to cover basic cost of Radio Station: electicity, phone, rent and fees!

The Impact

  • This is a special media project in Slavonski Brod (Croatia). One of the central characters in this particular project is someone who suffers from a muscular distrophy disease. In September 2014 project was supported by the European Union and radio station "Radio 92FM+" started. It is the first radio station set up by people with disabilities in this part of the world. The radio station is independent, focusing on the strengthening of civil society, with special attention to marginalized groups. Radio 92FM+ works with a small professional staff of four employees, five regular volunteers who make programs and a group of over 25 volunteers. In a house in Slavonski Brod, a small, well-equipped studio furnished. The station can be heard 24 hours a day in the air and on the internet.

  • Radio92fm+ was one of 6 best EU projects in 2014.
  • Just clic on our stream http://stream.radio92.eu:8000/ and listen our program and music for the soul :)

Risks & Challenges

  • Our main risk is funding and money. We are doing everything in our power to keep going and helping disability people and marginalized groups same as
    all civil society and NGO in our Country.
    Plan is to keep wrinting new aplications and projects same as keep looking for donations and help from people and associations that are willing to help this unique Radio Station!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute with money that doesn't mean that you can't help:

  • Ask folks and your friends to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Recovering at home versus institutional care
institutional care

According to survey of 1000 American adults conducted by Harris Interactive, 82 percent of the respondent stated a preference for home health care over institutional care? Although strong across all age group, gender, and income segments, this was especially true among Americans age 55 and older. More than 91 percent stated home health care to be their preference. Public Opinion Research conducted a poll for Glenworth that showed 75 percent of the respondents in their poll would prefer to receive home health care, and many believe that Medicare or their private insurance would help to foot the bill.


Insight of special need for patients:

Seniors, individuals with disabilities, developmental disabilities, illness, injury, surgical procedures, mobility-challenge and outpatients, need help with basic daily needs like Feeding, Toileting, Selecting proper attire, Grooming, Maintaining continence, Putting on clothes, Bathing, Walking and transferring such as moving from bed to wheelchair.

Story of Precedence Home Healthcare

We are a group of friends working together in a Home Health care agency. After being involved with health care industry both professional and in our personal life successful with diversity of patience, we realized that people have long ago stopped providing "care". I decided to create our own brand, and not just an ordinary Home Health care agency that could benefit from our own healthy lifestyle. That's why I created Precedence Home Healthcare– a simple and smart care that can really change life while making it easier.

BENEFIT

The benefit of Precedence Home Healthcare are endless, the number one benefit is that we allow patients to receive personal care in the privacy and comfort of their own homes. For aging and homebound individuals, in-home care facilitates them in remaining as functional and independent as possible, providing a much higher sense of security and dignity. Receiving home health care helps to reduce unavoidable readmissions to the hospital, and studies have shown that patients recuperating from illness, injury, or surgical procedures heal more quickly and more successfully when recovering at home versus in a medical facility.

The primary benefits of Precedence home health care include:

• Delivered in the comfort of the patient's home
• Easier for family and friends to visit
• Promotes healing and provides more safety from infections
• Allows more freedom and independence
• Tailored to the needs of each individual patient
• Reduces re-hospitalizations

Precedence home care services include:

 • Observation and Assessment                                                                                                      •  Wound care                                                                                                                                       •  Pain management                                                                                                                             •  Medication and disease education                                                                                               •  Physical therapy                                                                                                                                 •  Speech therapy                                                                                                                                   •  Occupational therapy                                                                                                                       •  Dietary management/education                                                                                                  •  Psychiatric care                                                                                                                                         

Help Us Help Patience!

After years of continuous hard work and determination, we need to bring services into the next phase. The business startup and human capacity have proven a considerable financial obstacle and we need accreditation to operate the agency.  Don't think you can’t be part of Precedence Home Healthcare exciting early adopter community? Think again, because there are many ways you can help us, even without pledging for a product.

We hope you will recognize the potential of our effort and services by helping us turn an idea into a reality. Together, let’s make Precedence Home Healthcare the people's choice!

Thank you for your Support!

You can expect transparency and direct communication from us all the way. All members of the team give you their word that everything will be implemented as promised. We have big plans with this Home Healthcare agency. This is just the beginning!

story:
R-U-DRNK is a breathalyzer device that is placed on the power switch of the car whether it has a key switch or start button.

The device has a nozzle, to which the driver must blow, to record breath alcohol levels It sends this data via a Bluetooth connection to an application. If the device detects a low level of alcohol, it rotates and opens so you can insert the key or press the button to turn your car on, otherwise, if the alcohol levels are high, R-U-DRNK won't open.

The application sends an alert to a previously selected trusted person reporting that the driver is drunk and can not drive, generating a map with the location of the intoxicated person.

The device also allows both the drunk driver or the trusted person to request a taxi service to the location of the driver, so they can return home safely.

While the main purpose of the app is to request a taxi service and/or help from a trusted person when drunk, it also provides the hability to send an alert to the trusted person (or people) when the user is in need or danger. A taxi service can always be requested to the driver's location and the destination being a previously selected place (comonly the user's home). This feature is specially useful in flat-tire scenarios.


10,076 people were killed in alcohol-impaired driving crashes in the US alone



Each year nearly 1.2 million people die and millions more are injured or disabled as a result of road crashes



but with R-U-DRNK and your help we can reduce this figures significantly



When you are ok (read not drunk), the device rotates and opens.


Fully compatible with cars with key switches


And start buttons.


This is the device installed in your car, If you're okay to drive, the device is activated and rotates for you to insert the key and start your car.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

If you are drunk (even just a little, enough for your senses to be blured), the device is locked and won't allow you to start your car. The app informs the people you trust and sends them your current location.

It's closed, blocking the key swith so the car can't be started.


It is also compatible with start buttons.


If you are drunk, the device is locked and won't allow you to start the car. The app informs the people you trustand sends them your location


Alcohol 


Alcohol is absorbed into the body at a much faster rate than food. On an empty stomach, 20% alcohol is immediately absorbed into the bloodstream. The average person's body breaks down alcohol at rate of 20 to 30 mg/dL per hour and is metabolized by the body or excreted through the breath, sweat or urine.

The peak blood, and so we should no longer drive, is reached about when the said alcoholic beverage intake.



The application


If you are okay to drive the app will only display the percentage of alcohol in green with a "you're okay to drive, care and respect traffic signals" message.

You can always request help to your trusted people, or request a taxi service to your location, you know, in case of flat tire, sickness, car malfunction or a quick way to get a taxi home.


When you are drunk, the application will automatically alert the people you trust about your condition, so they can contact you or request a taxi service for you. You can always request that taxi service yourself.

When a taxi service is requested and accepted, information about your driver and ETA are displayed and sent to he people you trust, so they get important updates about how close you are from returning home safely.


Whether you are drunk or in need for help, your trusted people will receive alerts about your situation, your taxi driver and your ETA.


The device


Components.

  1. Cover sealed to protect the circuitry
  2. Body, where the electronic circuit is located
  3. Base, this part is stuck in the car ignition switch
  4. The nozzle serves to blow and thus know the amount of alcohol in the blood
  5. Device
  6. Nozzle output
  7. Micro-USB charging port


Components.

1.  Bluetooth

2. ATMEGA328 microcontroller 

3. Alcohol Sensor MQ 3

4. Servo SG90

5. Stack

6. Regulator


Bluetooth

Bluetooth is an industrial specification for wireless personal area networks (WPAN) that enables the transmission of voice and data between different devices using a radio frequency link in the ISM 2.4 GHz band.

Its function: transmits the data obtained by the microcontroller and the sensor to a mobile application


ATMEGA 328 microcontroller

High performance integrated circuit that is based RISC microcontroller, combining 32KB ISP flash memory with the ability to read-while-write, 1KB of EEPROM memory, 2KB of SRAM, 23 lines E / S general purpose 32 records overall process, three flexible timer / counters with comparison, internal and external interruptions, USART programmer mode, byte-oriented serial interface 2 wire SPI serial port, 6-channel 10-bit A / D converter (8-chanales in TQFP and QFN / MLF packages), "watchdog timer" programmable internal oscillator with five modes software selectable saving energy.

Its function: responsible for providing power to the sensors and bluetooth, servo and MQ3 addition to process the communication bridge between the device and the mobile application.


Alcohol Sensor MQ3

Alcohol sensor for detecting the concentration of alcohol in your breath, just like your common breathalyzer. It has a high sensitivity and fast response time. It provides a resistive analog sensor output based on the alcohol concentration.

Its function: Get the level of alcohol in the breath of a person.


Servo SG90

A servomotor is similar to a DC motor that has the ability to be placed in any position within its operating range, and remain stable in that position device.

Its function: safety mechanism prevents the device to be opened when the user is drunk.


Battery

Its function is to keep the circuit fed. It primarily supplies the microcontroller, which distributes power to each of the other electronic components.


Regulator

Regulates the voltage delivered from the battery to the microcontroller, thereby preventing overheating.


Developing

Our idea is not only to sell a product, it is to save the lives of people who unfortunately die or see their lives get affected so much. 

R-U-DRNK can save a lot of lives, it could save YOUR life.

And this is how it all begins ...


alcohol testing with a simple circuit sensor


connecting with bluetooth and reducing size


testing with an official breathalyzer


starting device design


Completed device design


We hope that our device will save lives, but we need your help to make this possible and take it to every car on the planet!



The app will be available on every major mobile platform.

story:
What We're Doing

First off, we'd like to stress that this is not a donation campaign. Read on.

On a bucket list on our wall, one item reads: "Buy land for house, possibly in New England." The thought of snowshoeing through an evergreen forest, arriving at a snug cabin built by its owner, and warming up by a wood stove has a lot of appeal to it. We could not stop obsessing over the idea, and so we went ahead and committed to it. We had other goals associated with it:

  • Make it sturdy and high-quality, and when possible, out of recycled material
  • Have it be a place for others to enjoy as a getaway
  • Don't go broke building it

In order to accomplish these goals, we came up with a great idea: let others stay in the house. We looked on AirBnB, and found that we could easily rent our house out for quite a bit of money. However, that didn't feel quite right: we'd rather fund it by letting you stay in it for super cheap, and experience the magic yourself.

That's what brought us here. We want to raise at least $4,000 to cover expenses like lumber, insulation, a wood stove, a kitchen, and other amenities for our tiny home. If you'd like to come visit New England in the summer, winter, spring, or fall, then here is your opportunity to do so in the quaintest of settings.

The Reasons We Love Vermont

We cannot lie: Vermont is our favorite state. Here are some reasons: 

  • Vermont has made roadside advertising (billboards) illegal.
  • Burlington, its biggest city, runs on 100% wind, solar, and hydroelectric power.
  • Its fall foliage is the best in the country
  • Instead of letting "Anywhere, USA" architecture take over its towns, Vermont preserves its historic villages. Every town is a delight to the eyes.
  • It has some of the best skiing, snowboarding, XC skiing, snowshoeing, and mountain biking on the east coast.
  • It is a state that largely practices tolerance and acceptance
  • It borders a French-speaking province of Canada.

What You Get

Here's what we're offering:

  • You can rent the house + the 3.5 acres it sits on for $50/night. That's far cheaper than anything of this caliber.
  • The maximum number of nights is one week (7 days). At this point, you receive the 7th night free, for $300 total.
  • If you'd like to donate, we will gladly accept. But please note again that we don't see this as a donation campaign: we are offering ridiculously cheap accommodation and using those funds to get our cabin built.

The Impact

We are building this house from local lumber and materials. It will be styled after local Vermont architecture, with board-and-batten siding and a metal roof. 

  • You are helping to build a home from the ground up.
  • The house will eventually be powered by solar power, and will be completely off the grid. 
  • The house will also be host to artist residencies, where artists from all over will apply to work on their art for several weeks.
  • Recycled materials will be used whenever possible.

Risks & Challenges

Being that neither Jenny nor I have built a house before, this experience has been invaluable to us. Our families and friends who have helped have also enjoyed and embraced the challenge. Though there is a lot more work to do, we are inspired and motivated to keep the quality consistent. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Admittedly, the thought of being in a snowy cottage with a wood-burning stove, or spending summer days exploring a lush forest and swimming in northern rivers and lakes, has lots of appeal. You can help by sharing with your friends, because they are not likely to find a deal like this otherwise. We are very grateful for your help!

story:
WHAT IS COWORKING?

Coworking is the social gathering of a group of people, who are still working independently, but who share values, and who are interested in the synergy that can happen from working with talented people in the same space.

The Community Impact Statement

Arbor Hill is a neighborhood AND community that is deserving of new opportunities, partnership development, and continued growth. In using the word “community”, I mean building one that is thriving and inclusive. Being a part of somewhere where there is no “one” definition of community. 

I want Arbor Hill to grow and be known as more than a geographic location. For this neighborhood to be known by the common interests and causes, recognized through a sense of identity and its shared emotional connections. Building upon shared values or norms, mutual influences and overall commitment to meeting the shared needs.

I was born and raised in Albany, New York after my family moved here from Shubuta, Mississippi & Mobile, Alabama. My father has been active in Albany, having the most impact in Arbor Hill being that our family migrated to Dove Street & Orange Street for affordable housing within the Capital Region. Watching him give back and serve his community instilled traits within me, that I would further develop, leading me to stay committed to the city I grew up in with my father and family.

I spent 3 years at Phillip Livingston Magnet Academy and saw the possibilities within Historic Arbor Hill as I grew up here, knowing at a young age I would give back to my community, through entrepreneurship and education in the community. 

In partnership with Albany Housing Authority, I intend to bring the idea of shared workspace, called coworking to the Arbor Hill neighborhood, January 2016. This will be a mixed-use space promoting entrepreneurship within the community while educating current and aspiring business owners through seminars, special events, and mixers. I'm invested in Albany, New York and have committed to engaging the residents to help them start, run and grow small businesses. Whether they're just starting a business or working remotely for a company (while scaling their own product) I want to develop a space to work and a community full of like-minded (yet creative in their own way) individuals. Through this space, I aim to inspire collaboration, personal and professional development, mentorship, and empowerment here in the Capital Region. 

The goal is to help people grow & maintain a network to offer help, collaborate with, and support them through their professional journey. Members will have access to any monthly workshops we host and there will be free printing and scanning as well. The shared workspace will allow room for members to: teach a class of their own, bounce ideas during Friday brainstorms, make new friends at our monthly events and workshops, find help for every need with members from all industries and backgrounds. Here, they'll reach their full potential in a creative workspace, and join a supportive community full of fellow ambitious creators.

With that being said, I want to be a part of the change, moving forward, which is why I'm naming this business venture THRIVE because that is what I envision for the Arbor Hill neighborhood. For it to become & maintain being a neighborhood AND community that flourishes for residents, workers, and entrepreneurs. October 2014, American Planning Association named Arbor Hill as one of America's 10 great neighborhoods. I aspire to maintain it's eminence.

About Me
My name is Kaciem Swain. I'm the Creative Director for Idea Engineering at FlagshipUltra - a creative think-tank agency and idea lab producing brands, events, products in Albany, New York. I'm also a freelance business coach at Train With Swain. I help brands, creatives, startups, and small business owners start, run and grow. This campaign is important to me because I was born in raised in the community that I'm looking to bring a coworking space to. I've been an entrepreneur for 11 years, starting with a nightlife promotions company which eventually pivoted to become a special events company. Arbor Hill is currently going through a new growth phase. The city has built housing, a live/work space for artists, an art gallery and a new park in the neighborhood and I want entrepreneurs to join me in this community. You will join me in promoting the message of entrepreneurship and job creation through bringing startups and small businesses to the capital region while growing the ones we currently have here!

What We Need

THRIVE has arrived, our location is set, the lease is signed and the team is in place. We've turned to INDIEGOGO to engage our future coworkers, neighbors, and community beforehand, in hopes that you will help us make the THRIVE even better. The more money raised now, the more we'll be able to do as we plan out our community. It will enable us to create a space that’s not just functional and beautiful, but one that is a vibrant center for business in Albany's Arbor Hill.

We need $10,000, which will allow us to do the following:

  • Purchase furnishings for the workspace from local businesses (tables, chairs, beanbags, couches,etc)
  • Lease all-in-one printers, tvs, projectors and other equipment for the residents and members of THRIVE
  • Buy paint, tissue, snacks, supplies, and other much need materials.
  • Help us build a creative tool and resource lending library for rental and onsite usage. A reference library of books and material samples, audio and video equipment for production and post-production, and art and design tools and supplies will help outfit THRIVE with shared, creative resources.
WHAT WE WILL HAVE:
  • Print Station
  • Cafe/Coffee Bar
  • Concierge Services
  • Business To Business Collaboration
  • Networking Events
  • Weekly Programming
  • Tech Support 
  • Wired Internet & Wifi
  • Cleaning & Maintenance 
  • Library
  • Office Hours
  • Mailbox
  • Event Space
  • Staff Support
  • Speaker Series
  • Seminars
  • Workshops & Classes
  • Consulting
  • Office Supplies
  • & More, Based On The Community Needs

Our Overall Impact

The Economic: 

Coworking supports small businesses! and small businesses are key for a healthy economy! Entrepreneurship is encouraged through the creation of the right working environment. Talent stays in town, creating an environment for innovation and entrepreneurship helps talent feel good and supported when taking the initiative to start their own business. New networks of collaborations emerge - both physical and through online platforms! Projects are locally grown and with potential global impact!

Growth - While THRIVE grows, so will our ability to provide convenient and affordable space and opportunities will grow too - meaning we can do more, better and faster while making a larger impact within our community.

Education - By hosting classes and workshops at affordable prices we can make learning affordable for the members and neighborhood residents.

Risks & Challenges

While we will use funds raised from this campaign only for capital and build-out expenses, our coworking space is dependent on revenue from members, visitors, and programming or rentals. Like any business, we could see a drop-off in subscriptions and purchases that could endanger our long-term plans for the space.

Our estimates on the cost of capital purchases could be off, and unexpected or emergency costs could supplant the items listed above. But we will endeavor to stick to the original spirit and intent of this campaign in using any funds acquired.

We believe we are qualified to overcome any miscalculations or overages because we have been addressing those kinds of problems for nearly 2 years. We believe in our community space, and we want to make it as presentable as possible to our own city and its visitors.

What we are trying to do with this campaign is to use Indiegogo in the most faithful way possible: to rev up a unique project in Arbor Hill, build some excitement around it, make it beneficial to the people who live here, and move a bit faster than we might if we continued on from our own spare cash.

THRIVE is not a non-profit, but it is, informally, not a business any of the founders expect to feed their retirement funds. It's a labor of love. When we see people helping with each others' projects and chatting over coffee, groups planning events after-hours, and lots of newcomers enjoying a feeling of "heading to work," we feel good about our investment. We think you might feel good about investing in this, too.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help us:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Send this to your local news station or blogger!
  • Please share this campaign through social media!
  • Call me and find out how we can partner on this project together!
  • Donate furniture & equipment, help us paint the walls, and fix up the space!
  • Pass this along to any small business owners, creatives, real estate agents, lawyers or soloprenuers you know!
  • Rent the space to host your mixer, networking event or seminar!

And that's all there is to it.

Together, we THRIVE! Thank You.

In using the word “community”, I mean building one that is thriving and inclusive. Being a part of somewhere where there is no “one” definition of community. I want Arbor Hill to grow and be known as more than a geographic location. For this neighborhood to be known by the common interests and causes, recognized through a sense of identity and its shared emotional connections. Building upon shared values or norms, mutual influences and overall commitment to meeting the shared needs.I was born and raised in Albany, New York after my family moved here from Shubuta, Mississippi & Mobile, Alabama. My father has been active in Albany, having the most impact in Arbor Hill being that our family migrated to Dove Street & Orange Street for affordable housing within the Capital Region. Watching him give back and serve his community instilled traits within me, that I would further develop, leading me to stay committed to the city I grew up in with my father and family.I spent 3 years at Phillip Livingston Magnet Academy and saw the possibilities within Historic Arbor Hill as I grew up here, knowing at a young age I would give back to my community, through entrepreneurship and education in the community. In partnership with Albany Housing Authority, I intend to bring the idea of shared workspace, called coworking to the Arbor Hill neighborhood, January 2016. story:
What Is It's Borrowed?

Need something for one day or a week.? Find it on It's Borrowed. It's Borrowed is a mobile App allowing you to “borrow" everyday items like camping items, tools, sports gear, etc. from people just like yourself that have these items just sitting unused in their garage or closets. No need to buy items that you’ll use one time then toss in the corner to gather dust.

Already got stuff gathering dust not making you money? Create an It's Borrowed rental store page and you can easily generate money from items sitting around your house.

Why It’s So Good:
It's Borrowed empowers you to cut back on needless spending of items that you rarely use. The idea for It's Borrowed came about while on a business trip. Our founder needed for a pair of golf shoes but didn't want to buy a new pair for $100 and lug them back in his carry-on. Nothing existed to help his problem so he decided to fix the problem and thus It’s Borrowed was born.


Why Are We Crowdfunding For An App?

We're turning to the Crowdfunding community to help us raise increased funds so we can include more awesome features in the initial launch.

Currently we've raised 260k to get this project properly off the ground - from concept to first stage BETA production and on into a live launch late Summer 2016.

Features in the App are going to be exclusively available through some of the Perks of this campaign i.e. "supporter" profile page, home page image, etc..

Since the project is an App we're limited on our perk offerings so we're leveraging our own founder Mike Jacobsen to entice you into bigger perks. When It's Borrowed is huge you'll have the bragging rights to tell your friends "yep, I partied with the founder of It's Borrowed!"


Official It's Borrowed "puffy hat" perk

Notes About the Launch Party, Pebble Beach or Party Bus Perks
These perks do not include alcohol. It is against IndieGoGo policy to promote any Perks that cover the cost of or purchasing/furnishing of alcohol of any type.

Details about these Perks will be available once the campaign has funded. If you have any questions about these Perks please e-mail mj@itsborrowed.com

Risks & Challenges

There are none for this campaign. If we raise nothing, the App will still launch and we'll just have a longer timetable or future improvements. Whatever we raise here will only make the App better for our users right from the start.

www.facebook.com/itsborrowed/
www.instagram.com/its_borrowed/
https://twitter.com/itsborrowedapp
www.itsborrowed.co
