story:
Ignite Your Creativity with Spark Spaces Coworking !

 

Spark Spaces Coworking is finishing the build out of our space in Prince George’s County so we can welcome our first members this Fall. Spark Spaces Coworking will then become home to creative entrepreneurs, developers, consultants, innovators, makers, work-from-homers and startups. Pretty much any one who is looking for a collaborative community work environment is welcome. The resulting community will help each member, thrive and inspire each other.

We want Spark Spaces Coworking to be more than just desks, chairs, free wifi, coffee and organics snacks. Anyone can sublease an office, snag a seat at the local coffeehouse or library we wanted a coworking space that actually reflects the community it serves and the result is SparkSpaces.co. which is being built specifically to promote small business development, networking, collaboration, and  energy of the community.

 

Why Are We Raising Funds on IndieGoGo?

Why not? We really love the IndieGoGo community! Where else can you find so many awesome people willing to pitch in a couple of dollars (or more, hopefully more :-D) to help dreams come to fruition? We've supported other fundraisers here and knew it would be the perfect place to promote Spark Spaces Coworking and present our rewards for your contribution to the campaign. Plus, the more people who give, the more people we're accountable to and we are cool with that.

 

So, What's Next?

We'll be opening soon, like really soon (October 2, 2016) and the funds raised on IndieGoGo will be used to paint, and furnish our space. This is where your contribution comes in—we need to raise some money to furnish our space so our members and guests can enjoy a great work environment.Your donation will not be used to fund our operations. As we are bootstrapping the crap out of this with our own funds, too. We're also working with local vendors (awesome thrift shops, antique shops, carpenter and dope ass artist) in the community and carefully selecting our purchases so we can make sure that every single dime from our IndieGoGo fundraiser is used to make a kick-ass coworking space that you will be proud of. This is your money, coins, dinero, checks and we plan to spend it wisely.

With your support, we'll be able to transform  our space with furniture, paint, flooring, light fixtures and more to make it an awesome place to work. Our little List includes:

  • Paint
  • A couple of couches
  • Desks
  • Chairs
  • Conference Table
  • A few lockers
  • Shelfs
  • Bookcase
  • Mini-fridge to keep drinks cold
  • Mail slots to accept packages
  • Signage; so we can let everyone know where we are.
  • Light fixtures
  • Electrical Updates (comes with the territory with a building over 100 years old)
  • Conference Room Clean Up and Redesign (There is literally a tree growing through the window) 
  • Bathroom Update and Repairs. 
  • and more

If you donate, be sure to sign up for our e-newsletter on our site www.sparkspaces.co. Also, be sure to follow us on Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter for updates and behind-the-scenes deets of our daily shenanigans. We want you to be part of the fun and hopefully stop by and check us out.

So How Does the Space Look Now?

Well, not much. But, we can see the beauty of a transformed space and the community rocks!!!

Here is a pic of our historic building (seriously this building is over 100 years old, it’s so cool). Don't judge. It just needs a big hug a lot of love, some fresh paint and new signage. In other words it is going to take some work, and tons of elbow grease.

 

Some interior shots :-D. Well hello Beth and vintage water cooler.

So paint and carpet removal. We are hoping the hardwood underneath just needs some buffing and shine to restore its natural beauty. 

Another vintage water cooler :-D. More paint, carpet removal, hardwood buff and light fixtures and furniture. 

And here is our view from the top. Hello neighbors!!!



   

We will be located in the heart of the Historic Mount Rainier Community off of Rhode Island Avenue. Literally in the center of Mt. Rainer, where a 5 minute can put you in either be in D.C. or Hyattsville, MD.

We love this community and how they support entrepreneurs and artist; and we love the growth that the county has planned for the area. I mean they even have their own community currency here so you can trade goods and services; how cool is that. Amazing organic eateries, organic co-op grocery, bike co-ops, super cute library and artist studios galore. 

A Little About Us.

Spark Spaces Coworking Community was founded to harness the entrepreneurial energy of Prince George’s County . There are many exciting things happening in the heart of the Prince George’s Gateway Arts District and a quick 5 minute walk to DC, including incredible web & app development, artist and entrepreneurial communities.

So, Who is Behind Spark Spaces?

The founding members are creative entreHERneurs and StartupMommas who live in Prince George’s County: Beth Adams, and  Elizabeth Agbabiaka, yes we know we are the two Beth A's.  We identified a need of coworking in Prince George's County a few years ago when we were both working in different places within the DC metro. On days we worked from home we couldn't find anywhere that we could go to work and collaborate with others in our own county. There were tons of coworking options in Washington, D.C., Montgomery County and Northern Virginia but, none in our beloved Gorgeous Prince George's County that were open. Beth and I went to work researching the county demographics and programs, reading everything about coworking,  meeting with SCORE counselors, and members of the Prince George's County Economic Development Corporation.  After reading Alex Hillman's totally kick-ass blog we decided that we needed to bootstrap this ourselves by building our own community and we started an entreHERneur meet up over year ago for Prince George's County that quickly bloomed to almost 300 members, needless to say we started meeting at  Wegmans, moved to the South Bowie Library and then we were finally ready expand and look for a place to lease. Finding a coworking space proved it self to be a challenge after explaining to concept of coworking  and "collaborative open space", then being shown traditional silo-styled office spaces with no wall removal options and being told that we were either to young, probably couldn't afford it, or if our husbands would be signing the lease with us (I mean WTF!!!! in 2016. Really???) . We took those insults with a grain of salt and moved forward.

As we were walking in Mt. Rainier and discussing the incidents of that day's space hunting challenge we walked past a little building that we both loved in the heart of the city and noticed the leasing sign. Beth rang the doorbell and someone answered. We found our space and we are moving into the Gateway Arts District of downtown Mt. Rainier. We will offer free weekly and monthly events for members and the community about branding, coding, mobile app development, social media strategy, public relations, marketing and more. We also will offer family hours. Beth and I are both parents and we know the challenges of starting a business and raising a family. These hours will give families the opportunity to work while a trained childcare provider will watch your children while you build your future. 

In Closing.

We're so close to making coworking in Prince George’s county a reality. With your help, we'll realize that dream and create an environment we can all be proud of and you will have played a vital part in that, and for that we are truly grateful.

So, BIG THANKS, in advance IndieGoGoers... for helping us build this space out and your generous support. You all are awesome.

Thank you.

I mean they even have their own community currency here so you can trade goods and services; how cool is that. Amazing organic eateries, organic co-op grocery, bike co-ops, super cute library and artist studios galore. A Little About Us.
Spark Spaces Coworking Community was founded to harness the entrepreneurial energy of Prince George’s County . There are many exciting things happening in the heart of the Prince George’s Gateway Arts District and a quick 5 minute walk to DC, including incredible web & app development, artist and entrepreneurial communities.
So, Who is Behind Spark Spaces?
The founding members are creative entreHERneurs and StartupMommas who live in Prince George’s County: Beth Adams, and  Elizabeth Agbabiaka, yes we know we are the two Beth A's.  We identified a need of coworking in Prince George's County a few years ago when we were both working in different places within the DC metro. On days we worked from home we couldn't find anywhere that we could go to work and collaborate with others in our own county. There were tons of coworking options in Washington, D.C., Montgomery County and Northern Virginia but, none in our beloved Gorgeous Prince George's County that were open. Beth and I went to work researching the county demographics and programs, reading everything about coworking,  meeting with SCORE counselors, and members of the Prince George's County Economic Development Corporation.  After reading Alex Hillman's totally kick-ass blog we decided that we needed to bootstrap this ourselves by building our own community and we started an entreHERneur meet up over year ago for Prince George's County that quickly bloomed to almost 300 members, needless to say we started meeting at  Wegmans, moved to the South Bowie Library and then we were finally ready expand and look for a place to lease. Finding a coworking space proved it self to be a challenge after explaining to concept of coworking  and "collaborative open space", then being shown traditional silo-styled office spaces with no wall removal options and being told that we were either to young, probably couldn't afford it, or if our husbands would be signing the lease with us (I mean WTF!!!! in 2016. Really???) . We took those insults with a grain of salt and moved forward.
As we were walking in Mt. Rainier and discussing the incidents of that day's space hunting challenge we walked past a little building that we both loved in the heart of the city and noticed the leasing sign. Beth rang the doorbell and someone answered. We found our space and we are moving into the Gateway Arts District of downtown Mt. Rainier. We will offer free weekly and monthly events for members and the community about branding, coding, mobile app development, social media strategy, public relations, marketing and more. We also will offer family hours. Beth and I are both parents and we know the challenges of starting a business and raising a family. These hours will give families the opportunity to work while a trained childcare provider will watch your children while you build your future. 
In Closing.
We're so close to making coworking in Prince George’s county a reality. With your help, we'll realize that dream and create an environment we can all be proud of and you will have played a vital part in that, and for that we are truly grateful.
So, BIG THANKS, in advance IndieGoGoers... for helping us build this space out and your generous support. You all are awesome.
Thank you.

story:
Short Summary

I am a medical professional, a licensed pharmacist with backgrounds in pharmaceutical marketing, based in Taipei Taiwan, but would like to start up a small business online in 2nd-hand quality goods including clothes, bags, watches, CD/DVD etc. 

As I'm not employed currently, it would be much appreciated if I can get the financial aids from friends all over the world who'd find my project worth of giving a go. I need the fund to go collect more 2nd-hand quality items to enrich my Yahoo online shop.

What We Need & What You Get

(USD$12,000): for 2nd-hand quality goods collection/purchase.

(USD$960): for Yahoo admin fees (4%) once goods sold.

(USD$40): for mailings.

[USD$24,000]: expecting sales in one year.

If I reach my sales target in one year, 35% of the sales profits will go to charity groups in Taiwan, with receipts of the donations to be presented to my fund contributors accordingly.

If I do not reach my sales target, the final balance (= fund raised + sales made - all costs incurred) will go to charity groups in Taiwan, with receipts of the donations to be presented to my fund contributors accordingly.

The Impact

By making sales, I can help further those who are in financial hardship.

Other Ways You Can Help

It's just fine that you can't help financially, but it would be much appreciated if you can share my project via social media as possible as you can.

I need the fund to go collect more 2nd-hand quality items to enrich my Yahoo online shop.What We Need & What You Get(USD$12,000): for 2nd-hand quality goods collection/purchase.(USD$960): for Yahoo admin fees (4%) once goods sold.(USD$40): for mailings.[USD$24,000]: expecting sales in one year.If I reach my sales target in one year, 35% of the sales profits will go to charity groups in Taiwan, with receipts of the donations to be presented to my fund contributors accordingly.If I do not reach my sales target, the final balance (= fund raised + sales made - all costs incurred) will go to charity groups in Taiwan, with receipts of the donations to be presented to my fund contributors accordingly.The ImpactBy making sales, I can help further those who are in financial hardship.Other Ways You Can HelpIt's just fine that you can't help financially, but it would be much appreciated if you can share my project via social media as possible as you can.

story:
What is "Moms-Get-Jobs?"

Moms-Get-Jobs is an interest-free investment program launched by Natural Elements Wellness Collective that is designed to help single moms in their quest for a rewarding career that can lead to business ownership, It's the perfect mesh-up between a scholarship and a loan. It helps put single moms through a vocational school with a guaranteed job position upon graduation, while helping them with costs of schooling, supplies, licensing, childcare, and other basic expenses. 

Is this a non-profit program/organization?

No, this is NOT a non-profit program and it's NOT designed to be charity. This is an opportunity program. We believe that the right applicant is willing, able, and ready to work. Given the right opportunity she will seize it. Natural Elements will be funding the program entirely. The first person we're sponsoring is Toni!

How is the Scholarship-Loan paid back?

Upon graduation, the applicant will have a guaranteed job at Natural Elements. A percentage of the mom's earnings will pay back the loan . The Mom will continue to get their base pay while having the ability to make more money through tips during the repayment period.

There are no minimum required monthly payments. The more the mom works, the faster the loan gets paid down, and the more money she continues to make. 

What happens when the scholarship-loan is paid off?

Once the loan is completely paid off, the mom can decide to start their own practice and KEEP the entire client base that Natural Elements helped them build. 

They will also get continued support from Natural Elements through access to affordable rental space, marketing help, and business consulting to ensure a successful practice. Transition into owning their own business will exponentially explode the moms' income while still allowing for the same flexible schedule. Working less, getting paid more, spending less money on child-care while spending more time at home with the kids?! yes please! That's the whole point of this program!


What We Need

  • We need to raise $20,000 to be able to fully fund the program. This money will be used for school, day care, and payroll while our single mom is getting her education on! Part of the funds will also be used to pay the amazing therapists and healers that are offering services as part of the perks. 

What You Get:

  • If you're local (San Diego County): You can come experience the amazing services we have at Natural Elements Wellness Collective through some great perks! You can also gift any of the perks to anyone you like!
  • If you're not local: You can purchase our awesome T-shirt or Hoodie to rock! OR you can purchase any of the perks and send an e-mail to naturalelementscollective@gmail.com for us to donate that service to a single mom, gift it to a local charity, or give it as a gift to anyone you'd like. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our campaign! The more people hear about our business, the faster we can attract like-minded people and grow. The bigger Natural Elements Wellness Collective gets, the more moms we can sponsor through our program!

story:
Welcome to Angel Paradise Farm. We are a small livestock farm recently started that includes honey bees, dairy goats, poultry, and a few pigs for the farm as well as our personal pets and some rescue animals we occasionally adopt.  We believe in farm fresh eggs and healthy homegrown meats and milk. Our hearts and passion are involved in taking care of our livestock to the best of our ability.

Our main goal is to grow our honey bee apiary in order to (first and foremost) help save the Honey Bee, and (secondly) to produce healthy products such as honey, pollen, and wax products.

I have been a teacher of the deaf and hard of hearing for over 25 years at the same school. Unfortunately, due to circumstances beyond my control, just before the holidays I was informed that I would be losing my teaching job. Now the dream of owning and running a profitable farm business is now threatened due to the loss of income. We still need to take care of the animals through this challenging time. We also need to prepare for the next season to be able to increase the production of honey and honey products to sell, and handmade products that use honey, beeswax and goat milk (i.e. lotions, soaps, lip balms, candles, etc.)

Goals:

*Purchase feed and hay and provide housing throughout the year.

*Build bee hives and equipment for next season.

*Purchase additional equipment to make products using honey, beeswax, goat milk to sell.

*Fix the tractor to help with farm work.

*Fix some buildings to continue to provide safe and warm living environments.

We started keeping honeybees since 2012. We have built from 2 colonies to 15 colonies.  We have sold some hives to others interested in beekeeping to help pollinate plants and crops and as a source of their own honey. During this time we have lost some hives but are building hives that successfully survive the harsh Iowa winters and use those bees to grow our apiary. We build all our own hives and some equipment , constantly researching and testing new ideas to strengthen our bee colonies.

We ask for your help through funding our project and/or sharing with others to support bees and other animals at Angel Paradise Farm. We ask that you use the Indiegogo share tools to let everyone you know about us and ask them to share as well. Thank you for your help.

story:
Who we are,

The Charity Factory is a start up NPO in Pretoria, South Africa. We focus on fund raising for other care organisations, especially those caring for abandoned babies with disabilities. 

What we need,

We need our first 100 small change collection cans to distribute to local grocery stores and we need some help with development on our new website ( to implement forms for donation collection ). We try to do as much of the development ourselves but we are really stuck with this one. The company supplying us with the cans is a local company that gives special rates to NPO's. Their website can be found here http://canit.co.za/

Other Ways You Can Help

Please go to our website and sign up for our monthly newsletter, like our Facebook page and follow us on Twitter. http://www.thecharityfactory.co.za

story:
#SOSBLAKAUSTRALIA - Help us stop the Forced Closure of Aboriginal Communities

#SOSBLAKAUSTRALIA  is an Aboriginal led peoples movement that grew out of necessity in the response to the threatened forced closure of Aboriginal communities. Through social media, in 6 months, we were able to extend our reach to 12 million people worldwide, of which you are a part. 

We are committed to keeping our communities on their homelands and we have been consulting among our own people to develop sustainable and viable models for communities, outstations and seasonal campsites. 

We are now in a position to move forward in our humanitarian effort as we begin the steps toward sustainability. By donating now, you will be making a contribution to enable Aboriginal Communities to access green energy, which is a critical step forward in viability and one we will be able to leverage on for further support.  

Through a combined effort, what we will achieve is for communities to be able to harness the alternative power sources needed in order to run water-pumping stations, medical facilities, schools and other municipal services effectively.

The current situation

Remote Aboriginal communities need our help. After ongoing neglect from successive governments, the infrastructure is largely substandard and more akin to third world conditions than that of a first world country.

Of the 1139 Aboriginal communities nationwide, there are 274 remote Aboriginal Communities in Western Australia (WA) who remain at the epicentre of the threat of closure. Recently it was reported that eighty per cent of remote Aboriginal communities in WA whose essential services are delivered under a state-run program failed water safety tests by testing positive for E coli or Naegleria. In addition to those breaches, the water supplies of one in five communities in the program showed unsafe levels of nitrates or uranium contamination.

Of the 3,040 dwellings across these communities in WA, most need major repairs or replacement. Overcrowded conditions can put stress on household amenities such as cooking equipment and sewerage systems, potentially affecting safety, and may also contribute to higher transmission rates of infectious diseases. Many houses need one or more extra bedrooms to adequately accommodate all residents and others require demolition to alleviate issues with asbestos and substandard building. Not all people in remote Indigenous communities have a permanent dwelling as a home - over 1,500 people are still living in temporary dwellings such as sheds or humpies.

We know that the impact of the threat of forced closure has had a significant negative impact on well-being, particularly on Elders, some of which have explicitly stated they will die before they would be forced to leave. We know that of the communities who have already been closed, that the direct result has been over-crowding and homelessness. Should the State and Federal Governments continue as they are, they will force over 20,000 Aboriginal people into homelessness. This is heartbreaking.

In lifting the threat of forced closure from remote Aboriginal Communities we aim to make every Aboriginal community sustainable.  We will do this as our cultural continuum is vital to the core of humanity and it is the right thing to do.


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone will be in a position financially to support this campaign, so we ask that you consider the other ways you can assist:

  • As an individual, have the quality conversations within your circle of family and friends and let them know about this campaign. 
  • Join the Twitter, Facebook and Instagram feeds to receive up-to-date information and stories from Aboriginal Australia. 
  • Please share and support this campaign widely!

For more information.
www.sosblakaustralia.com

twitter.com/sosblakaust

www.facebook.com/sosblakaustralia

www.instagram.com/sosblakaustralia

story:
Fortify is working to solve the 

WORLD'S LARGEST PUBLIC HEALTH PROBLEM


Iron Deficiency Anemia (IDA)

By adding iron to everyday foods that are healthy, affordable and available in regions where the world's least nourished live and suffer because their diets lack iron, the key nutrient necessary for building blood, strength and vitality. 


Who We Are

Fortify is U.S. based 501(c)(3) corporation dedicated to using the power of the marketplace to provide food-based solutions to reduce iron deficiency anemia, and other micronutrient deficiencies, in developing countries, with a mission of reducing the incidence of maternal deaths during childbirth.  Key officers include: Nancy K. Martin, Founder/CEO:  https://www.linkedin.com/in/nancy-martin-a0769b3  Dr. Barbara Lyle, Chief Technology Officer and Nutrition Scientist:  https://www.linkedin.com/in/barbara-lyle-a288b23 For the Founder's history, and Fortify's Board of Directors, please see our website: http://fortifyfood.org.


Why We Care, and You Should, Too


Anemia, defined as a low level of hemoglobin in red blood cells, is the leading cause of death at the moment of bringing a new life into the world.  It kills at least 2 million women, girls, and babies annually.  Maternal and neonatal health are inextricably connected, and iron deficiency anemia is passed from mother to infant.



IDA affects one-third of the world’s population, and $50 billion in GDP is lost annually due to iron deficiency anemia, according to the World Bank, because IDA also severely impacts cognitive function and productivity.  

IDA can be insidious and invisible.  It's very likely you know someone who is iron deficient. One out of every 10 women experiences iron deficiency in the U.S., but unlike a woman or child living in a developing region of the world, where up to 70% of the population lives on less than $2 a day, an American woman has easy access to remedies.  She can literally "beef" up her diet ... adding more iron-rich meats and vegetables, consume more iron-fortified cereals, take an iron supplement, or in severe cases, have intravenous iron therapy or a blood transfusion in a modern health care facility.  



Helping mothers and girls thrive in the developing world leads to better health for the whole family, and increased participation in the community as well as the politics of entire nation, which is especially critical in countries where authoritarian leaders disregard the needs of the weak, and extremist groups prey on the poor and vulnerable.


The Best Solution

Food fortification is widely recognized as the best way to address major nutrient deficiencies for large populations at risk.  Food fortification works, and was proven in the U.S., beginning in the 1920's, and then increasingly more critical during and after World War II.  

A few examples of successful fortification you may know include: iodized salt, Vitamin D in milk (which also boosts calcium absorption), and breads and cereals enriched with thiamin, niacin, iron, and riboflavin initially, and recently with folic acid as well.  

Our strategy adopts successful fortification methods and applies them to developing regions where very few foods have been fortified.  Our greatest challenge is adding iron where it's never been added before – to foods that make sense because they are consumed by the people who need fortification the most. 


The Fortify Strategy

  1. Identify healthy, culturally preferred foods that are widely consumed
  2. Partner with global companies with wide distribution networks
  3. Guide research–select best forms of iron for foods that boost absorption
  4. Coordinate laboratory testing (sensory, shelf stability, and bioavailability)
  5. Work with government ministries in targeted regions to build awareness and educate health care providers of the benefits of iron fortified foods

Pilot: Tomato Paste in West Africa

In West Africa, many simple family meals include tomato paste.  Consumption statistics show that every person eats at least 3 servings of tomato paste per week. Tomato paste is affordable to those who need it the most, and is widely available, even in the most rural villages. 


Best Path to Success – Partner With a Leader

That leader is a global agri-business company behind one of the most popular and respected brands of tomato paste in West Africa. Their packaged foods business is dedicated to the West African consumer, and they are committed to the process of adding iron, and possibly other essential micronutrients to their paste, and other products.  

Fortify will initiate and guide the scientific process necessary to select iron forms that balance stability, taste, bioavailability, and cost considerations in order for an iron-fortified paste to be commercially viable.  As a not-for-profit, any potential intellectual property rights resulting from the development of fortificant formulations by Fortify will be controlled by Fortify. The intent is to share test results and formulations in the public domain for widespread use by entities working to fortify foods in developing regions of the world.

Our partnering company(ies) will provide tomato paste, in the form most relevant for the testing process, and will then incorporate selected iron formulas at their facility, and then package the paste, and ship it as needed and directed by Fortify to support product screening and final product testing at an accredited testing facility.

Once proven, packaged, and ready for distribution, Fortify will support its corporate partner(s) with in-country advocacy, government relations, education and public relations. 


Why We Need Your Help

Adding vitamins is fairly simple.  Fortifying foods with minerals is not. That's why iron fortified foods haven't reached the needy populations of the world. Our plan is to change that.  Food companies do not care to bear the expense of extensive laboratory testing, and re-testing, so we will, and anticipate some in-kind support as well. Companies are driven by the profit motive, and often disregard the opportunity to simultaneously "do good" and build market share.  Our plan is to change that, too.  

We see our social venture evolving in two phases, as shown below.  If you're interested in a more detailed breakdown of expenses in our budget, please ask.  We'd be happy to share that with you.



We need money...

But we also need to build a community of supporters, of all kinds, to help spread the message that it is possible for one little NGO to dramatically change the survival rate of women in childbirth globally with a highly focused initiative.  Fortify is about finding a simple solution to a global problem.  If you cannot make a monetary contribution, but feel compassionate and interested in helping as a volunteer, please let us know that. 

I would like to thank the Fortify Board of Directors for their unwavering support of Fortify, and hard work making this launch a reality.  I would also like to recognize Paolo Patruno (www.birthisadream.org) whose photo of mother and baby appears as our Campaign Card above.

 Nancy

are inextricably connected, and iron deficiency anemia is passed from mother to
infant.


IDA affects one-third of the world’s population,
and $50 billion in GDP is lost annually due to iron deficiency anemia, according
to the World Bank, because IDA also severely impacts cognitive function and
productivity.  
IDA can be insidious and invisible.  It's very likely you know someone who is iron deficient. One out of every 10 women experiences iron deficiency in the U.S., but unlike a woman or child living in a developing region of the world, where up to 70% of the population lives on less than $2 a day, an American woman has easy access to remedies.  She can literally "beef" up her diet ... adding more iron-rich meats and vegetables, consume more iron-fortified cereals, take an iron supplement, or in severe cases, have intravenous iron therapy or a blood transfusion in a modern health care facility.  


Helping mothers and girls thrive in the developing
world leads to better health for the whole family, and increased participation in
the community as well as the politics of entire nation, which is especially
critical in countries where authoritarian leaders disregard the needs of the
weak, and extremist groups prey on the poor and vulnerable.



The Best Solution

Food fortification is widely recognized as the best way to address major nutrient deficiencies for large populations at risk.  Food fortification works, and was proven in the U.S., beginning in the 1920's, and then increasingly more critical during and after World War II.  
A few examples of successful fortification you may know include: iodized salt, Vitamin D in milk (which also boosts calcium absorption), and breads and cereals enriched with thiamin, niacin, iron, and riboflavin initially, and recently with folic acid as well.  
Our strategy adopts successful fortification methods and applies them to developing regions where very few foods have been fortified.  Our greatest challenge is adding iron where it's never been added before – to foods that make sense because they are consumed by the people who need fortification the most. 

The Fortify Strategy

Identify healthy, culturally preferred foods that are widely consumed
Partner with global companies with wide distribution networks
Guide research–select best forms of
iron for foods that boost absorption
Coordinate laboratory testing (sensory, shelf stability, and bioavailability)
Work with government ministries in targeted regions to build awareness and educate health care providers of the benefits of iron fortified foods


Pilot: Tomato Paste in West Africa




In West Africa, many
simple family meals include tomato paste.  Consumption statistics show
that every person eats at least 3 servings of tomato paste per week. Tomato paste is affordable to those who need it the most, and is widely available, even in the most rural villages. 




Best Path to Success – Partner With a Leader




That
leader is a global agri-business company behind one of the most popular and
respected brands of tomato paste in West Africa. Their packaged foods business is dedicated to the West African consumer, and they are committed to the process of adding iron, and possibly other essential micronutrients to their paste, and other products.  
Fortify
will initiate and guide the scientific process necessary to select iron forms that balance stability, taste,
bioavailability, and cost considerations in order for an iron-fortified paste
to be commercially viable.  As a not-for-profit, any potential intellectual property rights resulting from the development of fortificant formulations by Fortify will be
controlled by Fortify. The intent is to share test results and formulations in
the public domain for widespread use by entities working to fortify
foods in developing regions of the world.
Our
partnering company(ies) will provide tomato paste, in the form most relevant for the
testing process, and will then incorporate selected iron formulas at their
facility, and then package the paste, and ship it as needed and directed
by Fortify to support product screening and final product testing at an
accredited testing facility.
Once proven, packaged, and
ready for distribution, Fortify will support its corporate partner(s)
with in-country advocacy,
government relations, education and public relations. 


Why We Need Your Help

Adding vitamins is fairly simple.  Fortifying foods with minerals is not. That's why iron fortified foods haven't reached the needy populations of the world. Our plan is to change that.  Food companies do not care to bear the expense of extensive laboratory testing, and re-testing, so we will, and anticipate some in-kind support as well. Companies are driven by the profit motive, and often disregard the opportunity to simultaneously "do good" and build market share.  Our plan is to change that, too.  
We see our social venture evolving in two phases, as shown below.  If you're interested in a more detailed breakdown of expenses in our budget, please ask.  We'd be happy to share that with you.




We need money...
But we also need to build a community of supporters, of all kinds, to help
spread the message that it is possible for one little NGO to dramatically change the
survival rate of women in childbirth globally with a highly focused initiative.  Fortify is about
finding a simple solution to a global problem.  If you cannot make a
monetary contribution, but feel compassionate and interested in helping as a
volunteer, please let us know that. 
I would like to thank the Fortify
Board of Directors for their unwavering support of Fortify, and hard work making this launch a reality.  I would also like to recognize Paolo
Patruno (www.birthisadream.org) whose photo of mother and baby appears as our Campaign Card above.
 Nancy

story:
Short Summary

Inthebitcoin.com is a website with a single goal - promote the use of bitcoin currency. Users can save short messages inside bitcoin's blockchain. Every stored message once stored can not be deleted or changed and will stay inside the blockchain forever.  For every message we generate a special video which the user can share online.

What We Need

1. Improve videos

We need funds to improve our videos. See our first one below. Yeah not very pretty. We would like to make more of them and of better quality  so users will be able to pick and choose.


2. Create tutorials 

We would like to create tutorials and animations how to use bitcoins for various purposes. See our first one published on medium.com. We would like to create more of them so users can read and get more familiar with bitcoins. Our goal is to make more of them on different topics related to bitcoins. This animation we created to visualise live bitcoin transactions. Be careful it is quite hypnotising.


 

What You Get

You as a contributor you will help to improve the project and at the same time learn how to use bitcoins and have fun sending and sharing video messages with your friends.

Each contributor will get a number of coupons (see our perks on the right) to store your personal messages free of charge (without the need to even own the bitcoins). You might even propose the next video theme or tutorial topic.

The Impact

More people will get familiar with bitcoins. By using videos, animations and social media we are trying to reach to people not familiar with bitcoins. By running this campaign we offer a possibility to try bitcoins and learn something about them without the need to actually own any bitcoin at all.

We believe that bitcoins will bring very positive change to the whole world, but to make it happen we need to reach a critical adoption mass. 

Risks & Challenges

There aren't many risks, all the money from this campaign will go directly to support the development of inthebitcoin.com, fix bugs, create new animations and tutorials.

Each new added feature or improvements will be described in the changelog published on github. As a contributor you will receive weekly notification about our progress.

We are very dedicated to improve inthebitcoin.com and to spread the information about it. With your support will be able proceed faster and reach many more current and future bitcoin users.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not contribute by donation there are other ways you can help.

  • Review the website and give your feedback
  • As we are not native english speakers - please let us know about any weird typos or errors we did.
  • If you are an animation guru and would like donate your animation we will be happy to use it
  • Share the word about this project with your friends
  • If you would like to directly support us with bitcoins feel free to send them to 13wf6a27RNpHKi9T5GUB53oxoCzKVr8KsK

story:
My mission is to create delicious food that we miss when going gluten free. 
To educate and raise allergen awareness.

I know how hard it is to eat out Gluten free, and I have heard some pretty horrid stories about cross contamination, and suffered the consequences for myself more than once.
 I am fed up of being alienated and made to feel bad because I have a medical condition that means I can not eat something (that is a staple food to most and hides and sneaks its way into many foods totally unnecessarily), IT'S NOT MY FAULT AND NOT MY CHOICE, its just the way it has to be if we want to stay well and healthy, so we have to make peace with it, I wish they would too.
That is why I will open This restaurant with a 100% gluten free kitchen, so that coeliacs have somewhere totally safe to eat, with a menu that isn't just a burger without a bun and a side salad.
A bit about me.
My name is Chantal, I am a chef and mummy of two. Myself, my kids and a few other members of my family are gluten free. I have been gluten free for over 20 years, back then us gluten free folk were lucky to find a loaf of "bread" that literally tasted of rancid cardboard and disintegrated into a pile of crumbs at the slightest touch! I have witnessed first hand the transformation of the gluten free world we live in, it has got 1000% better than it was 20 years ago, but I believe there is still a huge way to go. So I had to learn how to cook, and sharpish. I believe my passion for food and cooking came from this, having to cook everything from scratch, so I went to college to learn to become a proper chef.
My journey as a chef has been a pretty amazing one, I have been catering, doing product development for restaurants and been a private chef working in the beautiful Hannover terrace in Regent's Park, cooked for some lovely families, (I even cooked for a few famous people Including the infamous Madonna)  and then in 2012 alongside my adorable Dad, I opened a small Tapas restaurant, in the leafy suburbs of North London, unfortunately we had to close it after just under a year of trading due to licensing problems that could not be rectified. We lost a lot of money and it was a very difficult time emotionally as well as financially. 
The restaurant wasn't fully gluten free, however for every item on the menu there was a gluten free alternative available. We got amazing reviews from customers and local papers.
This is one of the reviews we got.
 "Even the best kept secrets can be shared with friends and so Secret Pantry deserves to be recognised as the one of the finest places for tapas within striking distance of London.
Situated across the road from the Abercorn Arms in Stanmore, this gem of a restaurant is run by award-winning chef Chantal Symons.
The dishes on Chantal's menu are traditionally Mediterranean and predominantly Spanish but she gives each dish a twist of her own. She is also specialises in gluten and dairy free cooking and there are plenty of exciting vegetarian options to choose from.
Using the freshest of ingredients sourced every day, Chantal's food combinations sing on the tongue. Her Patatas Bravas are punchy and her Alioli dip which can be served alongside potatoes, calamari or whitebait is gutsy with garlic. For starters, the Montaditos de Jamon was utterly faultless, much like bruschetta, these artisan bread toasts were topped with a generous helping of superior Serrano ham and garnished with coriander, tomatoes and olive oil. We also sampled velvety pork ribs glazed with warming orange, thyme and paprika and a divine saffron scented chickpea stew.
My husband also enjoyed the slow roasted chicken with garlic and lemon and some succulent and especially tender marinated chicken skewers.
Chantal is not afraid to be bold and passionate with your palate and her expertise in matching the flavours of herbs and spices expertly with meat and vegetables is first-class. Her signature dish is an oxtail stew with fluffy mash served in a cappuccino cup.
To finish, we couldn't resist the homemade apple strudel with cinnamon and almond ice creams, again each element bursting with piquancy and finesse.
This month's special offer is any seven dishes to share for £19.50, which is excellent value for money and you can bring you own wine. I shall be back to try the braised chorizo in red wine and Catalan sautéed spring greens, which are just two of the must-haves on this intriguing tapas menu."

The new restaurant I will open will be 100% gluten free, delicious and so good that your friends won't even know that they're eating free from food.

What We Need & What You Get

I want to raise as much money as possible to get us through the first year of trading as this is the hardest year for restaurants.

The money will go towards, 

General start up costs, licenses etc

Property rental

Refurbishment for the restaurant and kitchen

Advertising

Fair living wages for employees


The Impact

I want to open a restaurant that has a warm and inviting atmosphere, the restaurant will be in Brighton.
A 100% gluten free kitchen, so that coeliacs have somewhere totally safe to eat.
I would like to offer gluten free cookery lessons for the food that we miss and crave,
I miss Chinese food... mmm steamed dumplings, sweet and sour chicken, steamed pork buns, I want a samosa with my Indian, I want falafels inside a soft fluffy pitta and I want a proper burrito, not always a naked one! Fish and chips.....This list could go on and on. I know that many of you feel my pain! Ok so I don't really miss them that much because I can and do cook them, and I want to feed you and teach you. 
My cooking classes will be hands on small  classes, from complete beginner courses to more advanced stuff, and takeaway favourites.
How about gluten free speed dating? 
 I also want to Educate other restaurants on gluten free food, on cross contamination, show them how they can quite simply and easily change their menus to become more gluten free friendly and allergen aware.
The final part of my plan is to pop up a gluten free restaurant every so often to spread the gluten free love around the UK in due course, at festivals , etc.
You can expect tasting menus and themed evenings, plus much more.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, and we totally understand, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • We would be grateful if you could help to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign. Tell your friends, the person next to you on the train even the barista who makes your morning coffee.
  • Please feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools!

You can expect tasting menus and themed evenings, plus much more.

Tell your friends, the person next to you on the train even the barista who makes your morning coffee.

Please feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Build a WiFi car with your Kids Re-Using Stuff!

Our family has built a cell phone controlled WiFi car kit. It's pre-built and ready for a chassis, you can use your Legos, Kenex, a water bottle or even cardboard.  Having the kit pre-programmed and ready for batteries (4XAA) will give them and you extra confidence during the build, knowing this will work right away. A phone app is included and can be downloaded, or connect and use the on board web page to control the car.


Assembled WiFi Car kit (as it arrives to you)
WiFi Car Kit- screws are also included to attach the motors.



A water bottle WiFi Car and a K'nex Kar.

We want to share the fun we've had learning and using embedded processors (Like Arduino or ESP8266), this kit shows you how and why you'd want to host a webserver on portable device. We've been working on this for over a year and a half, it's been very challenging bringing this product to market, now we need you to help us get the cost down. In return, we'll ship your kit out by December 15th using Priority Mail 2-Day™ from the US Postal Service (Sorry no international shipping). We'll do everything possible to make sure your kit is delivered before Christmas. We want you to enjoy building together during the holiday break.

We are available via Skype to help out if you get stuck our SkypeID is CreateSTEAM.com. We'll also have a forum where you can share and get tips on different projects. We share our work, to help everyone, you can see the apps and the firmware for the ESP8266 micro controller at CreateSTEAM.com .

Why we need your help and what you'll get for it...

We need to be able to order parts for 100 kits to get a discount rate from our supplier. 


  • Each kit includes (1) ESP826-12E (1) H-bridge motor driver (2) motors and wheels (1) 4X AA Battery pack. Also wires and screws to complete the kit.
  • Each kit is complete and pretested
  • This is the only pre-programmed pre-wired kit we've ever seen.
  • This is the lowest priced programmable robotic kit on the market.
  • We'll ship any amount of kits ordered, we hate to disappointing people!

The Impact

This is a labor of love, for me to have shown my children how and "what it takes" to bring this product to market, along with their insistence on moving the project forward (Driving 6.5 hours each way from NJ to Ottawa, Ca to test market the first set of kits, mom joined us for tactical support), we all hope to share  :

  • Learning about technology as a "shared experience", is wonderful
  • Showing your kids how you learn and your kids will in turn showing you, is an iterative process that we've enjoyed for years.
  • Your success is our goal.

Risks & Challenges

To keep the costs down we are 3D printing the wheels, since we have one 3D printer keeping that running to print out 500 wheels is hard work, at this time we printed over 300 wheels as a head start and reduce the risk. Programming and building the kits takes time.

  • We've programmed, built and sold over 30 kits as a test (@Maker Faire Ottawa & Poughkeepsie, NY. Shout out and Thanks!)
  • We'll hire a programmer to make the second stretch goal of a game app for the car.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, we understand, but to help us and others:

  • Please share this with your friends and relatives
  • Kindly Use Indiegogo share tools!
  • Give us suggestions to help improve
  • Do you have a project you'd like us to build?
  • Feed back is appreciated

story:
I met Zayzay Kpadeh 14 years ago when he made his way from Liberia to Upper Darby, PA.  His life was threatened during the brutal and devastating 13-year civil war in Liberia and he made the decision to seek refugee status in the U.S.  He lost family and friends in this cruel war that took the lives of over 300,000 innocent men, women and children.  He was targeted for death and witnessed first hand many horrible killings.  He arrived in the U.S. with nothing and was given a job at Christ Lutheran Church where we got to know one another.

In the 14 years I have known Zayzay, he has not ceased being concerned about his family, friends and street children in Liberia as well as concern for the Liberian community in the U.S.  He has coordinated many drives to collect clothes, books, toys, computers, and other things that were shipped to Liberia.  At the same time he developed and executed a workshop for Liberians in Upper Darby/Lansdowne on understanding Biblical stories about the many peoples who left their own countries and found comfort and faith in their God.  Zayzay also has a radio talk show for Liberians, which you can hear on http://www.christianvisionbroadcastingnetworkcvbn.biz/

Zayzay just completed his Doctorate from Drew University, and he is now the Reverend Dr. Zayzay Kpadeh.  I am so proud of him and consider him a close friend.  I want to help him raise funds to return to Liberia and make an on-the-ground assessment of the social service and educational needs of Liberians outside Monrovia.  He will also touch base with the Rotary Club of Monrovia to identify synergies for Liberian projects. Zayzay needs $3,000 more to make the trip home and conduct the needs assessment in person.  His target timeframe for the trip is October.  Helping others has been his life’s mission.  Please help Zayzay to continue helping others by making a donation to this humble campaign for a  social justice ministry project to Liberia.


Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
I met Zayzay Kpadeh 14 years ago when he made his way from
Liberia to Upper Darby, PA.  His life was
threatened during the brutal and devastating 13-year civil war in Liberia and
he made the decision to seek refugee status in the U.S.  He lost family and friends in this cruel war
that took the lives of over 300,000 innocent men, women and children.  He was targeted for death and witnessed first
hand many horrible killings.  He arrived
in the U.S. with nothing and was given a job at Christ Lutheran Church where we
got to know one another. 
In the 14 years I have known Zayzay, he has not ceased being
concerned about his family, friends and street children in Liberia as well as
concern for the Liberian community in the U.S. 
He has coordinated many drives to collect clothes, books, toys,
computers, and other things that were shipped to Liberia.  At the same time he developed and executed a
workshop for Liberians in Upper Darby/Lansdowne on understanding Biblical
stories about the many peoples who left their own countries and found comfort
and faith in their God.  Zayzay also
has a radio talk show for Liberians, which you can hear on http://www.christianvisionbroadcastingnetworkcvbn.biz/
Zayzay just completed his Doctorate from Drew University,
and he is now the Reverend Dr. Zayzay Kpadeh. 
I am so proud of him and consider him a close friend.  I want to help him raise funds to return to
Liberia and make an on-the-ground assessment of the social service and
educational needs of Liberians outside Monrovia.  He will also touch base with the Rotary Club
of Monrovia to identify synergies for Liberian projects. Zayzay needs $3,000
more to make the trip home and conduct the needs assessment in person.  His target timeframe for the trip is
October.  Helping others has been his
life’s mission.  Please help Zayzay to
continue helping others by making a donation to this humble campaign for a  social justice ministry project to Liberia. 

Short Summary Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:  Introduce yourself and your background. Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you. Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.  Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?   What We Need & What You Get Break it down for folks in more detail:  Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.  Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited! Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.    The Impact Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:  Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world. Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one). Make it real for people and build trust.    Risks & Challenges  People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.  Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles. Describe your plan for solving these challenges.    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!   And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hi, thanks for dropping by our page.

We are Paul and Teresa of Wild Dharma.

Wild Dharma is an eco resort, nature sanctuary and yoga and meditation retreat centre situated on the wild and beautiful west coast of Palawan in the Philippines.

We are committed to development that integrates and includes the personal, social and environmental needs of everyone involved, from our guests to our staff and, in particular, the local communities in the area.

The local people live in extreme poverty which makes day to day life very difficult for them. This is especially evident in the health situation. They have very limited access to healthcare and education. 
For this reason, one of the first things we will be doing here is building a health clinic for them.

 Wild Dharma will rise in stages and while we work towards being able to achieve our longer term goals, including more integral social health solutions in the area, we feel we cannot put off the immediate needs for healthcare.  

So we are seeking your help to raise funds for the health clinic.

JOIN US IN CREATING A HEALTHIER FUTURE FOR THE PEOPLE OF PALAWAN


   

         

Paul Wooden and Teresa Tirol are creating Wild Dharma because we are both passionate about participating in life in a way that contributes to a better world and we understand that more and more people are feeling the same way. 

Wild Dharma, along with its eco resort and yoga, meditation and health programs is dedicated to projects that promote personal wellbeing, social responsibility and environmental sustainability;  a development that adds value to local communities and thus provide opportunities for families and children here in Palawan to have a better future.  

Paul has been studying, practicing and teaching yoga and meditation for over 25 years. Having run a successful yoga school and healing centre in Melbourne, Australia for many years he has since been working towards the creating the more socially integrated vision of Wild Dharma.

Teresa is a GP and spent two years working as a community doctor here in Palawan and has since been working towards more effective ways to serve the local health needs here. She is also an avid foodie with a keen interest in the relationship between diet and health in Palawan.


We need your help to raise the USD$60,000.

Your contributions will help us establish a simple health clinic building with necessary equipment and outreach and the first stages of a solar power system to power it. Any extra money will go towards the renovation of our very basic kitchen.

This health clinic will be the first stage in our longer term vision of a more integral approach to all the health concerns in the area. This includes a chronic poverty induced dis-empowerment and poor education opportunities.

The Numbers


The clinic will provide the sorely needed healthcare in the area. 

Teresa worked in Palawan as a community GP for two years and knows firsthand the many health issues the local people face.  

Most, if not all, children here suffer from malnutrition. This compromised condition gives rise to stunted growth, skin infections, and tuberculosis among other things. These are are preventable and treatable conditions.


                  

In adults, heart attacks and strokes result from unchecked hypertension. Pneumonia, diabetes and tuberculosis also commonly go undiagnosed. 
These are are preventable and treatable conditions.

Nobody would die from these ailments if they had access to treatment.

There is a limited health station further up the coast, but with limited resources locals cannot afford to travel let alone pay for any required treatment if they do make it there.  

Access to healthcare in these poor and far flung villages is difficult, if not impossible. If you don’t have money here, you don’t receive health care. It’s as simple as that. 

This serious lack of access to healthcare contributes to this vicious cycle of poverty and disempowerment. This is costing young people their shot at a better future and, in some cases, it is costing young lives. 

Our aim is to change this situation and with your help we can get started by attending to immediate health issues while we work towards more integrated solutions.


By supporting our small clinic the local communities will have access to free health care. Often simply addressing things early staves off problems later.

With this health clinic, we hope to provide primary healthcare: medical checkups, treatments, as well as provide basic medications and address food/nutrition issues in the local gradeschool. 

This health clinic is the first step towards a more integral health program in the area.  This will establish a platform for our social and environmental programs which will eventually integrate education and livelihood options that will empower the locals and give them opportunities for a healthier future.

But for now, our main focus in on the health clinic and the immediate health concerns here.

     


 Your help is deeply appreciated and to show our appreciation we have set out some insanely good value rewards for you.

We are offering great deals on holidays and retreats here with us in Palawan. We would really love you to make Wild Dharma your next holiday where you can not only enjoy the stunning beauty of Palawan but also see for yourself how your contribution is giving back to the local communities.

Treat yourself or buy an amazing Christmas present for friends and family.

A Christmas present that gives twice. First to your gift recipient and then to the local people in our area here in Palawan.. So please check them out. 

YOUR NEXT HOLIDAY WILL BRING REAL VALUE TO THE LOCAL COMMUNITIES

      THESE ARE OUR PERKS    

Please note all prices are in USD                                               


We understand that not everyone is in a position to contribute financially. If you support our project, you can still help in the following ways:

  • Spread the word on Facebook and Twitter (@WildDharmaPH)
  • By inviting your friends to our site, or re-posting
  • Use the Indiegogo share tool
Thank you for being part of the Wild Dharma vision and helping make life a little better for the people of Palawan.

story:
YOMADO is a group of young girls and boys in Rwanda that decided to do the difference in their community and to be part of the change that people need.

With this aim we founded an NGO based in Nyamata, Bugesera District, Rwanda. With YOMADO, the "Youth Mentoring Ambassadors for Development Organization" we have been running projects helping our communities to find ways to improve their lifes.

This time we are asking your help to make the difference in the life of a category of persons often left behind and to assure their potential as human beings and citizens is fully explored. 

Help us to train 90 women affected by HIV/AIDS to the tailoring professions and to create 3 cooperatives in which they will work together to get a brighter future for their families and their communities.

Women affected by HIV and AIDS are generally condamned to live poor lifes and their children are destined to not attend school, preventing their families to find a way out of destitution.

Our aim is to help 90 women and their families to get a permanent way out from the poverty caused by their sickness and by the discrimination coming from it.

With 10.000 dollars you will help us to create three training centers in different areas of Rwanda that will train 30 women each for 7 months in the tailoring profession.

During the training period the women will be also introduced to management and businnes skills to be prepared when the starting point of a new life will come, the day in which their training period will be over and their cooperatives officialy lunched!

Your donations will help us to donate all the materials that the women will need to study and open their cooperatives, to hire the 3 trainers for 7 months of courses and to legally register and lunch the cooperatives.

To make some examples on how your donation will make the difference:

  • with 10 dollars you donate 6 meters of fabric to use during the course,

  • with 60 dollars you hire a professional trainer for a month,

  • with 70 dollars you cover the rent of a training center for a month,

  • with 100 dollars you donate a sewing machine.

Another way to help us is to spread this campaign to your friends and contacts!

We count on the help of each of you!

Our facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/yomado.official

story:
SHORT STORY

We all know what is going on in Greece, just type in Google "Greece crisis" to get hundreds of thousands of pages describing the problem. This crisis has huge consequences for the inhabitants of this beautiful country.

- Stock Exchange (ASE) fell by 83%

- The number of employed persons fell from 4.6 millions to 3.75 millions

- The unemployment rate rose from 8% to 26%. Unemployment among people under 25 years is 58%.

- Huge public debt

- An increase in taxation

- €60 daily cash withdrawal limit in banks

- Increase of the prices of all goods and services

- Drastic reduction of the standard of life


WHAT WE NEED

Therefore, we want to help ordinary citizens of this country and give them even a few euros, for us it is not much, while for many a citizen of Greece, this is sufficient to improve living conditions ...

It's hard to set a budget for this type of action, every euros counts, but the more we collect, the more people will be able to get help. You can help not only by donating money, here is a brief offer for those interested:

- Share our project on Twitter, FB - it's free and makes a big impact

- Spread the word about our project among your friends, at school, work

- Parcelbroker have teamed up with Greek charity Desmos to allow you to send care packages completely FREE. You can send a package of food weighing up to 10kgs to Greek charity Desmos. The charity will then distribute the care packages to families in need of them.  for more information visit https://www.parcelbroker.co.uk/feedgreece

- Instead of vacation on Ibiza or other expensive place, travel to Greece, and donate to its economy.


WHAT YOU GET

We want as much of the money collected as possible to go to its target audience, so we try to incur a negligible cost. However, we do not want to leave you with nothing, so every donor will be issued a donor certificate. We expect several versions of certificates depending on the size of donation. In addition, for those who will make donations of more than 5,000 we plan a 7 day trip to Greece - All Inclusive (only for European citizens).




WHERE MONEY GO

The money will be given during a street action, to the Greek people, everyone will be able to receive some part of funds... We will visit 20 cities (please enter in a comments which city you would like us to visit, 20 most popular will be included on a our list).


WHY WE WILL NOT GIVE MONEY TO CHARITIES?

By supporting our actions you want to help the Greeks, ordinary people, not institutions. In case of charity institutions, in reality only a few % of the entire amount will go to ordinary people because of bank charges, administrative costs, and the subsequent costs of an organization that wants to pass money to people. So why to provide money for the banks etc.? Give it for the ordinary people instead.


ABOUT ME

My name is Matty, I'm 22 years old and I decided to organize this project because of the evil and human problems I see all over the world. No matter how old are you, and who you are. Starting from yourself you can change the world...


You can contact us on Twitter @Greece_Project or by e-mail shown in profile

From people to people

story:
We Love Books & Coffee

It is not just our business, it's our passion.

We're dedicated to bringing the Scottsville community the very best in locally roasted coffee (Shark Mountain Coffee Co. & Lexington Coffee Roasters), and pride ourselves in crafting delicious house-made pastries. 

Our eclectic book selection is carefully curated with the community in mind. From children's books to local interest, history and religion, we hope that you're always able to find a book that piques your interest. 

We opened the Scottsville chapter of 'Baine's Books & Coffee' nearly three (3) years ago with little more than an innate intuition that a "Baine's" would work in small, historic Scottsville, Va. On November 30th, 2015 we will be entering our 4th year of business! We are super excited about this enormous step and want to celebrate by making even larger strides in year four. To make these strides we need to accomplish three (3) key phases that will help us continue our mission of bringing good books and great coffee to the Scottsville community. 


Baine's Scottsville --- Project 3.0

PHASE #1: EXTERIOR REVAMP

Let's be real. Our store front looks like a house. Not a business. A house. And there's good reason for this, considering the fact that it was, initially, built as a house. Lifelong Scottsville resident, Edna Anderson used to spend many a day in our shop, since it was once her grandmother's home. How cool is that?!

Don't get us wrong. We like the house look. It makes our presence on Valley Street unique. However, it's incredibly hard for people who are not already familiar with 'Baine's Scottsville' to notice that we're here. There's only so much that a neon sign and an A-frame chalkboard can do, especially when they are only present during open business hours. When we're closed, people simply see 'a house.'

The plan was always to have a hanging sign, but once we got the business up and running our focus shifted to the interior, and outdoor signage just never got off the ground.

The first portion of funds that this campaign is set to raise will go toward enhancing our storefront, helping it look a little less like a house and a little more like a bona fide business. (See rendering below)

Oh yeah! That's better :)


PHASE #2 : EQUIPMENT UPGRADE

There's no denying that we need an equipment upgrade. We are dedicated to brewing all of our coffee manually, so that you receive the best, most flavorful cup every time you visit.
Manually brewing coffee takes time as it is, but it could go a lot faster with the help of a hot water tower. We currently have to wait for our hot water kettle to reach temperature before we are able to even begin the batch brewing process. With a brand new hot water tower we'd be able to begin brewing in the time that it takes to grind the coffee...pretty quick! This will allow our customers to be served in a much speedier fashion.

(Coffee brewing at its finest.)

PHASE #3: LIGHTING, LIGHTING, LIGHTING!

Lighting plays a huge role in a space's presentation. We want our shop's atmosphere to be both inviting and relaxing, which we found to be insanely difficult with three glaring florescent lights right above the espresso bar. We started leaving these three lights off two years ago, and customers immediately noticed and applauded the difference.

Since then, we've fashioned a series of lamps around the area. They help with the ambiance, but do little to fully light the space. We'd really like to replace the florescent fixtures with energy efficient, directional LEDs, so that the espresso bar can be fully lit in all of its shot pulling, milk steaming glory!


The Impact

Your contribution makes a difference! It allows us to continue our mission. We want to bring the best in quality books and coffee to the Scottsville community, while providing a place for people to gather, read, meet, relax and foster community.

And what is an Indiegogo Campaign without perks?! We've got some amazing perks lined up for each level of support. We hope that you will take advantage of these stellar rewards. It's our way of saying "THANK YOU!!!"


Other Ways You Can Help

Share, share, share! Let others know about the campaign. Share it on Facebook and other forms of social media. Or just spread the word the old-fashioned way.

B&W photos: Elizabeth Liebermann, 2015
