  Baine's Scottsville --- Project 3.0 

PHASE #1: EXTERIOR REVAMP
Let's be real. Our store front looks like a house. Not a business. A house. And there's good reason for this, considering the fact that it was, initially, built as a house. Lifelong Scottsville resident, Edna Anderson used to spend many a day in our shop, since it was once her grandmother's home. How cool is that?!
Don't get us wrong. We like the house look. It makes our presence on Valley Street unique. However, it's incredibly hard for people who are not already familiar with 'Baine's Scottsville' to notice that we're here. There's only so much that a neon sign and an A-frame chalkboard can do, especially when they are only present during open business hours. When we're closed, people simply see 'a house.'


The plan was always to have a hanging sign, but once we got the business up and running our focus shifted to the interior, and outdoor signage just never got off the ground. 
The first portion of funds that this campaign is set to raise will go toward enhancing our storefront, helping it look a little less like a house and a little more like a bona fide business. (See rendering below)


Oh yeah! That's better :)PHASE #2 : EQUIPMENT UPGRADEThere's no denying that we need an equipment upgrade. We are dedicated to brewing all of our coffee manually, so that you receive the best, most flavorful cup every time you visit. Manually brewing coffee takes time as it is, but it could go a lot faster with the help of a hot water tower. We currently have to wait for our hot water kettle to reach temperature before we are able to even begin the batch brewing process. With a brand new hot water tower we'd be able to begin brewing in the time that it takes to grind the coffee...pretty quick! This will allow our customers to be served in a much speedier fashion. 
(Coffee brewing at its finest.)PHASE #3: LIGHTING, LIGHTING, LIGHTING!Lighting plays a huge role in a space's presentation. We want our shop's atmosphere to be both inviting and relaxing, which we found to be insanely difficult with three glaring florescent lights right above the espresso bar. We started leaving these three lights off two years ago, and customers immediately noticed and applauded the difference. Since then, we've fashioned a series of lamps around the area. They help with the ambiance, but do little to fully light the space. We'd really like to replace the florescent fixtures with energy efficient, directional LEDs, so that the espresso bar can be fully lit in all of its shot pulling, milk steaming glory! 


 
The Impact
Your contribution makes a difference! It allows us to continue our mission. We want to bring the best in quality books and coffee to the Scottsville community, while providing a place for people to gather, read, meet, relax and foster community. And what is an Indiegogo Campaign without perks?! We've got some amazing perks lined up for each level of support. We hope that you will take advantage of these stellar rewards. It's our way of saying "THANK YOU!!!" 
  
Other Ways You Can HelpShare, share, share! Let others know about the campaign. Share it on Facebook and other forms of social media. Or just spread the word the old-fashioned way. 
B&W photos: Elizabeth Liebermann, 2015

story:
Hello, my name is Pastor Alonzo Bell and I am the new Pastor of Martin Evans Missionary Baptist Church.  I have a vision to revitalize the community surrounding the church because this is a special place and the children deserve an environment that is conducive to learning, growing, and succeeding.  Part of this plan includes renovating an abandoned Detroit Public School that's across the street from the church.  This school is very special because I attended many parent teacher conferences and graduations there.  This is the school attended by my oldest daughter when it was called Rosa Parks Middle School.  Many members of our congregation attended there as well. I grew up in both the church that I am Pastoring and in the neighborhood where the school and the church are located.  I fully recognize that its by the Grace of God that I made it this far.  If I did not have the help of concerned community members and the programs that were offered in the schools and recreation centers, I don't know where I would be right now.  Presently, there are no programs or recreation centers to provide help and support to struggling families with children, and  these children deserve what my peers and I had or even better, and that's why we must save this school from becoming another useless eyesore in the community and use it to help build up the children and their families.

When they closed the school down in 2013, the boiler system and the plumbing system was vandalized and damaged.  We have began repairing the damage but we have a long way to go.  We are able to use the classrooms and the gym to provide productive activities for the youth, but only in the summer.  Every winter we must close down because there is no heat and many of our children are left with nothing productive to do during this time.  We need this building open all year round and we need it fully functioning to reach our goals of reducing crime and increasing productivity.  Our goal for this building is to use it as a centerpiece to the  revitalization of this neighborhood and a beacon of hope to those who have suffered so much loss.  Please help us reach our goals as we launch WEEKLY and BI-WEEKLY campaigns to renovate this building PIECE by PIECE. My entire plan is below:

REDEEM DETROIT NEIGHBORHOOD REVITALIZATION STRATEGY:

1.  Project Noah: We give support to unemployed women with children by giving them a place to come and learn a vocational skill that will allow them to earn an income either by gaining traditional employment or by starting their own businesses.  Some of these vocational skills will consist of:

·  CNA Training

·  Medical Billing

·  Culinary Arts

·  Hospitality/Waitress

·  Clerical/Filing/Customer Service

·  Sewing/Alterations/Fashion

·  Graphic Arts

·  Event Planning

·  Social Media/Marketing and Advertising

2.  After having hands on, paid, training in some of these vocational areas, the graduates can even work in the businesses that are already established in the Redeem Center or rooms can be designated for business incubators for the most dedicated students to start their own businesses.  They will pay rent based off of their revenue.  These are the businesses that will be already running in the Center  where the women will get paid internships:

a.  Restaurant (Cafeteria)

b.  Dollar Store

c.  Beauty Supply/Women’s Clothing Store/Children’s Warehouse

d.  Daycare

e.  Children’s Birthday Parties

f.  Gym Rental

3.  These experiences along with classes on employment etiquette will help build their resumes and work ethic.  Graduates of our program will be in high demand as we develop employment relationships with Local businesses such as Applebees, Chilis, Coney Island, Bettermade, Faygo, Nursing Homes, Hospitals, etc.  Our students will also have voluntary internship opportunities with these community businesses.

4.  Along with their employment training, they will also learn the following:

a.  Building Credit

b.  Home Ownership

c.  Parenting Best Practices

d.  Conflict/Resolution

e.  Life skills

f.  Mentorship

g.  Networking and Building Relationships

h.  GED Prep if needed

5.  While they are in class learning and training, their children will be in our premium daycare learning a second language and getting the necessary tools to be on grade level or higher by the time they enter elementary school.  We will have income-based daycare fees or we will be able to bill Medicaid to cover expenses.

6.  We will lease space out to a clinic that specializes in women and children who accepts Medicaid and we will have a WIC office as well.

7.  On the Third Floor there will be income-based, temporary, housing for those who are in desperate need of shelter and who enroll and excel in our program. Rent can also be substituted by community service hours.

8.  Redeem Detroit will develop a COOP Housing Development around the school that will eliminate the blighted homes and vacant lots and make room for the graduates of our programs.  This will repopulate the area and pave the way for a new Elementary School for the Children who are in our Daycare.

a.  This will be a premiere school because not only will our children be ready academically and socially, we will have a relationship with their parents because both the parent and the child came through our program!  We are the ones who are responsible for training and employing the parent and we are the ones who taught their children – minimum drama, maximum learning!

9.  The women in our program will be encouraged to tell the child’s father about our Men’s Construction trades Program (VIP – Vocational Interest Program) which will be held in the building across the street – The Eastern District Development Center.  The men will also learn different vocational skills such as:

a.  Plumbing

b.  Carpentry

c.  Electrical

d.  Landscaping

e.  Building Maintenance

f.  Masonry

g.  Window Instillation

h.  Auto Mechanics

10.  The Men will also have opportunities to start their own businesses and to work in other businesses owned by Redeem Detroit such as:

a.  Airport related enterprises

  i.  Wash Airplanes

  ii.  Airplane Mechanic

  iii.  Manufacturing some airplane parts

  iv.  Airplane Related Retail and Services

b.  Landscaping

c.  Moving

d.  Transportation

e.  Handyman Contracting

f.  Auto Repair

11.  The men will have paid internships maintaining the COOP repairs and building maintenance as well as working with the local businesses in their areas of training.  In addition, they will also be taught about:

a.  Fatherhood

b.  Male Responsibility

c.  GED Prep

d.  Conflict/Resolution

e.  Networking and Building Relationships

f.  Leadership

g.  Building credit and Home Ownership

12.  The men will also have houses that they will rehab and eventually own and live in 

(CWFR Program).  Rent will be income based or can be substituted with volunteer work and classes.

13.  Redeem Detroit will own a car dealership in which cars are donated or bought at a reasonable price and used for training.  After being fixed they will be sold to our students and the public or given freely to the top achievers.

14.  With both parents being educated in a new way and having a new perspective, they may see things different and Unite!

15.  After our courses and training, hopefully marriages and families will be developed as well as self-sustaining neighborhoods and economies which will lead to low unemployment rates and low crime rates.

16.  There will be after school activities available to the children in the community as well.

17.  This model can be repeated using abandoned properties in each neighborhood.

WHAT WE HAVE DONE SO FAR

1.  As you can see through the various community awards from elected officials, the channel 7 20/20 award, the pictures, the videos, and the letters of recommendations, we have been laying the foundation to revitalize the Gratiot/Conner Neighborhood (Airport District).

2.  Redeem Detroit has built relationships with many of the parents and children in the neighborhood through our summer and after school programs.  We have also built relationships with the other non-profits and Block Clubs.

3.  We have purchased 3 commercial properties and 3 residential homes (All within 500ft from each other) where we have been running some of our programs as best as we could. 

a.  Duke Ellington School Building (The Redeem Center)

b.  True Value Building (Eastern District Development Center)

c.  Getz Printing Building (The Ark)

4.  We have purchased the following equipment to help start the businesses for our programs:

a.  Box Truck

b.  Tow Truck

c.  16 Yard Trailer

d.  Pickup Truck

e.  45 Passenger School Bus

f.  55 Passenger Charter Bus

g.  Industrial Lawnmower

h.  Small auto and carpentry tools

5.  We have serviced over 500 children and 150 Adults over the past five years. 

6.  80% of this has been done by the financial contributions of less than 5 people.

7.  95% of the work has been done by approximately 10 people who volunteer.

WHAT DO WE NEED?

1.  We need more volunteers.

2.  We need a heating and plumbing system in our School Building because someone broke in and stole the pipes and radiators.

3.  Financial donations to pay skilled staff members and teachers

4.  Someone who can advise us on how to use what we have to start the businesses and generate income.

5.  Once the buildings are fully operational and the businesses are started, we can use the revenue to run our programs and we will be self-sustaining.

story:
Yağhane: The Realization of a Dream

Three years ago as a young couple, we came to Datça from Istanbul to realize our dreams. We opened a pension which is also working as a yoga center and workshop house. Our building was used as an olive oil press in the old days, and this is why we call it “Yağhane”. It also gave its name to the street next to it. Currently, it is a stone building which has six rooms and designed for you to feel home. Many workshops and yoga trainings were hosted for three years. 

Now we come to turnout. We are in the last month to pay our last arrears. So this is a campaing to pay our arrears. This is also a pre-sales of a holiday. Each donation will be rewarded with a holiday.

We need around 30.000€ to pay our arrears to ex-owners. After that our pension will continue to host all alternative ideas and arts.

You could check Yağhane from www.yaghane.net and facebook.com/yaghanedatca

story:
Thank you for visiting our indiegogo page! You can help support local business  by helping to open the first float center in Shreveport! If you suffer from any type of illness, chronic pain, or just daily life stresses, floating is for you! We believe in our community and we want to help others so  We will donate 5% of all funds raised to St. Jude's Children's Hospital and 5% to the Shriners Hospital of Shreveport! 


So, what exactly is floating?

We're glad you asked! Floating, which is also known as sensory deprivation, is the practice of getting in a float tank (just larger than a bathtub in most cases) filled with water and lying on your back with the intention of reducing sensory input. The water in a float tank is usually 10’, but no more than 12’ deep. Pharmaceutical grade epsom salt is added to the water (800-1,200 lbs.) By adding the epsom salt we achieve the specific gravity of between 1.265 and 1.285 (the dead sea has specific gravity of 1.24!) This creates buoyancy so you float effortlessly, thus removing the feeling of gravity from your body. The water is heated to the same temperature as your skin which is 93.5 F. The inside of the tank is pitch black and soundproof. The person floating normally wears earplugs, and their ears are submerged under water as well.


So, why floating?

The point of floating is to remove or reduce sensory input to the brain allowing the left, more dominant hemisphere of your brain to take a break. When this is accomplished the right side is able to stretch its legs. Removing your sensory input allows your body to RELAX and actually LOWERS cortisol levels (the chemical component of stress.) Your brain also releases HIGHER levels dopamine and endorphins, neurotransmitters of HAPPINESS. 

In the tank you are ESCAPING gravity, imagine how relaxed you could be in outer space(providing you can breath and all.) When you float your body doesn't have to do things like support your weight, or regulate temperature so your brain is able to send all of its resources to where they are needed for HEALING. 

Another benefit of floating is the fact that after a while in the tank your brain shifts to producing Theta brain waves. The Theta state is a level of consciousness that can take people who meditate years to achieve. It is the state we are in just before we go to sleep at night and just after we wake up. It is also seen in children. 

Floating is a natural way to relieve chronic pain from things like arthritis and fibromyalgia. People with sore muscles and achy bones also get benefits. Due to the freedom of gravity your spine actually lengthens an inch.

EPSON SALTS in the tank replenish your skin and your body absorbs the magnesium, helping with the deficiency most of us have due to depleted levels in our soil.
Well, what are the benefits of floating?
The list is so long and thorough, basically everyone can benefit from floating in some fashion! 
  • Pain relief, whether caused by injury, such as a broken bone or a chronic illness, such as fibromyalgia, or arthritis.
  • Athletes can reap great benefits from floating as their muscles and injuries heal faster.
  • Women going through pregnancy can also find great relief in a float tank! Just the idea of being weightless can seem unreal to someone suddenly carrying 30 extra pounds, but they can also find relief from sciatic pain, back and joint pain, and just an overall relaxed feeling.
  • Stress relief; this is a very broad category, as stress can be the cause for so many other issues and illness. The relief from stress can help strengthen the immune system, but also relieve hypertension, depression, anxiety, compulsion disorders, and tension headaches. 
  • Emotion pain is very real, and disorders such as PTSD, and postpartum depression can find very real relief in a floating environment.
  • Sleeping problems, including insomnia; you're brain is tricked into thinking you are sleeping, and drifts into a theta state, which is the most relaxed state of sleep your body can reach. 
  • Enhanced creativity, and just an overall well-being.
This is a short list. A little research into sensory deprivation can reveal an endless number of problems and issues floating benefits. 

The Plan

Emerge Float Spa will be so much more than just a float center! James and Christin want Emerge to be an all around wellness center and an experience you can't find in shreveport, where there will be a number of ways to achieve a healthier and more relaxed state of being! In addition to floating where you'll be able to choose between state of the art rooms or a Samadhi tank, other services will include massage rooms, a single and couples room and Himalayan salt saunas! These great creations work like a regular sauna, heating up and causing the user to sweat out toxins. Salt saunas have a one-up, however, helping to replenish the body by heating up pink himalayan rocks and releasing the essential 84 minerals and trace elements our bodies need. We will also offer bottled health drinks, and health books for those ready to dive into a healthier lifestyle! After you experience a range of relaxation methods, we hope you'll stay awhile longer and experience our relaxation room! A cool, dimly lit room, it will offer additional services, like an oxygen bar, and a RIFE machine. The RIFE machine uses specific frequencies from the 3500 frequency list book to stimulate a altering of bioresonance in the cells, reversing the change caused by the disease. Transmitting these frequencies over the same electrodes ( vibration straps) over a period of time generates healing signals that have the curative effect. With this method of treatment, practitioners claim to be able to detect and cure a variety of diseases and addictions without drugs. Finished off with comfy chairs, books and saltwater aquarium, we hope you'll agree its the perfect place to finish up the ultimate relaxation experience!   
Perks
T-shirts, coupons and gift cards will be sent as soon as our campaign ends, while floating, massage and the sauna will be available once we open our doors. Our goal is to be open around July of 2016!

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest obstacle is funding, as this is our start-up business, however, that's why we've created this page! Helping us reach our goal will not only give us the start-up funding we need, for possible loans, but will also help our investors see just how serious we are about this!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute funds-wise, we completely understand! It's 100% free to share this page with your social media accounts and help us to get the word out! We'd love to reach as many people as possible so that they too can start to experience the benefits of floating!

Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

The point of floating is to remove or reduce sensory input to the brain allowing the left, more dominant hemisphere of your brain to take a break. When this is accomplished the right side is able to stretch its legs. Removing your sensory input allows your body to RELAX and actually LOWERS cortisol levels (the chemical component of stress.) Your brain also releases HIGHER levels dopamine and endorphins, neurotransmitters of HAPPINESS. In the tank you are ESCAPING gravity, imagine how relaxed you could be in outer space(providing you can breath and all.) When you float your body doesn't have to do things like support your weight, or regulate temperature so your brain is able to send all of its resources to where they are needed for HEALING. Another benefit of floating is the fact that after a while in the tank your brain shifts to producing Theta brain waves. The Theta state is a level of consciousness that can take people who meditate years to achieve. It is the state we are in just before we go to sleep at night and just after we wake up. It is also seen in children. Floating is a natural way to relieve chronic pain from things like arthritis and fibromyalgia. People with sore muscles and achy bones also get benefits. Due to the freedom of gravity your spine actually lengthens an inch.EPSON SALTS in the tank replenish your skin and your body absorbs the magnesium, helping with the deficiency most of us have due to depleted levels in our soil.
Well, what are the benefits of floating?The list is so long and thorough, basically everyone can benefit from floating in some fashion! 

Pain relief, whether caused by injury, such as a broken bone or a chronic illness, such as fibromyalgia, or arthritis.
Athletes can reap great benefits from floating as their muscles and injuries heal faster.
Women going through pregnancy can also find great relief in a float tank! Just the idea of being weightless can seem unreal to someone suddenly carrying 30 extra pounds, but they can also find relief from sciatic pain, back and joint pain, and just an overall relaxed feeling.
Stress relief; this is a very broad category, as stress can be the cause for so many other issues and illness. The relief from stress can help strengthen the immune system, but also relieve hypertension, depression, anxiety, compulsion disorders, and tension headaches. 
Emotion pain is very real, and disorders such as PTSD, and postpartum depression can find very real relief in a floating environment.
Sleeping problems, including insomnia; you're brain is tricked into thinking you are sleeping, and drifts into a theta state, which is the most relaxed state of sleep your body can reach. 
Enhanced creativity, and just an overall well-being.

This is a short list. A little research into sensory deprivation can reveal an endless number of problems and issues floating benefits. 

The Plan
Emerge Float Spa will be so much more than just a float center! James and Christin want Emerge to be an all around wellness center and an experience you can't find in shreveport, where there will be a number of ways to achieve a healthier and more relaxed state of being! In addition to floating where you'll be able to choose between state of the art rooms or a Samadhi tank, other services will include massage rooms, a single and couples room and Himalayan salt saunas! These great creations work like a regular sauna, heating up and causing the user to sweat out toxins. Salt saunas have a one-up, however, helping to replenish the body by heating up pink himalayan rocks and releasing the essential 84 minerals and trace elements our bodies need. We will also offer bottled health drinks, and health books for those ready to dive into a healthier lifestyle! After you experience a range of relaxation methods, we hope you'll stay awhile longer and experience our relaxation room! A cool, dimly lit room, it will offer additional services, like an oxygen bar, and a RIFE machine. The RIFE machine uses specific frequencies from the 3500 frequency list book to stimulate a altering of bioresonance in the cells, reversing the change caused by the disease. Transmitting these frequencies over the same electrodes ( vibration straps) over a period of time generates healing signals that have the curative effect. With this method of treatment, practitioners claim to be able to detect and cure a variety of diseases and addictions without drugs. Finished off with comfy chairs, books and saltwater aquarium, we hope you'll agree its the perfect place to finish up the ultimate relaxation experience!   PerksT-shirts, coupons and gift cards will be sent as soon as our campaign ends, while floating, massage and the sauna will be available once we open our doors. Our goal is to be open around July of 2016!
    Risks & Challenges Our biggest obstacle is funding, as this is our start-up business, however, that's why we've created this page! Helping us reach our goal will not only give us the start-up funding we need, for possible loans, but will also help our investors see just how serious we are about this!
    Other Ways You Can Help If you can't contribute funds-wise, we completely understand! It's 100% free to share this page with your social media accounts and help us to get the word out! We'd love to reach as many people as possible so that they too can start to experience the benefits of floating!
Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Hi, I'm Samantha and am currently a resident on the Westside section of Los Angeles. I volunteer within other organizations within the communities and there is absolutely no way not to notice the large homeless population along our coast. Many notice, many ignore and while I cannot fix the problem we face here in Los Angeles County, I can at least bring some dignity to those in need by distributing tangible items versus throwing cash at the issue at hand.

Ladies (and Gents), every month Aunt Flo comes to visit. Now, think about if you didn’t have the financial resources to buy feminine hygiene products? Think about if the only barrier you had were cloth rags or toilet paper found in public restrooms to block the blood stream. Think about how amazing it feels at the end of the day to take your bra off, but then imagine how uncomfortable it would be to walk around all day without one. Or, be wearing a bra that does not fit properly. Now, imagine being outside for prolong periods of time with cold feet, or walking around in snug shoes without socks. Then, factor this in on top of not having basic needs such as food or shelter. Shelters and food banks do amazing work and I am not here to step on their toes, rather I am working to supplement and provide some dignity and comfort to these ladies (and men). These small things such as tampons, pads, bras, and even socks, things we all take for granted, can provide a small amount of dignity and comfort to others in need.

We continue to help the less fortunate in foreign countries. Yes, I am human, I feel for them, but we need to open our eyes and look within our own communities to see what's right in front of us. While I cannot fix the homeless population, we as a collective can provide dignity to these women (and men). I understand many of you do not have the time or knowledge of how to help. I also understand that this is an after thought to your own obligations to yourself and family. This is why I am here. I can purchase these items, deliver to shelters, distribute to the population I see daily along the streets and beaches. I am ok with doing the work, but I cannot fund this project on my own. The reality is, I know for many it is easier to donate money and have others do the work. You can feel good, maybe share your experience with others and have others want to feel good? The cycle of helping and being kind is endless.

Unfortunately, feminine hygiene products are not cheap nor are they readily accessible to the non-homeless population, so if I can provide that one thing we all take for granted we are moving in the right direction. ALL funds will be used to purchase, donate and distribute the feminine hygiene products, ladies undergarments and socks, no matter what level we reach! Thankfully, I am a penny pincher and know to look for sales and coupons to make the funds stretch. Coupon clippers and sale shoppers, let’s talk. These items I am looking to distribute are always in need and there will never be enough as long as there is a homeless population. I understand many of you looking at this campaign do not live along the Los Angeles coastline. Yet, there is no reason we cannot make this project grow into other cities. Many people have crowd-funded and started nonprofits focused on similar ideas throughout the country. Join the movement.

The most important way to help is to get the word out. I am the first person to understand that you may not be able to contribute to this campaign financially, but your support through social media shares and word of mouth is greatly appreciated. Please take the time to share this campaign and most importantly talk about it.  I have set up Facebook, Instagram and Twitter accounts to get the word out and share ideas and coupons? In addition, if you are local and feel more comfortable donating these items we can make an arrangement for drop-offs. We can all make a difference in someone's life and bring some dignity to our communities!

Thank you.

story:
Short Summary

The vision of FunDaze Entertainment Center LLC starts & ends with the community. South Carolina is ranked 3 in the US with childhood obesity. Play is an essential part of childhood development. The physical benefits of FunDaze include the development of muscle groups, motor skills, hand-eye coordination and dexterity. The social and educational benefits include exercising the imagination, abstract think and problem solving techniques. Play also improves communication, language and learning skills while building self-confidence. Making children happy & healthy is our passion. We have visited many family fun centers & there is nothing like it in the Pee Dee area. The campaign is to help bring the fun industry to our area. Giving children a safe place to experience something new & exciting. When you contribute to our FunDaze Entertainment Center LLC, you will be a part of the foundation that made it possible to bring families together for healthy fun. 

What We Need & What You Get

The funding needed for FunDaze is $5,000,000, but I'm only asking for $50,000. This will be allocated to Phase 1 of my project. We will purchase the land & have it cleared of all trees.  We will begin to build our facility once the land is prepared. 

Do you want to get away with your family without the long drive? We've got you covered! We are building the only indoor/outdoor fun center in the Pee Dee. FunDaze will give you the ease of planning & a safe environment to have fun while getting fit & learning to be healthy.

The Impact

When you contribute, you're not just funding a faceless business, you're getting a different experience for your children in return. We want to create a lifetime of healthy memories. We have reference letters from the parents that have hired us to plan their children's parties in their home or their location of choice.

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks when starting a new business. Some places just aren't marketable. We have researched this industry for quite some time. FunDaze will appeal to everyone, young & old. The challenge that I've seen so far is that some people don't want to give start-ups a chance. Raising the funds through campaign, fundraisers & lots of saving, this business will be successful.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't meant you can't help. You could get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. You could mention it to family & friends in your area. Please share our plan. Utilize the Indiegogo share tools. Even word of mouth will help. Just mentioning the campaign to coworkers or church members would help a lot. Thank you.

story:
Subtitle in English click on captions (CC)

(Español debajo)

My name is Rafael Linero, currently I am a master student in electronic engineering at Pontificia Universidad Javeriana in Bogotá-Colombia. Four years ago I started to work with renewable energy and I knew that at Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta there are indigenous and coffee farmers communities that have to walk more than 3 hours to find electricity and to charge their cell phones and flashlights.

The importance of this campaign

According to The World Bank and the International Energy Agency (IEA) in Colombia approximately 1.5 million people lack access to electricity service, and a large percentage of the population of Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta does not have this service because this area is not interconnected to the power grid.

With this campaign, I intend, with the help of all of you, to take this friendly technology to the environment, portable solar energy systems, to improve the quality of life of indigenous and coffee farmers communities of Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta.

A campaign with impact

By making real this campaign at least 21 families living at Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta will have electricity for the first time in their lives, because they have a system with which charge their cell and illuminate their houses.

They will use environmentally friendly energy.

I have worked taking these solutions  to  these  communities.  In  following pictures you can  see  some  examples, with your help we can continue taking these technologies to these communities.

In case of no collect all the funds for this campaign, the collected funds will implement the systems as possible and make your donations.

They can be more beneficiary families with these solar systems, everything depends on the contributions received. If more founds are collect, we will implement more systems, as many as possible your donations afford.

What we need

We  need  to  implement  the portables solar energy systems, designed to charge cell phones and illuminate the rooms of the houses with LEDs 2 W.

The system contains:

  • 1. Solar panel 7W.
  • 1. System of 5Ah energy storage.
  • 12 V DC outputs for lighting
  • 5V USB outputs to charge cell
  • 2. LEDs 2 W.
  • 1. Connector for charging cell

It can be implemented with US$ 70.

Each hat can be bought and sent with US$ 50.

The Bogota-Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta transportation costs with economic tickets US$ 200.

We need to consider the percentages for use this platform of crowdfunding.

In this first campaign I intend to take 21 systems:

21x70 = US$ 1470 Total portable solar systems

21x50 = US$ 1050 Total Hats "vueltiao"

1x200 = US$ 200 Total transport

Considering the percentages for use this platform of crowdfunding we reached a total value of US$ 3000.

What you get

By contributing with this campaign you can get by e-mail acknowledgments, photos and videos of the technologies donations made at Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta. You can also receive typical hats "sombrero vueltiao" manufactured by indigenous communities in Colombia, a symbol of our country you've probably seen that colombian international athletes and artists such as James Rodriguez, Falcao Garcia, Shakira or Carlos Vives wear it. By buying these hats we are also by contributing to livelihoods of indigenous families in Colombia.

A gift for light: Get  thanks  +  photos  of the families who received solar systems. You are helping to make this campaign real, Thank you.

Another  gift  to  light:  Get  thanks   +  photos of the families who received solar systems +  video uploaded  on YouTube in which a donation is made in your name. You are helping to make this campaign real, Thank you.

A  system  of  you:  Get  thanks,  we  will  donate  a system in your name and will be send  to  you  a  video  uploaded  on  YouTube  of  the  time  of  donation  of  the solar system donated for you. Thank you.

A  hat  and  a  system:  Get  a  typical hat of Colombia and a system will be donated with the contribution made by you. Thank you.

A  hat  and  two  systems:  Get  a  typical  hat  of  Colombia and two systems will be donated with the contribution made by you. Thank you.

Contribution  for  transport the systems:   Get  a  typical  hat  of  Colombia  +  a  video  uploaded  on YouTube in which we  explain  to  the  beneficiary  community  that  you afford with your contribution this trip to the Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta. Thank you.

Two  hats and five systems: Get two typical hats of Colombia and five systems will be donated with the contribution made by you. Thank you.

Three  hats  and  twelve  systems:  Get  three  typical hats of Colombia and twelve systems will be donated with the contribution made by you. Thank you.

Four  hats  and  eighteen systems: Get four typical hats of Colombia and eighteen systems will be donated with the contribution made by you. Thank you.

We invite you to know to  this  experience:  You  are making a very generous contribution, this entire campaign; I know there are many very generous people in the world.

Get five typical hats of Colombia and twenty one systems will be donated with the contribution made by you. I also invite you to accompany me to live this experience of two days, to give donations of portable solar systems in the Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta, includes transport and hotel in Colombia.

Other ways you can help

There   are   many   ways   to   help  “Taking  solar  energy  systems  to  the  Sierra Nevada”

You can help sharing and spreading this campaign to all your friends and everyone, in all social networks and web pages you can, if you have an Indiegogo account, you have great sharing tools, that's really important.

If you want to collaborate with contributions of money or any other help thank you so much.

If you have other help for this campaign please tell me, everything is welcome. Thank you.

Campaign timeline

21 November 2015 - 21 January 2016: Indiegogo Campaign

22 January 2016 – 11 February 2016:   Fund collection

11 February 2016 – 11 Mach 2016:         Shipping hats - Implementation systems

12 Mach 2016 – 13 Mach 2016:               Donation systems


Español:

Mi nombre es Rafael Linero, actualmente soy estudiante de Maestría en Ingeniería Electrónica en la Pontificia Universidad Javeriana en Bogotá-Colombia, hace 4 años empecé a trabajar con energías renovables y conocí que en la Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta hay comunidades indígenas y comunidades de productores de café que necesitan caminar hasta 3 horas para poder encontrar energía eléctrica y poder cargar sus celulares y linternas.

La importancia de esta campaña

Según datos del banco mundial y la Agencia Internacional de la Energía (AIE) en Colombia aproximadamente 1.5 millones de habitantes no cuentan con acceso a un servicio de electricidad, y un gran porcentaje de la población de la Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta no cuenta con este servicio debido a que es una zona no interconectada a la red de energía.

Con esta campaña pretendo, con la ayuda de todos ustedes acercar esta tecnología amigable con el medio ambiente, un sistema de energía solar portable, para mejorar la calidad de vida de las comunidades indígenas y productoras de café de la Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta.

Una campaña con impacto

Si hacemos realidad esta campaña por lo menos 21 familias que habitan en las Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta tendrán energía eléctrica por primera vez en sus vidas, ahora tendrán un sistema con el cual cargar sus celulares e iluminar las salas de sus casas.

Ellos van a utilizar energía amigable con el medio ambiente.

Yo he trabajado llevando estas soluciones a estas comunidades, en estas imágenes puedes ver algunos ejemplos, con tu ayuda podemos seguir llevando estas tecnologías a estas comunidades.

En caso de no recaudar la totalidad de los fondos para esta campaña, con los fondos recaudados implementaremos los sistemas que sea posible y realizaremos sus donaciones.

Pueden ser más familias las beneficiadas con estos sistemas solares, todo depende de las contribuciones recibidas. En caso de recaudar un valor mayor al establecido en esta campaña, implementaremos más sistemas, tantos como sea posible y realizaremos sus donaciones.


Lo que necesitamos

Necesitamos implementar los sistemas de energía solar portables que han sido diseñados para cargar celulares e iluminar las salas de las casas con leds de 2 W.

El sistema contiene:

  • 1 panel solar de 7 W.
  • 1 sistema de almacenamiento de energía de 5 Ah.
  • Salidas de 12 V DC para iluminación.
  • Salidas USB 5V para cargar celulares.
  • 2 leds de 2 W.
  • 1 Conector para cargar celulares.

Puede ser implementado con US$70

Cada sombrero puede ser comprado y enviado con US$50

El transporte Bogotá-Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta cuesta con tiquetes económicos US$200

Debemos tener en cuenta el 5% por utilizar esta plataforma de crowdfunding.

En esta primera campaña pretendo llevar 21 sistemas:

21*70 = US$1470  Total gasto en Sistemas solares

21*50 = US$1050  Total gasto en Sombreros “vueltiao”

1*200 = US$200  Total gasto en viaje

Teniendo en cuenta el porcentaje por utilizar esta plataforma de Crowdfunding llegamos a un valor total de US$ 3.000

Lo que obtienes

Al  colaborar  con  esta  campaña  puedes  obtener  por medio de correo electrónico agradecimientos,  fotos  y  videos  de las donaciones de tecnologías realizadas en la Sierra  Nevada  de  Santa   Marta.  También   puedes   recibir   sombreros   "vueltiao" fabricados  por  comunidades  indígenas  de  Colombia,  un  símbolo de nuestro país que   probablemente    lo   has   visto   puesto   en   nuestros   deportistas   y   artistas internacionales como James  Rodríguez,   Falcao  García,   Shakira   o  Carlos  Vives.  Al    comprar   estos    sombreros   también   estaremos   colaborando   al  medio  de  sustento  de  familias indígenas de Colombia.

Un  regalo  para  luz:   Obtén  agradecimientos  +  fotos  de  las  donaciones  de  los sistemas  solares.  Usted   está  contribuyendo  para  hacer  realidad  esta campaña, gracias.

Otro  regalo  para  luz:  Obtén  agradecimientos  +  fotos  de  las  donaciones de los sistemas solares + un video subido a YouTube en el que se realiza una donación a tu nombre. Usted está contribuyendo para hacer realidad esta campaña, gracias.

Un sistema de tu parte: Obtén agradecimientos se donará un sistema a tu nombre y  se  enviará  un  video  subido en YouTube del momento de la donación del sistema solar contribuido por usted. Gracias.

Un sombrero y un sistema:   Obtén   un sombrero típico de Colombia  y  se  donará un sistema con una contribución hecha por usted. Gracias.

Un  sombrero  y  dos  sistemas:   Obtén   un   sombrero   típico  de Colombia  y   se  donarán  dos sistemas con una contribución hecha por usted. Gracias.

Contribución para el viaje:   Obtén  un   sombrero  típico  de   Colombia  + un video subido  a  YouTube  en  el  que  se  explica  a  la  comunidad   beneficiaria   que  usted permitió que se realizara ese  viaje a la Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta. Gracias.

Dos sombreros y cinco sistemas:  Obtén dos sombreros  típico  de  Colombia  y se donarán cinco sistemas con una contribución hecha por usted. Gracias.

Tres sombreros y doce sistemas:   Obtén tres  sombreros  típicos  de  Colombia   y se donarán doce sistemas con una contribución hecha por usted. Gracias.

Cuatro sombreros y dieciocho sistemas:    Obtén   cuatro   sombreros   típicos  de Colombia  y  se  donarán  dieciocho sistemas con una contribución hecha por usted. Gracias.

Invitación   a   esta  experiencia:   Usted   está   haciendo   una   contribución   muy generosa,  la  totalidad  de  esta  campaña,  yo  sé  que  hay  muchas  personas   muy generosas en el mundo.

Obtén cinco sombreros típicos de Colombia y se donarán veintiún sistemas con una contribución  hecha  por  usted.  Además  te  invito a que me acompañes a vivir esta experiencia de 2 días, a entregar las donaciones de los sistemas solares en la Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta,   incluye  transporte y hotel en Colombia.   Juntos haremos  posible esta campaña.

Otras formas de ayudar

Hay muchas formas de ayudar a llevar sistemas energía solar a la Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta.

Puedes ayudar a compartir y difundir esta campaña con todos tus amigos y por todo el mundo, en todas las redes sociales y páginas web que usted pueda, también puedes usar las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo, eso es realmente importante.

Si deseas colaborar con contribuciones de dinero o con cualquier otro tipo de ayuda muchas gracias.

Si tienes otro tipo de ayuda para esta campaña por favor cuéntame, todo es bienvenido. Gracias.

Tiempos de la campaña

21 Noviembre 2015 - 21 Enero 2016: Campaña en Indiegogo

22 Enero 2016 – 11 Febrero 2016:      Recibir los fondos recolectados

11 Febrero 2016 – 11 Marzo 2016:       Envío de sombreros – Implementación

12 Marzo 2016 – 13 Marzo 2016:         Donación de los sistemas
story_txt:
Subtitle in English click on captions (CC)(Español debajo)


My
name is Rafael Linero, currently I am a master student in electronic
engineering at Pontificia Universidad Javeriana in
Bogotá-Colombia. Four years ago I started to work with renewable energy and I knew
that at Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta there are indigenous
and coffee farmers communities that have to walk more than 3 hours to find electricity and to
charge their cell phones and flashlights.
The
importance of this campaign

According
to The World Bank and the International Energy Agency (IEA) in Colombia
approximately 1.5 million people lack access to electricity service, and a
large percentage of the population of Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta does not
have this service because this area is not interconnected to the power grid.
With
this campaign, I intend, with the help of all of you, to take this friendly technology
to the environment, portable solar energy systems, to improve the
quality of life of indigenous and coffee farmers communities  of Sierra
Nevada de Santa Marta.
A
campaign with impact

By making real this campaign at least 21 families living at Sierra Nevada de
Santa Marta will have electricity for the first time in their lives, because they have a system with which charge their cell and illuminate their
houses.
They will use environmentally friendly energy.


I
have worked taking these solutions  to  these  communities.  In  following pictures you can  see  some  examples, with your help we can continue taking these technologies
to these communities.

In
case of no collect all the funds for this campaign, the collected funds will implement the systems as possible and make your donations.

They
can be more beneficiary families with these solar systems, everything depends
on the contributions received. If more founds are collect, we will implement
more systems, as many as possible your donations afford.

What we need
We 
need  to  implement  the portables solar energy systems, designed to charge cell phones and
illuminate the rooms of the houses with LEDs 2 W.
The
system contains:

1.
Solar panel 7W.
1.
System of 5Ah energy storage.
12
V DC outputs for lighting
5V
USB outputs to charge cell
2. LEDs
2 W.
1.
Connector for charging cell

It
can be implemented with US$ 70.
Each
hat can be bought and sent with US$ 50.
The
Bogota-Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta transportation costs with economic tickets US$
200.
We
need to consider the percentages for use this platform of crowdfunding.
In
this first campaign I intend to take 21 systems:
21x70 = US$ 1470 Total portable solar systems
21x50 = US$ 1050 Total Hats "vueltiao"
1x200 = US$ 200 Total transport
Considering
the percentages for use this platform of crowdfunding we reached a total value
of US$ 3000.
What
you get
By
contributing with this campaign you can get by e-mail acknowledgments, photos
and videos of the technologies donations made at Sierra Nevada de Santa
Marta. You can also receive typical hats "sombrero vueltiao" manufactured by
indigenous communities in Colombia, a symbol of our country you've probably
seen that colombian international athletes and artists such as James Rodriguez,
Falcao Garcia, Shakira or Carlos Vives wear it. By buying these hats we are also by
contributing to livelihoods of indigenous families in Colombia.A gift for light: Get  thanks  + 
photos  of the families who received solar systems. You are helping to make this campaign real, Thank you.Another  gift  to  light:  Get  thanks   +  photos of the families who received solar systems +  video uploaded  on YouTube in which a donation
is made in your name. You are helping to make this campaign real, Thank
you.
A  system  of  you:  Get  thanks,  we 
will  donate  a system in your name and will be send  to  you  a  video  uploaded  on 
YouTube  of  the  time  of  donation  of  the solar system donated for you. Thank
you.
A  hat  and  a  system:  Get  a  typical hat
of Colombia and a system will be donated with the contribution made by you.
Thank you.
A  hat  and  two  systems:  Get  a  typical 
hat  of  Colombia and two systems will be donated with the contribution made by
you. Thank you.
Contribution  for  transport the systems:   Get  a 
typical  hat  of  Colombia  +  a  video  uploaded  on YouTube in which we  explain  to  the 
beneficiary  community  that  you afford with your contribution this trip to the
Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta. Thank you.
Two  hats and five systems: Get two typical
hats of Colombia and five systems will be donated with the contribution made by
you. Thank you.
Three  hats  and  twelve  systems:  Get 
three  typical hats of Colombia and twelve systems will be donated with the
contribution made by you. Thank you.
Four  hats  and  eighteen systems: Get
four typical hats of Colombia and eighteen systems will be donated with the
contribution made by you. Thank you.

We invite you to know to  this  experience:  You  are making a
very generous contribution, this entire campaign; I know there are many very
generous people in the world.Get five typical hats of Colombia and twenty one systems will be donated with the contribution made by you. I also invite you to accompany me to live this experience of two days, to give donations of portable solar systems in the Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta, includes transport and hotel in Colombia.
Other
ways you can help
There   are   many   ways   to   help  “Taking 
solar  energy  systems  to  the  Sierra Nevada”
You can help sharing and spreading this campaign to all your friends and everyone,
in all social networks and web pages you can, if you have an Indiegogo account,
you have great sharing tools, that's really important.
If you want to collaborate with contributions of money or any other help thank
you so much.
If you have other help for this campaign please tell me, everything is welcome.
Thank you.
Campaign
timeline

21 November 2015
- 21 January 2016: Indiegogo Campaign
22 January 2016 –
11 February 2016:   Fund collection 
11 February
2016 – 11 Mach 2016:         Shipping hats - Implementation systems 
12 Mach
2016 – 13 Mach 2016:               Donation systems

Español:
Mi nombre es Rafael Linero, actualmente soy estudiante de Maestría en
Ingeniería Electrónica en la Pontificia Universidad Javeriana en Bogotá-Colombia, hace 4 años empecé a trabajar con energías renovables y
conocí que en la Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta hay comunidades indígenas y
comunidades de productores de café que necesitan caminar hasta 3 horas para
poder encontrar energía eléctrica y poder cargar sus celulares y linternas.
La importancia de esta campaña
Según datos del banco mundial y la
Agencia Internacional de la Energía (AIE) en Colombia aproximadamente 1.5
millones de habitantes no cuentan con acceso a un servicio de electricidad, y
un gran porcentaje de la población de la Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta no cuenta
con este servicio debido a que es una zona no interconectada a la red de
energía.
Con esta campaña pretendo, con la
ayuda de todos ustedes acercar esta tecnología amigable con el medio ambiente,
un sistema de energía solar portable, para mejorar la calidad de vida de las comunidades
indígenas y productoras de café de la Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta.
Una campaña con impacto

Si hacemos realidad esta campaña por
lo menos 21 familias que habitan en las Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta tendrán
energía eléctrica por primera vez en sus vidas, ahora tendrán un sistema con el
cual cargar sus celulares e iluminar las salas de sus casas.
Ellos van a utilizar energía amigable
con el medio ambiente.
Yo he trabajado llevando estas
soluciones a estas comunidades, en estas imágenes puedes ver algunos ejemplos,
con tu ayuda podemos seguir llevando estas tecnologías a estas comunidades.
En caso de no recaudar la totalidad de
los fondos para esta campaña, con los fondos recaudados implementaremos los
sistemas que sea posible y realizaremos sus donaciones. 
Pueden ser más familias las
beneficiadas con estos sistemas solares, todo depende de las contribuciones
recibidas. En caso de recaudar un valor mayor al establecido en esta campaña,
implementaremos más sistemas, tantos como sea posible y realizaremos sus
donaciones. 

Lo que necesitamos
Necesitamos implementar los sistemas
de energía solar portables que han sido diseñados para cargar celulares e iluminar
las salas de las casas con leds de 2 W.
El sistema contiene:

1 panel solar de 7 W.
1 sistema de almacenamiento de energía
de 5 Ah.
Salidas de 12 V DC para iluminación.
Salidas USB 5V para cargar celulares.
2 leds de 2 W.
1 Conector para cargar celulares.

Puede ser implementado con US$70
Cada sombrero puede ser comprado y enviado
con US$50
El transporte Bogotá-Sierra Nevada de
Santa Marta cuesta con tiquetes económicos US$200
Debemos tener en cuenta el 5% por
utilizar esta plataforma de crowdfunding.
En esta primera campaña pretendo
llevar 21 sistemas:
21*70 = US$1470  Total gasto en Sistemas solares
21*50 = US$1050  Total gasto en Sombreros “vueltiao”
1*200 = US$200  Total gasto en viaje
Teniendo en cuenta el porcentaje por
utilizar esta plataforma de Crowdfunding llegamos a un valor total de US$ 3.000
Lo que obtienes 
Al  colaborar  con  esta  campaña  puedes 
obtener  por medio de correo electrónico agradecimientos,  fotos  y  videos  de las donaciones de tecnologías
realizadas en la Sierra  Nevada  de  Santa   Marta.  También   puedes   recibir   sombreros  
"vueltiao" fabricados  por  comunidades  indígenas  de  Colombia,  un 
símbolo de nuestro país que   probablemente    lo   has   visto   puesto   en   nuestros  
deportistas   y   artistas internacionales como James  Rodríguez,   Falcao  García,   Shakira   o  Carlos  Vives.  Al    comprar   estos    sombreros   también   estaremos   colaborando  
al  medio  de  sustento  de  familias indígenas de Colombia.
Un 
regalo  para  luz:   Obtén  agradecimientos  +  fotos  de  las  donaciones  de  los sistemas  solares.  Usted   está 
contribuyendo  para  hacer  realidad  esta campaña, gracias.
Otro 
regalo  para  luz:  Obtén 
agradecimientos  +  fotos  de  las  donaciones de los sistemas solares + un video
subido a YouTube en el que se realiza una donación a tu nombre. Usted está
contribuyendo para hacer realidad esta campaña, gracias.
Un sistema de tu parte: Obtén
agradecimientos se donará un sistema a tu nombre y  se  enviará  un  video  subido en YouTube del momento de la donación del sistema solar contribuido por usted.
Gracias.
Un sombrero y un sistema:   Obtén   un sombrero típico de Colombia  y  se  donará un sistema con una contribución hecha por usted.
Gracias.
Un 
sombrero  y  dos  sistemas:   Obtén  
un   sombrero   típico  de Colombia  y   se  donarán  dos sistemas con una contribución hecha por usted.
Gracias.
Contribución
para el viaje:   Obtén 
un   sombrero  típico  de   Colombia  + un video subido  a  YouTube  en  el  que  se  explica  a  la  comunidad   beneficiaria   que  usted permitió que se realizara ese  viaje a la Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta.
Gracias.
Dos
sombreros y cinco sistemas:  Obtén
dos sombreros  típico  de  Colombia  y se donarán cinco sistemas con una contribución hecha por usted.
Gracias.
Tres
sombreros y doce sistemas:   Obtén
tres  sombreros  típicos  de  Colombia   y se donarán doce sistemas con una contribución hecha por usted.
Gracias.
Cuatro
sombreros y dieciocho sistemas:    Obtén  
cuatro   sombreros   típicos  de Colombia  y  se  donarán  dieciocho sistemas con una contribución hecha por
usted. Gracias.
Invitación  
a   esta  experiencia:   Usted  
está   haciendo   una   contribución   muy generosa,  la  totalidad  de  esta  campaña,  yo 
sé  que  hay  muchas  personas   muy generosas en el mundo. 

Obtén cinco sombreros típicos de Colombia y se donarán veintiún
sistemas con una contribución  hecha  por  usted.  Además  te  invito a que me
acompañes a vivir esta experiencia de 2 días, a entregar las donaciones de los
sistemas solares en la Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta,   incluye  transporte y hotel en Colombia.   Juntos haremos  posible esta campaña.

Otras formas de ayudar
Hay
muchas formas de ayudar a llevar sistemas energía solar a la Sierra Nevada de
Santa Marta.
Puedes
ayudar a compartir y difundir esta campaña con todos tus amigos y por todo el mundo,
en todas las redes sociales y páginas web que usted pueda, también puedes usar
las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo, eso es realmente importante.
Si deseas
colaborar con contribuciones de dinero o con cualquier otro tipo de ayuda
muchas gracias.
Si tienes
otro tipo de ayuda para esta campaña por favor cuéntame, todo es bienvenido.
Gracias.
Tiempos de la campaña

21 Noviembre 2015 - 21 Enero 2016: Campaña en Indiegogo
22 Enero 2016 – 11 Febrero 2016:      Recibir los fondos recolectados 
11 Febrero 2016 – 11 Marzo 2016:       Envío
de sombreros – Implementación 
12 Marzo 2016 – 13 Marzo 2016:         Donación
de los sistemas

story:
Have you ever seen a child pluck a carrot from the earth? Suddenly a little person who resists all vegetables gobbles up the bright orange treasure like CANDY.
-History-

During WWII nearly 40% of all vegetables were grown in backyards. These “Victory Gardens” instilled pride in what was grown and eaten. This pride extended to the ornamental landscape as well. Plant selection was personal to the tastes and cultures of home owners and created eclectic personal spaces that maximized community pride. As the pace of life in the American family has increased it has become increasingly difficult to create and maintain these personalized garden spaces. Through its business plan Bluebird Growers hopes to provide the greater Jacksonville area with the tools to once again have Victory in their gardens.

Started in 2014, Bluebird Growers is the brain child of Nicholas Zimmer. Originally from Madison, WI, Nicholas has been putting his B.S. in horticulture from the UW-Madison to good use in the North Florida horticulture industry for over 8 years. Through these experiences he has developed a business model to provide the highest quality edible and ornamental plants to the Jacksonville community.

Once a thriving industry in Jacksonville, smaller wholesale nurseries are quickly being outsourced to large-scale operations that mainly cater to “big-box” stores. These types of operations focus on increasing profit margins and making production more efficient. Plant selection is often not specific to the community and plant nutrition is based on production cost instead of consumer success.

-Business Plan-

The first step in our business plan is the refinement of our growing facility. Bluebird Growers has recently acquired a 3-acre property on the Northside of Jacksonville. Much of the growing structure is in place, but funds are needed to aid in the purchase of growing supplies and equipment for the upcoming growing seasons. This funding would allow us to meet existing commitments while expanding our abilities to assist the entire First Coast. Through this expansion we hope to work with independent garden centers and other clients to refine our focus to better meet the needs of greater Jacksonville area residents.

Specific Spring Campaign Goals

1.  Generate funding for 10 hrs per week of paid internships- $1200.

2.  Purchase supplies for 3000, 1-gallon seasonal annuals and perennials. This will generate approximately $7500 in gross revenue.- $3000.

3.  Purchase supplies for 10,000, 4”-organic herbs and vegetables. This will generate approximately $ 5000 in revenue and allow us to provide approximately 500 donated 4”- herbs and veggies to various charitable organizations. $1000.

4.  Secure lease of growing facility through spring season. $2800.

The cost to accomplish these goals are estimated at $8000. We are seeking 75% ($6000) of this total to build a stable financial foundation that will allow us to initiate and develop our business model.

Small businesses are the back bone of the Jacksonville community. They give character and pride to our city and allow us to maintain a business culture that supports our community’s needs and values. Supporting the strong horticultural tradition in Jacksonville will enable our residents to reconnect with their food while restoring pride and value to their landscapes, Together we can make our garden victorious!

story:
Our lease is up so we are raising funds to move to a purpose built food production workshop and buy some much needed new equipment, so we can supply a larger community with our delicious hand made vegan products.   


WHO IS SUZY SPOON?

I’m Suzy Spoon and I’ve been passionate about vegan cooking for 29 years. I started making vegan sausages and meat alternatives at home for my family and friends because the vegan products available in supermarkets were highly processed, with no flavour and often a lot of food miles. So I created a range of vegan meat alternatives using lovely fresh produce and real ingredients, instead of numbers. I put an emphasis on flavour, which sets my products apart from the ones in the supermarket.


My friends and work colleagues loved my products. I even tried them out on actor Tobey Maguire while working as his personal chef when he was in Sydney shooting The Great Gatsby.  Tobey and my friends were very encouraging and I started to sell my vegan sausages and burger patties at a local farmers’ market every Sunday.

That was four years ago and now I employ a team of 11 great people who are passionate about animal rights and social justice issues. Each member brings a different set of skills to the team, but one important common thread we share is a dedication to producing delicious, healthy food for the community without exploiting animals, people or the environment. 


WHAT WE DO

We make a range of 12 different vegan products. Garlic and rosemary burger patties, Vienna style schnitzel, Italian herbed veggie balls, Home-style Bolognese, Lasagne,  Seitan pieces, Smokey rasher, Polenta sundried tomato and basil sausage, Kale and cauliflower sausage, Spicy original sausage, Sunday sausage and Smoked chilli sausage.

I created all the recipes from scratch and the team and I have perfected them over time. 


We have a small production room where we make our products, and busy café that show cases those products on the menu (kind of a try before you buy sort of thing)

In 2014 we won an award for Excellence in Innovation from the NSW business chamber, which was a huge honour and a fabulous introduction to many local business owners in our community.

We also won best vegan/vegetarian food Australia wide in the 2014 Foxtel I LOVE FOOD awards. We were so proud to win because it's calculated on votes by customers.


We sell our products a few different ways- Retail and wholesale to the public, catering companies, delis, pubs, cafes and event organisers. We have a distributer who delivers our products to health food stores as far north as Cairns and as far South as Melbourne. And we have an online store where East Coast customers can buy our products online and have them delivered to their home.

Link to Spoon's online shop

We make over 2500 protein-packed meat-free meals per week. The demand for our products is growing every day with customers wanting more stockists and a larger delivery area. But we can’t grow another inch in the space we’re in.

With a busy café and a sausage factory sharing one small cool room there’s a limit to how much we can make because refrigeration is such an important part of safe food production.




SO WE’RE RAISING FUNDS TO MOVE!

Our building lease expires in May so we move or we close. The team and I want to move! So we are raising funds to move to a food production workshop with large walk-in cool rooms and a temperature-controlled production area. 



In the new space we will be able to expand our range of vegan products, helping more people eat less meat.  And increase our production level to meet the ever-growing demand for our regular products –  so we’ll never run out of your favourite Suzy Spoon’s products again.

We will also be able to increase our stockist area to include Adelaide, WA, Tassie and regional areas, so we can share Spoon’s products with a larger community. We are currently in negotiations with a number of independent grocers and plan to have Suzy Spoon's products in independent grocery stores across Australia. 


HOW WILL THE FUNDING BE SPENT?

We can save Suzy Spoon's Vegetarian Butcher if we raise $30,000!

 We will use the money to move and buy much needed equipment such as a bratt pan, steam oven, exhaust extractor, racks and shelving. 

Our cafe can not exist without our food production workshop because thats where we make all the products that are on our menu. We are looking for a space that can house both workshop and cafe but if we can't find an appropriate place we might have to split the 2 parts of the business and have them in separate locations. 

So if we can't find a space big enough for both workshop and cafe then we will firstly re home the food production workshop. Then when our current lease in Newtown ends in May 2016 we will find a new home for our café. We will then have our bond back from the Newtown property and there are many appropriate locations to choose from. And any additional funds we receive will go towards relocating our cafe. 



Please help us make food that nourishes us into the future. Even if you’re not in a position to contribute financially, you can help by talking to people you know about our campaign and sharing it on social media. And if you can, come into the cafe and order our special fundraising burger.

Thank you very much from Suzy and the team. 


QandA

These are actual questions we have been asked in the past week, I hope these answers are helpful.

Aren’t you making heaps of money?

No I am not. It’s harder than it looks to run a small business, especially a food related business. There are so many laws and regulations to comply with.

I understand when customers come in at lunch time on a Saturday it looks like we must be making a bomb but it’s not that simple. Very few businesses see profit in the first few years and most even go bust. We have had our wins and setbacks like any small business but last year we had more than our fare share of building related set backs, fridge breakdowns & a robbery, that have taken their toll on our progress.

Didn’t you know your lease was coming up for renewal?

Yes I did. My long term plan was to renew the lease and keep the café in the space but move the food production area to a little industrial unit somewhere as soon as I could afford it. But the new lease comes with a rent rise I am unable to pay. So I can’t renew the lease and stay.

Surely a big company like yours can pay its own way?

I am a sole trader not a company. I am considered a micro business which is smaller than a small business, and even that is being generous. There is a cost related to becoming a company and I have not yet had the spare $ to make the change. Once my business starts becoming profitable I will change to a company to receive certain tax breaks that are not available to sole traders.

Why don’t you just get a loan?

I was only able to open Suzy Spoon’s Vegetarian Butcher because my partner and I took out a bank loan, which we are still paying off.

What will you do if you don’t raise the funds you need?

I will do what I can, with what I have. My business might need to start from the beginning again with a small kitchen in the suburbs and a weekend market stall.

The products are my priority over my café. So if I can’t find a space for both together I will look for a space for the food production workshop and close the café indefinitely.

Why do you need a food production space why not just open the café?

Suzy Spoon’s Vegetarian Butcher is a food production business, with a café where you can taste the products we make. Without the products I don’t really have a café, because that is what makes my cafe so special and different from other cafes, the menu is made up of the products we make.

There are heaps of empty shops that are really cheap, why can’t you just move into one of them?

It’s not impossible but there are complications.

My funds are limited so the place I move into needs to have a few things so I can make my products safely, hygienically and within the council, Sydney water and NSW health’s regulations. For example cool rooms, floor drains, grease trap and an exhaust extractor. I need 3 phase power, gas and the space needs to be approved by the council for food use.  When I moved into the Newtown property there was no grease trap and it cost $20,000 to have one put in.

Even to open a small café the building needs to have been approved for food use by the council, and if I want to do any cooking at all I need a grease trap and exhaust.

What will you spend the money on?

I am still looking for a space to move to. So it’s hard to know what problems I will face. But I will post regular updates on our progress.

The money will be spent on moving the food production side of the business to a new location. If I can open a café in that location I will. But if I cant I will then look for a space where I can open the café.

At this point we will need roughly $20,000 for the bond on a new building. But we will hopefully get our bond back from our Newtown shop at the end of May.

We need to buy a new Bratt pan which is a giant electric fry pan ($3000 second hand), and a combi steam oven ($4000 second hand). It is unlikely we will be able to afford these new but newer than the ones we have would be great, as I don’t think the ones we have will survive a move.  



 [1]
