basil sausage, Kale and cauliflower sausage, Spicy original sausage, Sunday
sausage and Smoked chilli sausage. 
I created all the recipes from scratch and the team and I have perfected them over time. We have a small
production room where we make our products, and busy café that show cases those
products on the menu (kind of a try before you buy sort of thing)
In 2014 we won an award for Excellence in
Innovation from the NSW business chamber, which was a huge honour and a
fabulous introduction to many local business owners in our community. 
We also won best vegan/vegetarian food Australia
wide in the 2014 Foxtel I LOVE FOOD awards. We were so proud to win
because it's calculated on votes by customers.We sell our products a few different ways- Retail and wholesale to the public, catering companies, delis, pubs, cafes and event organisers. We have a distributer who delivers our products to health food stores as far north as Cairns and as far South as Melbourne. And we have an online store where East Coast customers can buy our products online and have them delivered to their home.Link to Spoon's online shopWe make over 2500 protein-packed meat-free meals per week. The demand for our products is growing every day with customers wanting more stockists and a larger delivery area. But we can’t grow another inch in the space we’re in.With a busy café and a sausage factory sharing one small cool room there’s a limit to how much we can make because refrigeration is such an important part of safe food production.SO WE’RE RAISING FUNDS TO MOVE!
Our building lease expires in May so we move or
we close. The team and I want to move! So we are raising funds to move to a food production workshop with large walk-in cool rooms
and a temperature-controlled production area. In the new space we will be able to expand our range of vegan products, helping more people eat less meat.  And increase our production level to meet the ever-growing demand for our regular products –  so we’ll never run out of your favourite Suzy Spoon’s products again.We will also be able to increase our stockist area to include Adelaide, WA, Tassie and regional areas, so we can share Spoon’s products with a larger community. We are currently in negotiations with a number of independent grocers and plan to have Suzy Spoon's products in independent grocery stores across Australia. HOW WILL THE FUNDING BE SPENT?We can save Suzy Spoon's Vegetarian Butcher if we raise
$30,000! We will use the money to move and buy much needed
equipment such as a bratt pan, steam oven, exhaust extractor, racks and
shelving. Our cafe can not exist without our food production workshop because thats where we make all the products that are on our menu. We are looking for a space that can house both workshop and cafe but if we can't find an appropriate place we might have to split the 2 parts of the business and have them in separate locations. So if we can't find a space big enough for both workshop and cafe then we will firstly re home the food production workshop. Then when our current lease in Newtown ends in May 2016 we will find
a new home for our café. We will then have our bond back from the Newtown property and
there are many appropriate locations to choose from. And any additional funds we receive will go towards relocating our cafe. 
Please help us make food that nourishes us into
the future. Even if you’re not in a position to contribute financially, you can
help by talking to people you know about our campaign and sharing it on social
media. And if you can, come into the cafe and order our special fundraising
burger. 
Thank you very much from Suzy and the team. 
QandA 
These are actual questions we have been
asked in the past week, I hope these answers are helpful.
Aren’t you making heaps of
money?
No I am not. It’s harder than it looks to run a small business,
especially a food related business. There are so many laws and regulations to
comply with. 
I understand when customers come in at lunch time on a Saturday it
looks like we must be making a bomb but it’s not that simple. Very few
businesses see profit in the first few years and most even go bust. We have had
our wins and setbacks like any small business but last year we had more than
our fare share of building related set backs, fridge breakdowns & a robbery,
that have taken their toll on our progress. 
Didn’t you know your lease
was coming up for renewal?
Yes I did. My long term plan was to renew the lease and keep the
café in the space but move the food production area to a little industrial unit
somewhere as soon as I could afford it. But the new lease comes with a rent
rise I am unable to pay. So I can’t renew the lease and stay. 
Surely a big company like
yours can pay its own way?
I am a sole trader not a company. I am considered a micro business
which is smaller than a small business, and even that is being generous. There
is a cost related to becoming a company and I have not yet had the spare $ to make
the change. Once my business starts becoming profitable I will change to a company
to receive certain tax breaks that are not available to sole traders. 
Why don’t you just get a
loan?
I was only able to open Suzy Spoon’s Vegetarian Butcher because my
partner and I took out a bank loan, which we are still paying off. 
What will you do if you
don’t raise the funds you need?
I will do what I can, with what I have. My business might need to
start from the beginning again with a small kitchen in the suburbs and a
weekend market stall. 
The products are my priority over my café. So if I can’t find a
space for both together I will look for a space for the food production
workshop and close the café indefinitely. 
Why do you need a food
production space why not just open the café?
Suzy Spoon’s Vegetarian Butcher is a food production business, with
a café where you can taste the products we make. Without the products I don’t
really have a café, because that is what makes my cafe so special and different
from other cafes, the menu is made up of the products we make. 
There are heaps of empty
shops that are really cheap, why can’t you just move into one of them?
It’s not impossible but there are complications. 
My funds are limited so the place I move into needs to have a few
things so I can make my products safely, hygienically and within the council,
Sydney water and NSW health’s regulations. For example cool rooms, floor
drains, grease trap and an exhaust extractor. I need 3 phase power, gas and the
space needs to be approved by the council for food use.  When I moved into the Newtown property
there was no grease trap and it cost $20,000 to have one put in. 
Even to open a small café the building needs to have been approved
for food use by the council, and if I want to do any cooking at all I need a
grease trap and exhaust. 
What will you spend the
money on?
I am still looking for a space to move to. So it’s hard to know what
problems I will face. But I will post regular updates on our progress. 
The money will be spent on moving the food production side of the business
to a new location. If I can open a café in that location I will. But if I cant
I will then look for a space where I can open the café. 
At this point we will need roughly $20,000 for the bond on a new
building. But we will hopefully get our bond back from our Newtown shop at the
end of May. 
We need to buy a new Bratt pan which is a giant electric fry pan
($3000 second hand), and a combi steam oven ($4000 second hand). It is unlikely
we will be able to afford these new but newer than the ones we have would be
great, as I don’t think the ones we have will survive a move.  





 [1]

story:
Short Summary


UPDATE: WE GOT AN EXCITING CALL WITH INTEREST TO GET THIS BABY INTO A STORE...BUT THEY NEED TO SEE THE MARKET VALUE AND NEED. 


HELP ME GET THESE NUMBERS UP NOW WE ONLY HAVE A FEW DAYS. WE CAN DO THIS. EACH ONE OF YOU THAT HAVE PURCHASED, ASK A FRIEND OR 2 TO PURCHASE TOO. WE CAN DO THIS.


#oprahbreadpuddingchallenge #nadegesbreadpudding

Hi all,

My Name is Nadege Fleurimond and I am a caterer, author, and event planner in NYC. For years one of our clients absolute favorite dessert has been my Challah bread pudding served with coconut rum sauce known as Kremas. Soft, decadent and downright well...I will say it...ORGASMIC!!! The taste usually results in knees buckling, followed by eyes being rolled back, with exclamations of "OH MY GOD OPRAH NEEDS TO TASTE THIS".

It took me a while to understand that meant people really liked it and thought it so delicious that they figured if Oprah tasted it, it would easily become one of her favorite things. So I started to say it too...whenever people complimented me on it, I would say, yeah, if only Oprah could taste it!

And one day this past Christmas weekend after stating, "yeah if only we could get Oprah to taste it" my friend Florence Taylor, wrote me back and said, "send it to her!".

I said, you know what, I think I will. Hence the CHALLENGE!!! #oprahbreadpuddingchallenge


INDIEGOGO made sense and it didn't. It didn't make sense because I'm not technically fundraising, but I figured it's the easiest way to keep track of everyone. Its the best way for us to spread the way. It provides a platform for us to commune and discuss our progress towards Oprah and our great love for the bread pudding :-)

I don't know Oprah honestly...But I've always been fascinated by the power of human energy to make things happen. Team work makes everything possible. So I thought, this is a perfect opportunity to exercise the power of our network and find out, is it really 6 degrees of separation to anyone?

6 Degrees of Separation to Oprah!

FROM WIKIPEDIA: "Six degrees of separation is the theory that everyone and everything is six or fewer steps away, by way of introduction, from any other person in the world, so that a chain of  "a friend of a friend" statements can be made to connect any two people in a maximum of six steps."

I believe we can get someone to order one of the bread puddings for Oprah herself. Do you know Oprah? Well don't worry. Most of us don't know Oprah. Nor do we know anyone who even knows Oprah...At least we don't think we do. That is why this is so cool. Imagine how awesome it will be in 30 days when we draw that tree and you realize your branch is what led us to Oprah!

We are all connected I believe all it takes is a little thought and adventurous spirit.

Can't think of anyone specific? Send it to the biggest connector you know. Send it to a pastor friend, a mortgage broker, someone in the mail room, a gym buddy. Someone you know that will give it thought and enjoy the bread pudding too, and believe it good and tasty enough to send one to Oprah or to someone else who might enjoy it, and in tthe process, lead us to OPRAH!

The challenge? In 30 days lets put at least a 1000 bread puddings into the universe and FIND OPRAH!

*Read & Act Fast...not just like or share :-)...get that bread pudding! ACTION is what will bring this project home. So grateful for you guys. 30 days to Oprah. I believe we will meet this Challenge*

WE CAN MAKE THIS HAPPEN. You get to enjoy some tasty bread pudding along the way...DID I MENTION THAT COCONUT RUM SAUCE? 

SO THE CHALLENGE IS FUN, TASTY & SIMPLE


While your taste buds is of importance to me. We have bigger fish to fry...ok...bigger bread pudding pans to bake. WE HAVE TO FIND OPRAH!!!


WHY DO THIS CHALLENGE???

1) You have nothing to lose. Your contribution is the purchase of  a tasty dessert delivered to your door! Did I mention you will absolutely love it!

2)You get to gift a tasty dessert to someone who deserves it (and is getting us one step closer to Oprah)

3)uhm...tasty dessert. HELLO...LETS GO!!!!

4)When we find Oprah, we can throw a big bread pudding party for all our contributors (in NYC that is, but out of towners please come...you are welcomed, I just cant throw a big party in your town...New York is pretty cool, minus all the bad stuff!). People know all I need is an excuse to throw a party!

5) We get to live and talk about this...Can you imagine??

Other Ways You Can Help

share share share: Share this on all your social media pages, facebook, ig, and twitter and let the universe know we are looking to deliver Oprah a tasty dessert!

CAN YOU GET 5 PEOPLE FROM YOUR OFFICE TO BE A SUPPORTER OR AMBASSADOR?

Honestly you can't think of anyone to give a tasty bread pudding too? Then order one for yourself or support our lovely bread pudding operation as we prepare to package and get into stores....be part of the movement!  Have questions? Call or email me!

Nadege Fleurimond
nadegefleurimond@gmail.com
646-489-4120
Follow me on IG: @nadegecooks
twitter: @nadegecooks
Facebook: Nadege Fleurimond - Culinary Curator

story:
Help Kind Organics Buy a Farm! 

  •  Kind Organics is a year-round farm in Southern Ontario. For the past 7 years we have been growing sprouts, baby greens and salad blends on rented land. 
  • We have been working hard year after year to save enough money to buy a farm, this has been challenging due to the ever increasing prices for real estate in Ontario. The good news is we have found a farm we love, we have the downpayment and we have secured a mortgage. Now we need your help to close. Closing costs, moving costs, new equipment and the cost of repairs to the greenhouses on the new property mean we need to find another $100,000 in the next 60 days.
  • It has been our dream to own a farm for many years now and we are very close to achieving this goal but we need your help!
  • By helping to fund our campaign you will be contributing to Kind Organics having a permanent home and ensuring that we will continue to grow great greens for the Southern Ontario market year-round.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Closing costs which include land transfer tax, adjustments and disbursements will be about $15,000 The new property has greenhouses which need the poly replaced. We estimate the material costs to be about $20,000. We need to make raised beds, buy soil, mulch and compost and we estimate the cost of these to be $25,000. Moving our farm will take months of work and expenses will likely cost about $10,000. We would also like to invest in some new equipment; stainless steel tables, a greens washer and a harvester would run another $30,000. 
  • Have a look at our perks and thank you very much for donating!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We understand if contributing financially at this time is not possible, we would appreciate your help in spreading the word and sharing our campaing wherever you see fit.
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!   And that's all there is to it.

story:
THE FELLOWSHIP

IDEX is a six-month professional fellowship for individuals seeking to gain emerging market experience while working to support enterprises in India that deliver social change to local and global communities. To date IDEX has supported over 130 college graduates and young professionals from all corners of the world to transition into high impact careers

story:
Our journey 

Hey! I'm Miles! I'm a passionate security professional from the Bay Area. I am launching this fundraiser to help make my dream of owning my own security company, CheckN Security, a reality.

Straight of of high school in 2000, I was offered a job as a security guard at the Oakland Henry J. Kaiser Event Center. Under the leadership of my uncle Michael A. Campbell, who was the director of security, I developed a true passion for helping others. After 5 years on the job, the City of Oakland closed down the arena and I was without a job. My love of doing security work led me to continue to pursue a career in the field with different security companies. My everyday consists of customer service, providing security and safety to people from all over the world, and truly connecting with the people that I help. After over 15 years working for security company after company, learning all about security while in the profession, I developed a drive to start my own security company.  I am passionate about my field, driven by the love of keeping people safe and I am dedicated to offering customer service everyday. 

CheckN Security!



WE ARE THE UBER OF SECURITY FOR ALL YOUR SAFETY AND SECURITY NEEDS!
Utilizing advanced mobile technology through our App we are able to provide security professionals to you on DEMAND for all your security needs!
In order to get this off the ground and help keep people safe, we need your help!!!!!!!

You can help us with purchasing office supplies to help start our business from a-z!

WITH YOUR HELP & OUR SECRET TECHNOLOGY WE WILL SECURE THE WORLD!

What We Need & What You Get!!

You will provide a concrete foundation to help us get our business started and growing in areas and communities all across the world using a special technology!!

  • A functional website and app.  
  • A functional laptop,
  • Special technology CheckN tags.
  • Business licenses and documents.
  • Marketing materials.
  • Uniforms.
  • Security guard safety equipment.
  • If we do not reach our goal, your funds will give us the finicial push to hovver off the ground!

The Impact

You can help us CheckN on small businesses and homeowners all over the world, and bring back customer service, safety and the passion of helping others available at your fingertips!

Risks & Challenges

We will risk our hard work, dedication and passion to go above and beyond too keep people, small businesses and communities safe.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please just share our business with the world or reach out if you need someone to CheckN on you and your family!!

story:
Short Summary

Chris and RouthEvelyn want to start a small, emergency preparedness business in Northwest Arkansas, but we need YOUR help! We need to raise money to get Native Ready off the ground so we can start helping families be prepared in the face of the unexpected!

Chris and RouthEvelyn met at a campus event at Arkansas Tech University where they were both (and Chris still is!) studying Emergency Management. Since that time, a close friendship has ensued which has now led them to starting their own business. 

Native Ready began with a simple idea: To help families within the community prepare for the unexpected. Chris and RouthEvelyn's passion is to help others, so why not do that in the field that they both love, which is Emergency Management? When a disaster hits (AKA Tornadoes, Hurricanes, Home Fires, and much more) a majority of individuals are either uniformed, not prepared, or completely deny their risk to being the victim of a disaster. When you are not prepared for a disaster or simple emergency you can be at risk of injury, death, property loss, psychological harm, and so much more. At Native Ready, our mission is to help get families prepared by implementing mitigation strategies, doing a thorough evaluation of hazards both inside and outside the home, writing an emergency evacuation plan specific for families, and finally providing disaster kits to families that can help them survive and recover from a disaster once one occurs. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our overhead is quite low, but just because it is low does not mean that we are able to start our business without money. We are seeking $10,000 and plan to recover that money fairly quickly once we are able to go public and able to start taking clients. The following is a breakdown of our startup costs:

$2,000-Liability Insurance, because you can never be too insured! 

$2,000- Lawyer, to help us with customer agreements, liability waivers, and confidentiality contracts.

$1,000- CPA, who will provide us with financial management. 

$4,000- Emergency Kit Supplies, This allows us to buy all the products needed for the emergency bags that we will be giving to families. These kits include anything from whistles and water purifying tablets to pocket utility knifes and fire proof safe boxes.  

$1,000- Marketing and miscellaneous expenses.


Our gift to you for helping us out will be a couple of fun emergency preparedness products that can help you weather the storm :)

The Impact

Our impact, once we are able to get established, will be quite monumental. Not only will we be helping families prepare for and recover from disasters, but we will be helping essential county and local emergency response personnel in the critical moments after a disaster so that they can focus on helping other victims which can in turn possibly allow them to save lives. 

Chris & RouthEvelyn both have extensive experience in emergency planning and response.  They are both members of the International Association of Emergency Managers and the American Red Cross.

-Chris has worked on emergency management related projects for United States Senator John Boozman, the Crawford County Department of Emergency Management, and the Arkansas Tech Department of Emergency Management. He wrote and conducted a full scale emergency exercise for the Crawford County Department of Emergency Management which gained national attention for its quality and execution. He has also been on several emergency response deployments with the American Red Cross where he has witnessed first hand the damage and destruction that can be brought on by disasters and what effects they can bring to victims. 

-RouthEvelyn received her Masters in Emergency Management in the Spring of 2015. She played a critical role in the Arkansas Tech Department of Emergency Management serving as a graduate assistant where she worked closely with faculty and students. She has worked on several emergency management related projects including a COOP plan for Arkansas Tech University administration departments, a database for the FBI Little Rock Field Office, and the Arkansas State Police. She has served as the Global Student Council Secretary for the International Association of Emergency Managers and has been an American Red Cross volunteer. 

Risks & Challenges

At Native Ready, we consider ourselves pioneering emergency managers. We are the new face of emergency management and want to make emergency preparedness the new-hip thing to do.

Our biggest challenge is simply informing families and households why they need to be prepared. Organizations such as the American Red Cross and the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) preach that you need to be prepared, but does anyone do it? No, they don't. Why? It's usually either because they do not know how to properly prepare or because they are just too busy and do not have the time. That's where we come in, we like to call ourselves your personal emergency manager. Come rain, shine, tornado, or earthquake, we will be there to help you weather the storm (or earthquake!) and walk you through the proper recovery process so that you can have peace of mind. We are going to be specifically targeting families with young children and senior citizens who may need specialized help. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Like and share our page on Facebook, follow us on Instagram, and visit our website at www.Nativeready.com

Other Ways You Can Help
 Like and share our page on Facebook, follow us on Instagram, and visit our website at www.Nativeready.com

story:
Dog Collar Bandana-Reversible

The must have bandana of Fall 2016 for your favorite fur friend! The Two Bitch™ Bourbon over the collar reversible bandana is the perfect pet accessory. Sport the Two Bitch™ Bourbon logo when you and your pet are letting your hair down or reverse it to let people know that your dog is refined and well bred. Available in your choice of "Old Teddy Bear", "Dapper Plaid" or "Debonair Dog". 3 sizes (S,M,L). Comes with an adjustable collar or slide it onto an existing collar.

FREE SHIPPING!

$15

This Item Ships Free!

 

Give & Take

In early 2015, while at her Bridal Shower in New Mexico, Lauren received the call from her fiancé Joe in Nevada, telling her that Mocha Bean, her dog of 10 years was lost to the desert. Amazingly, two months later Lauren still married Joe.

In August, Lauren returned to New Mexico. The desert had a gift waiting for her there. Two Doberman-mix puppies – sisters! – had been left at the shelter after being found in the desert. Lauren packed them up and drove Scarlett & Sage home to Nevada.

Two Bitch™ Bourbon

For years, Joe & Lauren have held whiskey parties at their home bar, appropriately called the Luby Saloon. A few months ago, they were designing an invitation to a whiskey party and wanted to incorporate the new dogs into the design. The result was Two Bitch™ Bourbon, named for Scarlett & Sage!

It started as a fun bourbon bottle mock-up on the invitation, but everyone thought it was a great idea for a new brand of bourbon and spirits. Thus, Two Bitch Spirits Ltd., and Two Bitch™ Bourbon were born!

 

 

We are planning a full line of spirits including multiple bourbon editions (e.g., cask strength, single barrel, etc.) as well as other whiskey profiles. The first product available commercially will be our unaged whiskey (moonshine). It will be distilled using the same recipe as our standard bourbon. At the same time, our first batch of bourbon will go into the barrels to begin the maturation process. We also expect to bring a blended product to the market in the first few months following the Indiegogo campaign.

Overall, whiskeys aged in the desert climate tend to mature faster and compare very favorably with longer-aged batches from more moderate regions. Ultimately, it’s all about you! The more funds we can raise through this Indiegogo campaign, then the more juice we can put in barrels and the more variety of products we can bring to the market sooner.

 

Some things just fall into place! As we searched for a distillery partner we found George Racz, Founder and Master Distiller of the Las Vegas Distillery. George wrote the Nevada distillery law and became the first legal distiller in the state.
 

We want YOU to be part of our story! Join the good times by helping fund our Indiegogo.com campaign. You’ll be a permanent member of our Distiller’s Circle and will be part of Two Bitch Spirits Ltd. history. You will be recognized on a special page on our website as an early supporter! You'll also receive early access to new limited-release products, special offers, and invitations to special events. If you love dogs, bourbon, and good times, then you need to be in the Distiller's Circle!

 

This perk level has it all! Receive a Two Bitch Bourbon 2L Oak Barrel, 3 Vouchers for Two Bitch Unaged Whiskey (moonshine) - enough to fill the barrel w/ some leftover! - Voucher for a Limited Edition Founder's Bottle of Two Bitch Bourbon (won't be sold in stores), Distiller's Circle T-shirt, Hat, Bandana & 2 Shot Glasses! Great as gift items too! Shipping in time for Christmas!

$250

 

 

Make sure your dog gets one of our Two Bitch™ Bourbon Bandanas. Send us your best photo of your pooch sporting their stylish bandana and we will add them to our Two Bitch™ Bourbon Bandana Buddies web page.

 

Let the good times roll! Are you a winner? We think you are. That's why we are hosting fun contests, giving away swag and celebrating you - our supporters!   Get your Two Bitch™ Bourbon swag ready and join us. Here's what's coming up:

  • Two Bitch™ Bourbon Swag Photo Contest
  • Tag Your Bar - Two Bitch™ Bourbon Shot Glass Shots
  • Mixology Masters Cocktail Showdown

Have a contest idea? We want to hear from you! Post your idea in the comments section.

Go on. We won't bite!

 

Presenting the 3 Winners from the Dogs of Luxury Instagram Photo Contest! We had the best time looking at all the wonderful creative entries! We wish we could send every pooch a prize (more contests to come)!

Thank you to everyone who participated and congratulations to our winners:

Miss Boston @DobieSisters

Princess Ruby @Ruby.toot.toot

Brother Yorkie @the_cat_and_the_flying_rat

 

Okay. We get it. Even though it's all about the dogs, our brand name has the potential for a lot of word play.

"Make it a DOUBLE! Because Two Bitches are better than one."

"Small Batch With Bite!"

Post your best catch phrase or tagline in the comments section. You may just inspire a new Perk (shirt, hat, thong or something).

 

It's a big wild world out there! Please help Scarlett and Sage spread the word about Two Bitch™ Bourbon and this Indiegogo campaign.  Use the share buttons in the top right corner to share this campaign with the world! If you're logged into your Indiegogo account the share tools will generate a unique ID allowing you to get credit for your referrals. We see referral rewards in your future (Hint, Hint)! Details coming soon.

 

"I've been Dad's best friend for 10 years. Did he call it 'Good Boy Hunter's Bourbon'? No.  He named the new company after two yappy new pups leaving me out in the cold. I hate those bitches!"

 

Perk Particulars

1. Several of our perks require you to make a selection of size, color or item. You will receive an email requesting this information.

2. Vouchers for Two Bitch™ Unaged Whiskey (moonshine) and Limited Edition Founder's Bottles of Two Bitch™ Bourbon will be redeemable at Las Vegas Distillery and participating retailers. There is no guarantee that a participating retailer will be available in every state. Earliest expected redemption date for Two Bitch™ Bourbon Unaged Whiskey (moonshine) vouchers is November 2016. Earliest possible redemption date for Limited Edition Founder's Bottles of Two Bitch™ Bourbon vouchers will be late 2017 or later depending on factors beyond our control, particularly the maturation process.

Two Bitch™ Bourbon Swag Photo Contest
Tag Your Bar - Two Bitch™ Bourbon Shot Glass Shots
Mixology Masters Cocktail Showdown

Have a contest idea? We want to hear from you! Post your idea in the comments section.
Go on. We won't bite!
 


Presenting the 3 Winners from the Dogs of Luxury Instagram Photo Contest! We had the best time looking at all the wonderful creative entries! We wish we could send every pooch a prize (more contests to come)!
Thank you to everyone who participated and congratulations to our winners:

You may just inspire a new Perk (shirt, hat, thong or something). It's a big wild world out there! story:
Here's the Low-Down

We've been on the hunt for several years for the next statement-making venue (where you can do almost anything), and recently found the cutest spot at the RiverPlace on Green Street near the Riverwalk in the heart of downtown McHenry, IL!

There's two units in vanilla box condition between Kiera Confections, High Volume Hair Salon, and BuddyZ that we will combine into one beautiful 2,800 square foot space. It will be the perfect spot for parties, events, meetings, classes, events, etcetera. 

Our neighbors in the sky will be the tenants who live in the fully occupied 27 unit apartment complex at the Riverplace on Green Street (South of 120). This section of Green Street is home to its fair share of fun businesses and several events already take place throughout the year. We're especially looking forward to Cruise Nights, Open Air Markets, parades, holiday events and more.

We will also become members of the Downtown Business Association which brings fun community events to the area all year long.

Mixin Mingle McHenry will be outfitted with two bathrooms, a kitchenette sink with cabinets, refrigerator/freezer, round/rectangle/cocktail tables, chairs, TV, designer slatwall for decorating and exhibiting, speaker system, free wifi, and more. We expect there to be seating for about 150 guests or more (pending permit). Event hosts will be able to bring their own food and beverages (including beer and wine). We will rarely restrict you from being able to decide what you want to have--it's your event after all.

Pricing will be slightly higher than our Woodstock venue due to the increased expenses, but it will still be an affordable option for customers versus traditional venues. Plus, it will serve as a great nearby location that can be reserved when the Woodstock location is already booked (you know how frustrating it is to lose bookings because their date is taken?).

If all goes as planned, we will be open late August or early September 2016, and will throw a Grand Reveal Party to celebrate at the new location with our backers.

We can't wait to see it all come together!

Let's Talk Moola & Perks for a Minute

"If it were easy, everyone would do it" (Confucius?), but it isn't. To help us reach what feels like the peak of Mount Everest, we're offering a number of special perks for a limited time only, including: 

Grand Reveal Party Ticket $10
You gotta fight...for your right...to PARRRRRRR-TAAAAAAY! That's right--we'll throw a big Grand Reveal Party to show off the new digs. It'll be complete with local music, food and drink, and guaranteed fun for the whole fam damily!

Online Stardom $25
We can't promise you'll be the next Chewbacca Mom, but we'll do our best and put your name or logo on our new online wall of fame at www.mixinmingle.com. We'll also throw in a free ticket to the Grand Reveal Party!

Double Down ($100 Certificate) $50
Remember the Double-Mint gum commercial where you get extra flavor and extra fun? This is kind of like that except you'll get double your money when you book an event at either Mixin Mingle location. $100 will be credited to your account for just $50. We'll also throw in 2 free tickets to the Grand Reveal Party!

Grand Reveal Party Sponsor $75
We love being a destination for affordable, mini convention-esque experiences that help local businesses create connections in the community. You'll be a featured sponsor in all advertising for the big Grand Reveal Party plus an 8ft table space to show off your products and services. We'll also throw in the Online Stardom and 4 free tickets to the Grand Reveal Party! We are looking for fun and unique offerings for this shindig from local businesses.

10% VIP Savings for Life $100
That's right, we'll put you in our top secret preferred customer database and you'll save 10% on the listed price for event bookings at any of our locations from now until eternity. (Before anyone asks--yes, the discount applies to vendor spaces at events hosted by Mixin Mingle.) We'll also throw in 2 free tickets to the Grand Reveal Party!

20% VIP Savings for Life $200
That's right, we'll put you in our top secret preferred customer database and you'll save 20% on the listed price for event bookings at any of our locations from now until eternity. (Before anyone asks--yes, the discount applies to vendor spaces at events hosted by Mixin Mingle.) We'll also throw in 4 free tickets to the Grand Reveal Party!

Almost Famous Wall of Fame $300
Achieve celebrity status (minus the paparazzi) and feature your name or logo on our Almost Famous Wall off Fame. You'll have your very own 8"x10" picture framed for everyone to remember you by until the end of time. We'll also throw in the Online Stardom and 4 free tickets to the Grand Reveal Party!

Showered with Love Party $500
First comes love, then comes marriage, then comes the baby in the baby carriage! With so many reasons to celebrate, spoil your lucky guests with a fabulous shower. You'll get the room for up to 6 hours on a weekend (ending by 4pm), and we'll throw in the room setup, cleanup, tables, chairs and white table linens! Call 1-815-308-5170 to check your date.

Wedding Wonderland Booking $1000 

Getting hitched doesn't have to cost an arm and a leg. And just imagine how cool of a backdrop the Riverwalk will be for your wedding photos. You'll get the room for up to 14 hours on a weekend (ending by midnight), and we'll throw in the room setup, cleanup, tables, chairs and white table linens! Call 1-815-308-5170 to check your date.

Join Us!

You can help us get the room at the McHenry Riverplace and back us any number of ways, including grabbing a perk (or two), making a financial contribution, or pre-booking the space for events after September 2016. You can also spread the Mixin Mingle LOVE by sharing this campaign on your social pages. Also, if you or anyone you know is a licensed and insured carpenter, drywall/painter, electrician, or plumber and would like to trade services in exchange for some perks to help get us going, please give us a call at 1-815-308-5170.

Signing off for now, and we thank you from the bottom of our hearts for helping us grow!

XOXOXO,
Mixin Mingle
Naté Grindeland, Founder & President
Melissa McMahon, Manager

info@mixinmingle.com
www.mixinmingle.com

Getting hitched doesn't have to cost an arm and a leg. And just imagine how cool of a backdrop the Riverwalk will be for your wedding photos. You'll get the room for up to 14 hours on a weekend (ending by midnight), and we'll throw in the room setup, cleanup, tables, chairs and white table linens! Call 1-815-308-5170 to check your date.




Join Us!

 You can help us get the room at the McHenry Riverplace and back us any number of ways, including grabbing a perk (or two), making a financial contribution, or pre-booking the space for events after September 2016. You can also spread the Mixin Mingle LOVE by sharing this campaign on your social pages. Also, if you or anyone you know is a licensed and insured carpenter, drywall/painter, electrician, or plumber and would like to trade services in exchange for some perks to help get us going, please give us a call at 1-815-308-5170.
Signing off for now, and we thank you from the bottom of our hearts for helping us grow!
XOXOXO,Mixin MingleNaté Grindeland, Founder & PresidentMelissa McMahon, Manager
info@mixinmingle.comwww.mixinmingle.com

story:
Hello.  Thank you for visiting our IndieGoGo campaign.   We here at STX Events pride ourselves on producing quality, fan and family friendly pop culture events that everyone can enjoy.  We started out by putting on smaller one-day events in the Houston/Katy/Woodlands areas, and then expanded to putting on a full scale convention with last years Brazos Valley Comic Con in Bryan, Texas.

With this campaign, we hope to raise additional funds to bring you an even more exciting show than the one we are already brining this year.  It is important to us, and to you, for our convention to stand out from the pack.  In an area such as Bryan/College Station, there is a higher chance that a successful, highly attended comic convention can impact the local businesses by attracting out of town attendees.  One of the best ways to attract fans from out of town is by presenting guests that they haven’t had the opportunity to meet elsewhere in the state.  By helping us ensure the success of this years event, you also help to ensure the existence of next years event.

In this campaign we are attempting to raise a minimum of $35,000.  Yes, you’re correct, that is quite a bit of money.  If you choose to support us, your donation will go toward the following:

  • Securing guests.   Appearance fees, flights, and hotel rooms can add up rather quickly.  Whether they are from the comics industry or entertainment industry, this is where the lions share of the funds will be used.

  • Hotel for our volunteers.   Thanks to the BOSS program at Fort Hood, our volunteer force is comprised of active duty soldiers.  Part of the arrangement is for us to provide lodging for them, but, sadly, before we had confirmation of their involvement this year, our budget was at its end.

  • Advertising.  While we will of course be advertising on TV, radio, and internet, we also want billboards.  While we have some existing budget for the other venues, billboards are Expensive, and surprisingly so.   We’d like to have some up before the college semester starts.

To pique your interest and inspire you to help, we have some amazing (and some odd) perks for you to take advantage of.   Ranging from a simple Thank You to staring in one of our off-beat commercials to owning an original piece of art by a legendary comic artist…there is bound to be something that catches your eye.  

 In our “Amped!” tier alone, you have the opportunity to receive an exclusive VIP badge that gains you entrance to not only the con, but to any afterparty, opening ceremony, or other event associated with the con.  It also features exclusive art that was created for us by Adam Kubert!  It is unsure whether or not Adam’s artwork has ever been used on a con badge before, but this is definitely the first time a con in Texas has had the opportunity to feature such an item.  You can take part in history!  Plus, if you head over to our Facebook page, you can have a say in what the final art will be!  

One of the great things about IndieGoGo compared to other similar services…we do not have to reach our goal in order for you to help make a difference!   While meeting or exceeding our goal is the more desired outcome, if we don’t, we are able to take the support you’ve given us and, for lack of better phrasing, do the best we can with what we’ve got.  What this means is that every dollar helps us to add more to the event we already have, and every contribution is wholeheartedly appreciated.

The biggest risk we are facing with this campaign is the availability of guests.  We have spoken with a number of celebrities, and while they are available on November 5th and 6th at the moment, that could change by the end of our campaign.  Not to worry, though.  We will still strive to bring you relevant and “rare” guests that you haven’t had an opportunity to meet elsewhere in the state.

If you can’t contribute to our convention at this time, don’t feel bad…we understand.   There are still ways you can help us, though.   Sharing the link on your social media pages is one of the quickest and easiest ways to help.  Adding a hashtag (even though they’re kind of lame) can help it reach even more people.   Our official hashtag is #BVCC, and we have been using #80sAwareness quite often, too.  #Deadpool always gets a lot of views, also….plus we already have a Deadpool artist booked at the con.

Thank you again for taking the time to visit our page.  We appreciate your support in any form

story:
The TicrThing has been launched! 

Missed the campaign? Get your TicrThing at our official web shop!

 

 

 

Summary

The TicrThing is your hands-free bitcoin companion. It is a geeky gadget that puts the bitcoin price right at your table, an eye glance away.

 

How it works

The cube periodically connects to your local WiFi network or hotspot, polls the bitcoin price online and displays it on the screen.

 

Features

  • Distraction-free - don’t lose focus on your work
  • Wireless - no cables on your table
  • Portable - integrated rechargeable battery
  • Optimized for different viewing angles
  • OLED display - perfect visibility in bright and dark rooms
  • No additional app - just your regular browser
  • No accounts or registration needed
  • Highly configurable

 

Get timely warning to price swings, so that you never miss the right market opportunity to make profit. The screen flashes on large price jumps, warning you of big market moves as they happen.

 

The TicrThing simplifies price watch down to a single value. No trend lines, volume depths or complex price indicators. What is the current bitcoin price? The answer is right there, anytime, without starting an app.

 

Story

This project grew from our passion about the Blockchain revolution. We’ve been immersed in the cryptocurrency ecosystem long enough to know this: everyone is secretly obsessed with the bitcoin price. And we have to admit it - we too get excited watching the price roller-coaster. We wanted to create a gadget that makes the price watch as simple as checking the time. So we built the TicrThing and showcased it in our local bitcoin community, which responded with overwhelmingly positive feedback. This gave us the motivation to pursue it further. We then demonstrated our first prototypes to a broader audience at Barcelona Mini Maker Faire.

Your support will help us implement all the cool designs and features on our roadmap and bring the cube in production, so you can enjoy your hands-free bitcoin companion. Above all, your backing will enable us to share our passion with the broader cryptocurrency community and to offer our contribution to the Blockchain ecosystem.

 

Project timeline

Models

By supporting our campaign you will become one of the first to receive the TicrThing. We offer the following models:

  • TicrThing Classic - Eco-friendly wooden case
  • TicrThing Core - 3D printed case from PET (recycled plastic bottles)
  • TicrThing Craft - same as Classic, but we will engrave your text, logo or QR code on the walls of your choice (left, right and/or top walls). After purchasing, send us an e-mail with your design and desired position.
  • TicrThing Clear - black acrylic case. Shiny and reflective in the day, pitch black at night. The white screen contrasts the dark surface just perfectly. Smooth to the touch.

In addition, we are currently evaluating prototypes of the following models:

  • Painted wood in different colors
  • Different types of wood
  • Acrylic in different colors, including transparent
  • Aluminum/metal case
  • 3D printed case from PLA in different colors

 

Roadmap

Your funding will help us improve the current prototype and bring a ton of new designs and features for the next model:

  • Support for more national and crypto currencies
  • Cloud service for more robust price polling
  • Improve connection security
  • Different case materials
  • Optimized firmware
  • Lower energy consumption
  • Improve user interface
  • Create manual, and how-to video guides
  • Wireless firmware update
  • Decreasing case dimensions

 

Stretch goals:

  • Other price tickers - raw materials, stocks, fuel prices, etc.
  • Battery-saving display for improved energy autonomy
  • Buttons for immediate buy/sell order
  • Sound alarm for price jumps
  • Different product shapes and designs

story:
I am Cynthia Okoye, I am 20 years old, I hail from Awka, Anambra state with Twins (a boy and a girl) and my husband just lost his job.

This had made it very hard for us to sustain in the family so I and my husband put head together to start a laundry business so we can take care of the little children in our hand. We've contacted family members for help and none is coming forth so we need your help in starting up the business.
By helping us, you will help us sustain the family from going into hunger and starting a business means you are giving us and the children a better life to live.

What We Need 

My husband "Francis" is an app developer and he has decided to use his skill to make sure the business has a mobile application where people can order for their laundry in our area and we will quickly go to pick their clothes and wash then deliver to their doorstep. This will make the business succeed quickly. But we will need other equipment like washing machines, dryer, motorcycle (for delivery) and iron. We will also look for a small space we can use to start up with.

Risks & Challenges

It will be hard to deliver to far distances so we will only launch the mobile app service to customers around us for now so we can deliver in time without delay.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also share our story with your friends so they can help us. We will never let you down. Please help us! Help my family!

story:
Welcome to Dylan Fabrics!

Dylan Fabrics is a retail fabric store coming soon to Silverdale, WA. Without nearly enough local options for good quality fabric with great service at great prices, it's time for a new place to shop.

Dylan Fabrics will specialize in fashion, apparel, and costume fabrics and trims, with additional inventory in quilting and home decor. We'll offer a variety of styles and types, focusing on modern and up-to-date styles that match today's fashion trends. The store will include a community sewing area where we'll hold events, classes, and sewing circles to increase engagement and camaraderie in our local sewing community.

As of April, 2016 we have an existing inventory of 400 different fabrics, and countless ribbons and buttons. We are in negotiations on a retail storefront in Silverdale, to be available in June 2016. Additional inventory is required to offer customers the best possible array of fabrics and notions to complete any sewing project with style and aplomb!

What You Get

A contribution to the Dylan Fabrics indiegogo campaign will earn you:

  • A members-only preview of inventory pre-opening, with first dibs on purchasing.
  • Invitations to members-only events, promotions, classes, and special deals.
  • A personal sewing tutorial from proprietor Melissa Dylan ($50 minimum contribution required)
  • Access to a local source for fabric whose focus is on individualized shopper experiences, quality fabric at reasonable prices, and customer needs. If we don't have what you're looking for, we can find it!

The Impact

The Big Box stores have cornered the market for fabric and sewing supplies in Silverdale and outlying areas. They are out of touch with the next generation of people who sew. Their inventory is low-quality and over-priced, styles are out of date, and customer service is nonexistent. Dylan Fabrics will offer an alternative place to purchase supplies, a community in which to create and inspire, and an open mind and heart to add supplies based on what you need, not what someone in a corner office thinks you need!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please get the word out and share this campaign!
  •  Indiegogo share tools are available to help spread the word!

story:
Organicburgr Project: Helping Communities Rise.

Motivating people every day to improve the lives of others through enjoyment of nutritious organic food.

The charitable Organicburgr project sprouted from 3 basic beliefs:

  • To harness the power of organic food
  • To create equal employment opportunity for millennials
  • To improve the lives of young families with children

The driving forces behind the Organicburgr project aim to change people’s approach and outlook on animal rearing, meat consumption, the benefit of local trade and to create fair employment opportunities for young people from underprivileged backgrounds. 

 

We aim to elevate community life through sales of organic burgers (from our pop-up food cart) to help millennials & families with young children live better lives and to build a prosperous and sustainable future for generations to come.

 

The Organicburgr project will launch its pilot programme in London, Summer 2017, serving:

Healthy, mouth-watering Organic Burgers & fresh fruit Smoothies from a pop-up food cart. The gourmet patties are grilled over an open flame fuelled by wood using prime cuts of 100% organic, locally sourced meat and are made fresh to order.

Harnessing the power of organic food

We introduce a convenient yet healthy and organic lunch option into people’s lives by serving tasty handcrafted burgers & smoothies prepared from sustainable organic ingredients sourced locally.

Creating Equal Opportunity for Millennials

We support local communities by employing young people from troubled backgrounds.

Improving the lives of others

We donate organic food, educational toys and adventure days out to families in need of ongoing support.

 

So how do we do it?

Easy.

(Well, not that easy, but nonetheless, worthwhile.)

 

We sell our organic and handcrafted burgers and smoothies prepared from local organic fruit and veg from our pop-up food cart and use the proceeds to invest into the local community.

 

Let's talk burgers.

Burgers are one of the culinary world’s most popular and tastiest creations. (No argument there, José!)



 

They come in a variety of combinations and options, yet more often than not does their consumption lead to health adverse effects due to the long and frightening list of ingredients such as GMO’s, trans fats, food dyes and other harmful food additives that are best avoided.

The driving forces behind the Organicburgr project aim to change people’s approach and outlook on animal rearing, meat consumption, the benefit of local trade and create fair employment opportunities for young people from troubled backgrounds.

 

 

We are proud to support

 

 

A recent survey conducted by DEFRA and the office for national statistics calculated the average UK household spend on food that could have been eaten but is thrown away is around £470 a year. The Organicburgr project teamed up with a local Devon based farm which will supply us with 100% organic and sustainable produce including the premium beef, great tasting organic vegetables, artisan burger buns and fine local cheeses to complete the unique culinary experience.

The selection of fresh and organic fruit smoothies are season dependent. All fruits are grown in Devon, Kent and Essex. We Love food. Hate waste.

The Organicburgr project prides itself to overcome the issue of food waste. Our burgers are prepared daily from fresh organic produce. Any surplus meat, veg and fruit are donated to local food banks.

 

You. The people behind the Organicburgr food revolution project. (Together. We are stronger.)

 

 

Margaret and Michael, the founders of the Organicburgr project, always had a passion for healthy foods and a strong interest for organic produce, local agriculture along with its interconnected effects on our lives. The notion towards a health conscious and balanced diet has only strengthened since they became first time parents to their daughter Maya in 2015.

The first London based pilot project will create five full time jobs. The new-hires will consist of young people from disadvantaged backgrounds. One of the core aims of the Organicburgr project is to give those that are talented and willing to work a chance for meaningful full time employment at competitive wages and long term career prospects.

The hiring and placement process will be overseen by accredited London based charity organisations.

 

The Organicburgr project aims to make a difference in the lives of young people through secure full time employment and competitive wages.
 

SOME SAY, MAKE A BETTER WORLD FOR OUR CHILDREN. 
WE SAY, MAKE BETTER CHILDREN FOR OUR WORLD.

 

Poverty affects one in four children in the UK today. There were 3.9 million children living in poverty in the UK in 2014-15. That’s 28 per cent of children, or 9 in a classroom of 30. London is the area with the highest rates of child poverty in the country.

The Organicburgr project is designed to donate 20% of its profits to families with young children.

To ensure that donations reach the families, we have taken the conscious decision to avoid cash donations.

Instead we have opted to make meaningful donations by regular food deliveries in partnership with our local farms. A selection of fresh and organic vegetable, fruit, meat and other food staples will be delivered to London and Essex based families on a weekly basis. As the Organicburgr project grows additional families will benefit from our programme.

Good to know
 

 

The Organicburgr project exists to make meaningful charitable contributions to local poverty-stricken families and their young children. Ongoing donations are made by means of clothing, food, educational tools such as toys, a variety of courses and computer equipment.

The Organicburgr project also helps organise and cover the cost of adventure days out such as visits to the Zoo, short trips and various sports events.

Driving force of change. Everyday.

The concept of the Organicburgr project is built upon force of change to improve knowledge of food consumption, individual ingredients and the impact food choices can have on our health and overall wellbeing.

Our approach

Combined with a structured, sound and scalable model we anticipate to expand rapidly to deliver the concept of the Organicburgr project to a wide audience across the UK and further afield.

Our aim

Our aim is to help families and their young children. To promote local trade, improve employment opportunities for young people from underprivileged backgrounds within local communities, to better animal welfare and to educate through insightful knowledge about organic foods.

An ambitious project. To serve for the greater good of all.

The Organicburgr project aims to motivate people every day to help one another through the enjoyment of tasty & healthy organic burgers.

Getting started

The Organicburgr project concept has been drafted and prepared in great detail over the past eighteen months.

Realistically speaking, the biggest risk is not achieving the funding goal of $100,000. Coming short of the full amount may delay the launch.

Naturally, there are other unforeseen risks when launching any new venture, especially with something as involved as the Organicburgr project which doesn’t operate for profit alone but mainly for the greater good of the community. In the end it all comes down to how well the venture is prepared for such challenges and the passion and drive behind the project.

The Organicburgr project team is made up of a group of experienced and passionate people that can help handle the challenge that may come our way.

Another potential challenge would have been to ensure that our local farm would be able to deliver its fresh organic produce on time, every time. To eliminate this potential short coming we have teamed up with a group of local farms that can step in on short notice to fill the gap if and when required.

 

 

Local farms. Supplying local produce.
100% organic. No compromise.

The Organicburgr project teamed up with a local Devon based farm who will supply us with 100% organic and sustainable produce such as responsibly raised beef, organic vegetables, organic artisan bread and fine local cheeses to complete the culinary experience.

The selection of fresh and organic fruit smoothies varies depending on the season and are grown in Devon, Kent and Essex.

 

$100,000.

The cost to launch and run the project.
Will you help by giving $3?

 

Where will my money go?


All funds will be used towards staff wages, a pop-up food cart, cooking equipment, inventory and ongoing project-related expense such as our involvement in the charitable element of the Organicburgr project.

Based on conservatively calculated budget and revenue forecasts we anticipate that the raised amount will get the project live within six months. The quarterly forecast foresees the project to draw positive turnover within six months from launch date.

Any profit will be used to grow the project in line with the core ethos to serve healthy organic food and to improve the lives of others by adding direct and tangible benefit to local communities through employment of young and underprivileged young people and by supporting families with young children requiring ongoing support.

 

Will you support the cause?

Your contribution will make a positive impact on local communities.

 

 

We want to hear from you. Contact us today to make a difference.
Our support line number is +44 20 7117 2857.

#Organic_burgr.
Motivating people every day to improve the lives of others through enjoyment of nutritious organic food.

Motivating people every day to improve the lives of others through enjoyment of nutritious organic food.
The charitable Organicburgr project sprouted from 3 basic beliefs:

To harness the power of organic food
To create equal employment opportunity for millennials
To improve the lives of young families with children

The driving forces behind the Organicburgr project aim to change people’s approach and outlook on animal rearing, meat consumption, the benefit of local trade and to create fair employment opportunities for young people from underprivileged backgrounds. 
 
We aim to elevate community life through sales of organic burgers (from our pop-up food cart) to help millennials & families with young children live better lives and to build a prosperous and sustainable future for generations to come.
 
The Organicburgr project will launch its pilot programme in London, Summer 2017, serving:
Healthy, mouth-watering Organic Burgers & fresh fruit Smoothies from a pop-up food cart. The gourmet patties are grilled over an open flame fuelled by wood using prime cuts of 100% organic, locally sourced meat and are made fresh to order.

Harnessing the power of organic food
We introduce a convenient yet healthy and organic lunch option into people’s lives by serving tasty handcrafted burgers & smoothies prepared from sustainable organic ingredients sourced locally.
Creating Equal Opportunity for Millennials
We support local communities by employing young people from troubled backgrounds.
Improving the lives of others
We donate organic food, educational toys and adventure days out to families in need of ongoing support.
 
So how do we do it?
Easy.
(Well, not that easy, but nonetheless, worthwhile.)
 
We sell our organic and handcrafted burgers and smoothies prepared from local organic fruit and veg from our pop-up food cart and use the proceeds to invest into the local community.
 
Let's talk burgers. 
Burgers are one of the culinary world’s most popular and tastiest creations. (No argument there, José!)

 
They come in a variety of combinations and options, yet more often than not does their consumption lead to health adverse effects due to the long and frightening list of ingredients such as GMO’s, trans fats, food dyes and other harmful food additives that are best avoided.
The driving forces behind the Organicburgr project aim to change people’s approach and outlook on animal rearing, meat consumption, the benefit of local trade and create fair employment opportunities for young people from troubled backgrounds.
 

 
We are proud to support
 

 
A recent survey conducted by DEFRA and the office for national statistics calculated the average UK household spend on food that could have been eaten but is thrown away is around £470 a year. The Organicburgr project teamed up with a local Devon based farm which will supply us with 100% organic and sustainable produce including the premium beef, great tasting organic vegetables, artisan burger buns and fine local cheeses to complete the unique culinary experience.
The selection of fresh and organic fruit smoothies are season dependent. All fruits are grown in Devon, Kent and Essex. We Love food. Hate waste.
The Organicburgr project prides itself to overcome the issue of food waste. Our burgers are prepared daily from fresh organic produce. Any surplus meat, veg and fruit are donated to local food banks.
 
You. The people behind the Organicburgr food revolution project. (Together. We are stronger.)
 

 
Margaret and Michael, the founders of the Organicburgr project, always had a passion for healthy foods and a strong interest for organic produce, local agriculture along with its interconnected effects on our lives. The notion towards a health conscious and balanced diet has only strengthened since they became first time parents to their daughter Maya in 2015.
The first London based pilot project will create five full time jobs. The new-hires will consist of young people from disadvantaged backgrounds. One of the core aims of the Organicburgr project is to give those that are talented and willing to work a chance for meaningful full time employment at competitive wages and long term career prospects.The hiring and placement process will be overseen by accredited London based charity organisations.
 
The Organicburgr project aims to make a difference in the lives of young people through secure full time employment and competitive wages. 
SOME SAY, MAKE A BETTER WORLD FOR OUR CHILDREN. WE SAY, MAKE BETTER CHILDREN FOR OUR WORLD.
 
Poverty affects one in four children in the UK today. There were 3.9 million children living in poverty in the UK in 2014-15. That’s 28 per cent of children, or 9 in a classroom of 30. London is the area with the highest rates of child poverty in the country.
The Organicburgr project is designed to donate 20% of its profits to families with young children.
To ensure that donations reach the families, we have taken the conscious decision to avoid cash donations.
Instead we have opted to make meaningful donations by regular food deliveries in partnership with our local farms. A selection of fresh and organic vegetable, fruit, meat and other food staples will be delivered to London and Essex based families on a weekly basis. As the Organicburgr project grows additional families will benefit from our programme.
Good to know 

 
The Organicburgr project exists to make meaningful charitable contributions to local poverty-stricken families and their young children. Ongoing donations are made by means of clothing, food, educational tools such as toys, a variety of courses and computer equipment.The Organicburgr project also helps organise and cover the cost of adventure days out such as visits to the Zoo, short trips and various sports events.
Driving force of change. Everyday.
The concept of the Organicburgr project is built upon force of change to improve knowledge of food consumption, individual ingredients and the impact food choices can have on our health and overall wellbeing.
Our approach
Combined with a structured, sound and scalable model we anticipate to expand rapidly to deliver the concept of the Organicburgr project to a wide audience across the UK and further afield.
Our aim
Our aim is to help families and their young children. To promote local trade, improve employment opportunities for young people from underprivileged backgrounds within local communities, to better animal welfare and to educate through insightful knowledge about organic foods.
An ambitious project. To serve for the greater good of all.
The Organicburgr project aims to motivate people every day to help one another through the enjoyment of tasty & healthy organic burgers.
Getting started
The Organicburgr project concept has been drafted and prepared in great detail over the past eighteen months.
Realistically speaking, the biggest risk is not achieving the funding goal of $100,000. Coming short of the full amount may delay the launch.
Naturally, there are other unforeseen risks when launching any new venture, especially with something as involved as the Organicburgr project which doesn’t operate for profit alone but mainly for the greater good of the community. In the end it all comes down to how well the venture is prepared for such challenges and the passion and drive behind the project.The Organicburgr project team is made up of a group of experienced and passionate people that can help handle the challenge that may come our way.
Another potential challenge would have been to ensure that our local farm would be able to deliver its fresh organic produce on time, every time. To eliminate this potential short coming we have teamed up with a group of local farms that can step in on short notice to fill the gap if and when required.

 

 
Local farms. Supplying local produce.100% organic. No compromise.
The Organicburgr project teamed up with a local Devon based farm who will supply us with 100% organic and sustainable produce such as responsibly raised beef, organic vegetables, organic artisan bread and fine local cheeses to complete the culinary experience.
The selection of fresh and organic fruit smoothies varies depending on the season and are grown in Devon, Kent and Essex.
 
$100,000.
The cost to launch and run the project.Will you help by giving $3?
 
Where will my money go?
All funds will be used towards staff wages, a pop-up food cart, cooking equipment, inventory and ongoing project-related expense such as our involvement in the charitable element of the Organicburgr project.
Based on conservatively calculated budget and revenue forecasts we anticipate that the raised amount will get the project live within six months. The quarterly forecast foresees the project to draw positive turnover within six months from launch date.
Any profit will be used to grow the project in line with the core ethos to serve healthy organic food and to improve the lives of others by adding direct and tangible benefit to local communities through employment of young and underprivileged young people and by supporting families with young children requiring ongoing support.
 
Will you support the cause?
Your contribution will make a positive impact on local communities.
 

 
We want to hear from you. Contact us today to make a difference.Our support line number is +44 20 7117 2857.
#Organic_burgr. Motivating people every day to improve the lives of others through enjoyment of nutritious organic food.

story:
Guess What, I'm Starting a Wine Bar!

  • Hi, I'm Kat Kaliski, native Texan, UT grad, Army Officer, entrepreneur and lover of wine, art, music and outstanding ambiance!
  • I'm happy to announce that I am opening a new wine bar next year, and would love your support in getting things started.
  • I am working very hard saving, prepping, planning, brainstorming and networking, but could use that extra boost from you!

About the Bar

  • Wine can be intimidating. This space will be a great place to navigate the vast world of wines.
  • Guests can pop in for a bottle, attend a wine 101 class or, best of all, sample flights which include wines from around the globe.
  • Wine merchandise, cigars, art, music and eats will be available! 
  • Join the quarterly wine club and receive a personalized case tailored to your palate.
  • This wine bar will have a hip, chic and inviting atmosphere.

  • When customers arrive they can chat and sip and swirl welcoming, space, or purchase wine and wine tchotchkes to go!

Help Me Reach My Goal

  • I am shooting for the lofty goal of $15,000 in donations to help me secure a beautiful building, manage renovation and properly advertise an amazing space for your wine tasting enjoyment.
  • This will be a relaxing environment where you can learn about wine while enjoying light eats,  and enjoying art and music.
  • All donations will go towards start-up funding costs and my initial injection.

Your Impact

  • Your love and support is directly helping me accomplish an incredible life-long dream of owning my own business.
  • Wine, culture and music are my passions. Opening the doors will allow me to share my favorite things with the Central Texas community. 
  • I've spent many years in and around the entertainment industry. Working event promotions on the UT campus and in the greater downtown Austin community, sales for the San Antonio Spurs, gigging with bands, booking bands, working in bars, online radio hosting and marketing. 
  • I  have also been volunteering with wineries, conducting tastings for Flow Wine and continually earning wine certifications such as Wine & Spirits Education Trust and Court of Master Sommeliers to build my knowledge. 
  • With your help, next year I will be blending  fun events with great wine tastings. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Sharing is caring.
  • If you know someone who may be willing to support, use the Indiegogo share tools to enable other possible donors to contribute.
  • Whether you contribute financially or not, your support matters!
story_txt:
Guess What, I'm Starting a Wine Bar!  Hi, I'm Kat Kaliski, native Texan, UT grad, Army Officer, entrepreneur and lover of wine, art, music and outstanding ambiance! I'm happy to announce that I am opening a new wine bar next year, and would love your support in getting things started. I am working very hard saving, prepping, planning, brainstorming and networking, but could use that extra boost from you!
   About the Bar

Wine can be intimidating. This space will be a great place to navigate the vast world of wines.

Guests can pop in for a bottle, attend a wine 101 class or, best of all, sample flights which include wines from around the globe.

Wine merchandise, cigars, art, music and eats will be available! 
Join the quarterly wine club and receive a personalized case tailored to your palate.
This wine bar will have a hip, chic and inviting atmosphere.
When customers arrive they can chat and sip and swirl welcoming, space, or purchase wine and wine tchotchkes to go!

Help Me Reach My Goal  I am shooting for the lofty goal of $15,000 in donations to help me secure a beautiful building, manage renovation and properly advertise an amazing space for your wine tasting enjoyment.
This will be a relaxing environment where you can learn about wine while enjoying light eats,  and enjoying art and music. All donations will go towards start-up funding costs and my initial injection.    Your Impact  Your love and support is directly helping me accomplish an incredible life-long dream of owning my own business.
Wine, culture and music are my passions. Opening the doors will allow me to share my favorite things with the Central Texas community.  I've spent many years in and around the entertainment industry. Working event promotions on the UT campus and in the greater downtown Austin community, sales for the San Antonio Spurs, gigging with bands, booking bands, working in bars, online radio hosting and marketing. 
I  have also been volunteering with wineries, conducting tastings for Flow Wine and continually earning wine certifications such as Wine & Spirits Education Trust and Court of Master Sommeliers to build my knowledge. 
With your help, next year I will be blending  fun events with great wine tastings. 


    Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing is caring.

If you know someone who may be willing to support, use the Indiegogo share tools to enable other possible donors to contribute.

Whether you contribute financially or not, your support matters!

story:
Management Team

Arzu Altinay : Entrepreneur, tourism professional, tour guide, owner of Istanbul's premier walking tour company.  We organise and lead the most impressive series of walks in Istanbul.
I have full command of the market with 18 years of experience.

Tour Guides: 

I create business for 11 tour guides in Istanbul who are scholarly, experienced and local. 

The Campaign:

I want to expand this knowledge and experience into cities across Europe : Rome / Florence / Venice / Amsterdam / Athens / Jerusalem. 

I already have contracts with my local guides in the first 6 cities.  The content of the website is ready and I've written all the itineraries. 

I am looking for a 12 month funding to start new company, launch the new website walksineurope and start its marketing campaign across the 6 cities.

Customer Problem

Difficulty contacting scholarly and local guides in destination. 
Lose time souring the web to find professionally planned walking tours. 
Cost of private tours for a thematic and in depth experience is a concern. 
Difficulty in pre-planning with confidence to find perfect match of itineraries and guides.

Products & Services

Online solution to pre-book perfect walking tours without the hassle. 
It delivers personalized, relevant and contextualized activities content. 
Simple search matching dates and theme in cities across Europe. 
Read reviews. 
Find the perfect match of local guides and date. 
Book online-with a deposit. 
No need to worry about minimums or over booking. 
Get online voucher. 
It's efficient, easy and affordable.

Customer Segments

Free, individual travellers who pre-book online. 
Private tours. 
Small group shared tours,max 8. 
Shore excursions. 
Pre and post cruise ships. 
Business travellers who have free time to discover. 
Families with kids. 
Senior travelers. 
People who like to have a social experience in a new city and mingle with locals.

Sales & Marketing Strategy

Online app to book on the go 
Web site with excellent SEO 
Direct email to all previous clients 
ITB and WTM travel shows 
Hotels and travel agents ( B2B) 
Affiliates( Viator,Expedia, Musement,Get Your Guide) 
Google Adwords 
FB ads 
Local tour/guide associations 
Trip Advisor Reviews

Competitors

The travel activities landscape is dominated by small providers. Activity providers typically lack the resources and/or expertise to implement advanced distribution technologies. 
Aggregators include segment pioneer Viator.

Online: 
Viator 
Trip Advisor via Viator 
Get Your Guide 
Musement 
Touriocity

Offline: 
Context 
Traditional travel agents in destination

Competitive Advantage

Unique expertise, full command of market and clients. 
Pioneer of walking tours in a high frequency tourist destination. 
Can create unique and high quality tour content. 
Ease of use. 
Compare itineraries and book directly online. 
Private or small group shared tours. 
Browse best selection of guides 
Guide incentive with online pre-bookings.
